Name: Book 1

text: I stubbed my toe on a root, one of the pitfalls of living in a tree.
Name: Book 1

text: It throbbed and I slammed the door in frustration as I left the tree.
Name: Book 1

text: It only took a moment to realize what Id done.
Name: Book 1

text: I picked up the pace as Aunt Fannies curses came screaming through the closed door.
Name: Book 1

text: She was determined not to let me forget what a burden it had been to take me in, even if it used every spare ounce of energy to do it.
Name: Book 1

text: My mouth twisted, and I shifted into a run until I reached the little outcropping of rock on the west side of the village.
Name: Book 1

text: I was still thinking about it when I slowed to climb through the tangle of brush in back of Junnies house, but once my fingers trailed the cool rock surrounding the structure, it fell away.
Name: Book 1

text: When it felt as if I could breathe again, I rapped two quick knocks and then one loud knock on the small wooden door.
Name: Book 1

text: It was the one sure way shed know it was me.
Name: Book 1

text: A wisp of bright blonde hair swirled around Junnies shining eyes as the door swung open, and I decided I must have caught her working; she looked flustered.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie was older than I, but remained striking with the blonde hair, blue eyes, and thin features that seemed to be standard-issue among the village elves.
Name: Book 1

text: The Council had assigned her as my tutor, citing my advanced age as the reason I couldnt learn with the others, but I suspected it was my stunning lack of ability that had landed me here.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie brushed a lock of hair aside.
Name: Book 1

text: There you are, my Fredora.
Name: Book 1

text: She was always trying out new nicknames for me.
Name: Book 1

text: It was no secret I despised my given name: Elfreda Georgiana Suzetta Glaforia.
Name: Book 1

text: I decided, not for the first time, my father must have been a drunken imp.
Name: Book 1

text: Not that I could remember him, but I could definitely blame him because the father was always responsible for naming the firstborn.
Name: Book 1

text: It wasnt as if you could get more unoriginal than using the ancient word meaning elf, but he certainly hadnt needed to follow it with a string of ridiculous, floweryI stopped mid-thought, realizing my tutor was watching me.
Name: Book 1

text: Hey, Junnie, I said, forcing a smile.
Name: Book 1

text: Whats on the schedule for today.
Name: Book 1

text: She smiled in return, straightening the deep blue sash that tied her tunic.
Name: Book 1

text: How do you feel about studying the lineages.
Name: Book 1

text: She knew I hated trying to memorize endless pages of names and dates, and didnt seem surprised by my groan of complaint.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, lets get to it then, she said, leading me through the tiny living area toward the back room.
Name: Book 1

text: She didnt have or need a great deal of space.
Name: Book 1

text: Much like me, Junnie was practically alone.
Name: Book 1

text: Her family had all received the calling to serve elfkind.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know exactly what that meant, only that the elf usually left with fanfare and seldom returned in fewer than a hundred years.
Name: Book 1

text: It was apparently a very honorable thing, though she never seemed proud.
Name: Book 1

text: Just off the living area was the study, larger than the front room, stuffed full of documents and lit by a pair of dim oil lanterns.
Name: Book 1

text: Dust covered the decrepit scrolls and books lining the walls, but aside from a well-used worktable, the room was clean.
Name: Book 1

text: Settling onto my usual stool, I leaned forward, elbows on the carved edge of the table to prop my head up for the monotonous hours to come.
Name: Book 1

text: It was hard to say how long I sat so, looking down on a huge volume entitled The Great Elves of Varkenshire, pretending to read.
Name: Book 1

text: But my eyes had wandered from the page to a small thistle where it rested among some other potion ingredients.
Name: Book 1

text: It had begun to extend its leaves.
Name: Book 1

text: I was startled; Junnie was preoccupied with a lengthy scroll across the room and couldnt have possibly been the source, and I had never made anything grow.
Name: Book 1

text: I concentrated on the thistle then, eyeing each tiny spike.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew the magic, though it had never worked for me before.
Name: Book 1

text: To my surprise, the leaves turned up and the head began to turn green.
Name: Book 1

text: The stem reached out new roots and new buds began to form.
Name: Book 1

text: What did you find.
Name: Book 1

text: No, I was just there was a thistle here.
Name: Book 1

text: It was all that had developed, the bulbs and seedlings were undisturbed, and I couldnt help but think, Oh, sure, the weed grows.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie was across the room in a flash.
Name: Book 1

text: She glanced at the changed thistle and then, briefly, me, but when I tried to meet her gaze, it shifted to the wall of books.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, good for you, Frey.
Name: Book 1

text: Your efforts are finally paying off.
Name: Book 1

text: I stared blankly at her.
Name: Book 1

text: What do you say we wrap it up for today.
Name: Book 1

text: Ive got some business with Council.
Name: Book 1

text: I stumbled off the stool, half numb from being still so long, and made my way outside into the warm sun, unsure of my direction.
Name: Book 1

text: The idea of lingering within sight of the village center didnt have much appeal, but I was in no hurry to get back home to Fannie.
Name: Book 1

text: Choosing instead a rambling, rarely used path out of the village, I found myself wandering idly through the trees and, eventually, into an abandoned, overgrown garden, where I tried to work out what to do with my now empty afternoon.
Name: Book 1

text: Sitting surrounded by the various weeds, my tutor might have urged me to do something useful, like identify the species, but she wasnt here, and I couldnt help but attempt to repeat the process Id used on the thistle in her study.
Name: Book 1

text: Id been warned not to practice without supervision, but the field felt alone as I concentrated on one weed and then on each of the others, spinning my charms in an attempt to develop them.
Name: Book 1

text: I had no luck with the wild flowers and renegade vegetable plants, but a small thorn tree and a couple of noxious strains began to mature in response to the magic.
Name: Book 1

text: All this time, Id thought something was broken in me, that something had happened when Id lost my mother, but maybe Junnie was right.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe Id just needed to get my focus, to work until it came through.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, well, what do we have here.
Name: Book 1

text: Is Elfreda making magic.
Name: Book 1

text: Evelyns sourness burned through me.
Name: Book 1

text: It took everything I had to curb my reply, keep myself out of trouble.
Name: Book 1

text: Oh, uh, I didnt realize is this your.
Name: Book 1

text: I was struggling to answer.
Name: Book 1

text: This wasnt her field.
Name: Book 1

text: The forest and surrounding meadows didnt belong to anyone, only an elfs home was theirs.
Name: Book 1

text: But I knew from past experience Evelyn would punish me for being here when she happened along.
Name: Book 1

text: Sure, not physicallyno elf did that.
Name: Book 1

text: But I could just imagine the way perfect little Evelyn would repeat the story in town.
Name: Book 1

text: Poor Elfreda, sitting alone in the weeds, couldnt even make grass grow.
Name: Book 1

text: What can we do to help her.
Name: Book 1

text: We should have a Council meeting on it, Im sure.
Name: Book 1

text: I stayed where I sat, forcing my eyes to the ground.
Name: Book 1

text: But then I pictured the smirk on her face as she mocked me to the villagers, to Council, and couldnt stop the resentment from boiling up.
Name: Book 1

text: My ears rang with it.
Name: Book 1

text: I glanced up at Evelyn through the jagged line of my bangs.
Name: Book 1

text: A a choo.
Name: Book 1

text: she wheezed.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt help it.
Name: Book 1

text: Evelyn shot a glower at me.
Name: Book 1

text: And then she whirled, storming away, and as she glanced back, her parting expression was so priceless I wished I could see it again.
Name: Book 1

text: My ears popped as I burst out with laughter.
Name: Book 1

text: Evelyn began to run toward town and I couldnt stifle it, despite the fact that it was absurd something as insignificant as a sneeze would give me such pleasure.
Name: Book 1

text: I wondered briefly how Id delight in a choking fit and then tugged the lobe of my ear as it popped again.
Name: Book 1

text: Apparently I wasnt used to laughing.
Name: Book 1

text: I strode off toward home, taking the long route despite my good humor.
Name: Book 1

text: As I approached the old tree, its twisted and gnarled limbs reaching into a cloudless gray sky, I caught sight of an aged elf leaving.
Name: Book 1

text: My stomach dropped; it was a Council member.
Name: Book 1

text: Tassels hung around his neck depicting lines and accomplishments: sky blue for receiving the calling, deep crimson for service to the guard.
Name: Book 1

text: His chest bore a personalized crest, an oak leaf on an unbroken shield of gold and acorn brown.
Name: Book 1

text: I watched from the trees as a rainbow of a half dozen tassels fluttered behind him where he rushed down the path toward the village.
Name: Book 1

text: When I walked through the door, I saw immediately Fannie had not expected company.
Name: Book 1

text: The telltale signs of a hurried cleaning spell were everywhere.
Name: Book 1

text: I slipped into one of the low chairs to enjoy a bowl of berries set out for company under the guise of politeness.
Name: Book 1

text: We didnt often have visitors, and I could count on a new spruce twig the times wed had fresh berries.
Name: Book 1

text: Might as well enjoy them.
Name: Book 1

text: I popped a ripe juneberry into my mouth as Aunt Fannie rounded the corner.
Name: Book 1

text: She was on her way into the room, having dashed back to her stash of wine as soon as the visitor had hit the door.
Name: Book 1

text: She peered at me out of the corner of her eye, twisting the cork free of the bottle.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe it annoyed her to see I was eating her berries.
Name: Book 1

text: Not that shed picked them; I was sure shed just set a charm on an unsuspecting squirrel to make it perform her manual labor.
Name: Book 1

text: I was enjoying the bitterness of a spireberry now.
Name: Book 1

text: It seems there was some trouble in town today, she said.
Name: Book 1

text: The elders are in an uproar.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt question any further.
Name: Book 1

text: Town trouble was usually of no interest to me.
Name: Book 1

text: Actually, I couldnt think of the last time the town had had trouble.
Name: Book 1

text: She huffed and I knew it was best to indulge her.
Name: Book 1

text: What sort of trouble.
Name: Book 1

text: Apparently, Evelyn of Rothegarr came into town from the meadows at full speed wheezing and sneezing.
Name: Book 1

text: She reached the village center, grabbed her throat, and fell to the ground without a breath.
Name: Book 1

text: I stopped chewing, my mouth gone dry.
Name: Book 1

text: Fannie continued, They found a common thistle caught in her airway.
Name: Book 1

text: My stomach curled into knots.
Name: Book 1

text: I whispered, A thistle.
Name: Book 1

text: Mmm.
Name: Book 1

text: Council thinks she must have been working a spell that went awry.
Name: Book 1

text: Fannie peered at me; I might have turned pale.
Name: Book 1

text: She threw the cork at me.
Name: Book 1

text: Hard.
Name: Book 1

text: I must have quit breathing because when I drew in a breath, it was sharp in my lungs.
Name: Book 1

text: My thoughts twisted, but Aunt Fannie wore a mean grin.
Name: Book 1

text: I asked, my voice barely audible.
Name: Book 1

text: She was enjoying knowing something I didnt, dragging it out.
Name: Book 1

text: When I glared at her, she shrugged.
Name: Book 1

text: The Council was just able to save her in time.
Name: Book 1

text: Almost couldnt find the right words to turn the spell.
Name: Book 1

text: The pain escaped my lungs in a rush.
Name: Book 1

text: Fannie continued to talk, probably berating me for looking so dumbfounded.
Name: Book 1

text: But I was oblivious; my mind was doing somersaults like a pixie on sweet pea.
Name: Book 1

text: All I could think was, Impossible.
Name: Book 1

text: And then the questions.
Name: Book 1

text: Had the Council known shed gone running because I laughed at her.
Name: Book 1

text: Had the thistle grown as she stood beside me.
Name: Book 1

text: Was that what had caused the sneezing.
Name: Book 1

text: Evelyn would tell them I was there.
Name: Book 1

text: They would come for me.
Name: Book 1

text: There would be another inquisition.
Name: Book 1

text: What had the Council member told Fannie.
Name: Book 1

text: He must have known I was a witness, why else would he have been there.
Name: Book 1

text: I could still see the anger on her face.
Name: Book 1

text: She would accuse me, I was sure.
Name: Book 1

text: Somehow, Evelyn would make this my fault.
Name: Book 1

text: Fannie hissed, leaning over to glare at me.
Name: Book 1

text: I jerked back to reality, no idea what shed been saying.
Name: Book 1

text: Where were you during the commotion.
Name: Book 1

text: she repeated.
Name: Book 1

text: Id think if you were at Junnies, youd have known all about it.
Name: Book 1

text: Why didnt you warn me.
Name: Book 1

text: My mouth opened and closed.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, I said, Junnie sent me home early because I learned a spell.
Name: Book 1

text: Fannie looked incredulous, so I backpedaled.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, not a spell, but I grew a flower.
Name: Book 1

text: And then I was so excited I was going to run home and tell you but I took the back way and then.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, and then I got lost.
Name: Book 1

text: Aunt Fannie was incensed, her curses flying out in a rant that felt as if it would never end.
Name: Book 1

text: The years of listening to it seemed to coalesce, and I was suddenly exhausted.
Name: Book 1

text: I think Ill go lie down.
Name: Book 1

text: Do you think you can just sleep when you want to sleep.
Name: Book 1

text: Whose tree do you think this is.
Name: Book 1

text: Youll lie down when I say youll lie down.
Name: Book 1

text: I bit down on a groan, eyes running over the wood grain of the table as I tuned her out.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew the outcome if I didnt, and I was already in trouble enough.
Name: Book 1

text: Shortly after her tirade insisting I stay until I had earned permission to leave, the one-sided argument ran its course and Fannie tired of looking at me and sent me on my way.
Name: Book 1

text: I trudged out of the kitchen, through the main sitting area, and into my room.
Name: Book 1

text: It was dark except for a small beam of light from a knothole in the wall.
Name: Book 1

text: Fire was the one magic I had mastered; I had been able to light lanterns and candles for as long as I could remember, but I didnt bother.
Name: Book 1

text: If I was in this room, I wanted to be alone.
Name: Book 1

text: And in darkness I felt more so.
Name: Book 1

text: I was usually a late sleeper, but the next morning I was out of the house early.
Name: Book 1

text: I wanted to get away before I had to face Fannie in the middle of her wine hangover, and I knew Junnie could tell me if Evelyn had turned the town or Council against me.
Name: Book 1

text: I rushed up the path and through the village gate, keeping my head down.
Name: Book 1

text: No one generally went out of their way to speak to me, but I didnt want to take any chances.
Name: Book 1

text: The other elves didnt have much use for one who wasnt able to contribute.
Name: Book 1

text: My lack of magic and skill had put me far from their minds.
Name: Book 1

text: Except in the case of Evelyn, who sought to raise herself by lowering me, but always with such a thick coating of sweetness.
Name: Book 1

text: And it didnt help that I couldnt pull off the polish or cheer of the other elves.
Name: Book 1

text: I slipped around the village and through Junnies back yard, darting past a trellis toward the door.
Name: Book 1

text: As I ducked under the hanging ivy, I caught my foot on a vine and stumbled forward, cursing as I nearly ran into a boulder.
Name: Book 1

text: A boulder wearing a shirt.
Name: Book 1

text: Gradually, my head tilted upward, and I blew my too-long bangs aside to peer up first at a strong chin, stern mouth, and then the darkest, deepest sapphire eyes Id ever seen.
Name: Book 1

text: Sure, lots of elves had blue eyes, but bright and shimmery.
Name: Book 1

text: These were of the deepest blue.
Name: Book 1

text: They must appear black in the shadows.
Name: Book 1

text: The thought made me flush.
Name: Book 1

text: I was staring into someones eyes.
Name: Book 1

text: But as quickly as I had come upon him, he was gone.
Name: Book 1

text: He turned from me without a word and disappeared in a few long strides.
Name: Book 1

text: I watched him go.
Name: Book 1

text: Short dark hair, dark eyes, and a large, strong build.
Name: Book 1

text: He certainly wasnt from this clan.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie cleared her throat.
Name: Book 1

text: I hadnt realized she was watching me from the open door.
Name: Book 1

text: You neednt bother yourself with him.
Name: Book 1

text: She could see I would.
Name: Book 1

text: Hes from a northern clan.
Name: Book 1

text: Hell be here only a short while.
Name: Book 1

text: That brought me back to my mission.
Name: Book 1

text: Fannie said there was some trouble with Evelyn.
Name: Book 1

text: There was something in her tone I didnt recognize.
Name: Book 1

text: Shes fine now.
Name: Book 1

text: I was yesterday, I saw her.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes.
Name: Book 1

text: Dont worry yourself, Freylinda.
Name: Book 1

text: Come now, lets study.
Name: Book 1

text: Evelyn had mentioned me, but not accusingly.
Name: Book 1

text: Surely Junnie would have more to say.
Name: Book 1

text: She placed a gentle hand on my shoulder and led me in.
Name: Book 1

text: What shall we do today.
Name: Book 1

text: I went back over our conversation, trying to find some meaning.
Name: Book 1

text: Inspiration, or maybe distraction, hit me as I recalled the dark-headed stranger.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie raised an eyebrow as I sped to the study, but Id worry about Evelyn later.
Name: Book 1

text: This was my chance to find out about this Chevelle Vattier.
Name: Book 1

text: After a dozen or so volumes, my determination began to falter.
Name: Book 1

text: There were so many lineages, but I needed something on the northern clans, something on Vattier, and Junnie didnt have that.
Name: Book 1

text: Id need a library, maybe even the Council library.
Name: Book 1

text: I shivered; I definitely wasnt sure about that.
Name: Book 1

text: Even if I worked up the nerve to sneak in, I didnt have the magic to search documents to quickly find what I was after like the Council members did.
Name: Book 1

text: I would have to stick to the village library.
Name: Book 1

text: I made a short excuse to Junnie and headed out the door and around back.
Name: Book 1

text: After I rounded a few houses, I cut back toward the village center.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt doing anything wrong, but I didnt want to flaunt it.
Name: Book 1

text: I had no good reason for researching Chevelle Vattier, except I had been thinking about him all day.
Name: Book 1

text: You just met him this morning.
Name: Book 1

text: Heat crept into my cheeks for no good reason, and I picked up my pace to the old tree that housed the library.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew my shoulders were drawn in and I was glancing around too often, but I couldnt seem to help it.
Name: Book 1

text: Twice I imagined a set of dark eyes on me, a pricking sensation running over my spine.
Name: Book 1

text: I was going to have to pull myself together.
Name: Book 1

text: I was being ridiculous.
Name: Book 1

text: At this rate, Id be fawning and flipping my hair like Evelyn by sundown.
Name: Book 1

text: When I finally walked into the library, I remembered why I didnt go there to study lineages.
Name: Book 1

text: There must have been a thousand volumes and tenfold more scrolls in the main level alone.
Name: Book 1

text: And I had no magic to lead me in the right direction.
Name: Book 1

text: I went to the section which would most likely house the desired information, and then closed my eyes and concentrated.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe it wouldnt work, but I could try.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt sure I felt anything, but after a few minutes I imagined my right hand might have tingled a little.
Name: Book 1

text: I grabbed a close volume and leafed through it.
Name: Book 1

text: It was a legacy of the Viridian Forest clan.
Name: Book 1

text: I pulled another volume down.
Name: Book 1

text: A diary of Momar the Ancient.
Name: Book 1

text: This was going to be like trapping a greased pixie.
Name: Book 1

text: I sat for hours exploring the early texts, stories of the river clans and their battles with the Imps of Long Forgotten, firsthand accounts of the Trials of Istanna, and the long lineages of the eldest families.
Name: Book 1

text: A whisper roused me from my studies and I realized it was late, so I decided to give up and start again the next day.
Name: Book 1

text: Rising unsteadily, I heard the whisper again.
Name: Book 1

text: But it wasnt a whisperit was the wind.
Name: Book 1

text: Paper fell to scatter on the floor.
Name: Book 1

text: I surveyed the library, but it was practically empty.
Name: Book 1

text: Someone on a higher level must have knocked the pages down.
Name: Book 1

text: I bent over and read the closest document.
Name: Book 1

text: It was an account from the northern clans.
Name: Book 1

text: Despite my disbelief, I somehow managed to act quickly, stashing the papers in my shirt before attempting a casual exit to read them at home.
Name: Book 1

text: I made it out of the library and almost to the gate when I noticed a dark figure behind Virden Days tree.
Name: Book 1

text: He was speaking with Virden when he turned his head slowly toward me and I was staring into his eyes again.
Name: Book 1

text: Oh, give me a break; hes halfway across the village from you.
Name: Book 1

text: But I was staring.
Name: Book 1

text: Despite my resolve, color rose to my cheeks once more as I turned away.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt understand why he was affecting me this way.
Name: Book 1

text: The pages stuffed in my shirt felt like fire against my skin.
Name: Book 1

text: I quickened my pace, caught my toe on a root, and stumbled.
Name: Book 1

text: As soon as I righted myself, I wasnt able to stop myself from peeking back to see if he had noticed, but he was gone.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know if I was relieved.
Name: Book 1

text: My mind went over the encounter again as I made my way home.
Name: Book 1

text: Did he always wear such a stern expression.
Name: Book 1

text: Why was he looking at me so intensely.
Name: Book 1

text: But I had my answer: Because you keep staring at him, fool.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed to me Fannie always knew when I didnt want to be bothered and went out of her way to ensure I was.
Name: Book 1

text: I quietly entered the house, hoping to slip right into my room, but there she was, smack in the center of the sitting area, drunk as a two-day jamboree.
Name: Book 1

text: She stopped me on my way through and forced me to sit, her audience.
Name: Book 1

text: I watched her as she rambled.
Name: Book 1

text: She had the same dull blonde hair and muddy-brown eyes as me, though my eyes were specked with green.
Name: Book 1

text: After a long evening ducking her verbal jabs and listening to her theories on the Councils secret conspiracies, I finally made it to my room.
Name: Book 1

text: A flick of my fingers and light flooded the tiny space.
Name: Book 1

text: I took a quick inventory: the seal on my wardrobe was intact, my drawings were still scattered across the floor, and the stash of cheese remained on the table beside my bed.
Name: Book 1

text: My mothers pendant hung from a woven leather chain above my pillow, shooting refracted beams across the bed, and I smiled as I sat beneath it.
Name: Book 1

text: Scanning the pages Id brought home from the library, I tried to find some order.
Name: Book 1

text: I hadnt even considered there might be missing pages, but I sorted what I had as best I could onto the worn comforter.
Name: Book 1

text: I sat rigid while reading through, unable to fathom why it had me so anxious.
Name: Book 1

text: The first pages contained a detailed description of the writer, including his lineages and how hed come upon the information.
Name: Book 1

text: He was apparently a record-keeper for Grand Council and was responsible for copying scrolls and adding new information for each of the northern clans from their various local libraries.
Name: Book 1

text: Some of the information was sketchy: gossip from the neighboring fairy guild about strange activities and reports from travelers about deserted villages.
Name: Book 1

text: Or maybe not deserted.
Name: Book 1

text: One description seemed to imply the village was empty not only of elves, but all evidence it had ever been inhabited.
Name: Book 1

text: There were maps of the mountains and forests, showing each village and town.
Name: Book 1

text: Curved lines of azure cut through the page, rivers and streams, and I had a pang of regret for not studying maps with Junnie.
Name: Book 1

text: The next pages were a copy of the record-keepers report to Grand Council about his findings.
Name: Book 1

text: There were definitely missing pages here, but something dreadful had happened for certain.
Name: Book 1

text: His official report should have been factual and serious, but the description was loaded with fear.
Name: Book 1

text: Even his script became shaky as it reached the final word.
Name: Book 1

text: All the northern clans were gone, according to his account.
Name: Book 1

text: Something had wiped out an entire region.
Name: Book 1

text: The last pages were lists of clan members in order of family names.
Name: Book 1

text: There must have been thousands, but still pages were missing.
Name: Book 1

text: As I reached the end, I took a deep breath.
Name: Book 1

text: I had gotten so involved in the terrified mans story and page after page of family names, I had forgotten why I was reading in the first place.
Name: Book 1

text: Of course, the pages with the V names were missing.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt a stab of guilt for the selfishness of the thought while looking over such loss, but I waved it away and tucked the pages under my mattress.
Name: Book 1

text: Lying back on the bed as I looked up at my mothers pendant, I closed my eyes, trying to remember.
Name: Book 1

text: I could see her face.
Name: Book 1

text: Her straight nose, her gentle smile.
Name: Book 1

text: Her long hair waved around her shoulders, stray locks caught by the wind.
Name: Book 1

text: She wore a white dress with bell sleeves and a low-cut neck.
Name: Book 1

text: Her pendant hung there.
Name: Book 1

text: It started to refract light, but there was only darkness around my vision of her.
Name: Book 1

text: The wind picked up and her dark hair began to whip back and away from her face.
Name: Book 1

text: She was smiling, glorious now, her arms outstretched.
Name: Book 1

text: The pendant started to glow and the darkness cracked.
Name: Book 1

text: The wind was howling.
Name: Book 1

text: I could barely see.
Name: Book 1

text: Or maybe something was covering my face.
Name: Book 1

text: When I screamed the sound was lost.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried again, but suddenly I was mute.
Name: Book 1

text: Blind, mute and still.
Name: Book 1

text: And yet I knew everyone was dying.
Name: Book 1

text: Running and screaming and dying.
Name: Book 1

text: I jerked upright in bed, gasping.
Name: Book 1

text: My ears were ringing.
Name: Book 1

text: There was something wet on my face.
Name: Book 1

text: My nose was bleeding.
Name: Book 1

text: It took a moment to get my bearings.
Name: Book 1

text: My bed sheets were a tangle and my clothes were disheveled.
Name: Book 1

text: It must have been a dream.
Name: Book 1

text: I had fallen asleep looking at my mothers pendant, trying to remember her, and somehow combined it with the disaster I had read of the northern clans.
Name: Book 1

text: It was only a dream.
Name: Book 1

text: Shaken, I sat up, struggling to collect myself.
Name: Book 1

text: I reached up to remove the pendant from the hook and squeezed it tight in my fist.
Name: Book 1

text: It felt good, like a connection, and I slid the leather chain over my head, pulling the pendant down to rest on my chest.
Name: Book 1

text: It felt right there and I knew I should have been wearing it all along.
Name: Book 1

text: As I let go, I realized Id gotten blood on my hands, so I headed to the hall and poured water from the pitcher into a ceramic basin.
Name: Book 1

text: Staring into the mirror was not my favorite pastime.
Name: Book 1

text: It mostly made my head hurt.
Name: Book 1

text: But I had to clean the blood from my face and straighten the nest of hair on my head.
Name: Book 1

text: When I leaned forward, a flash caught my eye.
Name: Book 1

text: For a moment I thought the pendant was reflecting light from somewhere in the dark hallway, but my brain must have been still muddled from sleep.
Name: Book 1

text: I examined the stone closer and saw blood had gotten smudged there as well, so I rinsed it clean.
Name: Book 1

text: I lingered there, clutching it tight in my hand.
Name: Book 1

text: It was a comfort to hold.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed to warm something deep within me.
Name: Book 1

text: I vowed to keep it on as I shook away a thought from the dream coming back to me and headed for the door.
Name: Book 1

text: It was a gloomy day and I didnt miss having to squint away the bright sunlight.
Name: Book 1

text: Early as it was, I decided to take the long way to town, meandering through the fields and thinking of all that had passed in the last days, until I reached a patch of weeds that reminded me of Evelyns taunting.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt a momentary spasm in the pit of my stomach at the thought of her choking.
Name: Book 1

text: And then I remembered growing the weeds in the garden and I was suddenly in a rush to get to Junnies.
Name: Book 1

text: I rapped our special knock, and in a heartbeat, Junnie was opening the door.
Name: Book 1

text: My voice was determined.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, I want to practice growing.
Name: Book 1

text: She glanced at the pendant against my chest.
Name: Book 1

text: She was silent for a moment as she looked into my eyes, almost searching.
Name: Book 1

text: She was probably worried I was sad or missing my mother.
Name: Book 1

text: It seems I have business with the Council this morning.
Name: Book 1

text: Her mouth turned down in a grimace.
Name: Book 1

text: All right, it wasnt like I didnt have plenty to do.
Name: Book 1

text: Id just head to the library and try to find the missing pages to the northern clan documents.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, Ill see you then.
Name: Book 1

text: I smiled at her and headed around back again to cut through the village.
Name: Book 1

text: I took my time to allow her to make her way to the Council building.
Name: Book 1

text: As my feet scuffed along the path, I heard angry whispers and glanced up to find their source.
Name: Book 1

text: Virden Day was leaning toward a dark figure, wearing a harsh expression and pointing out fingers on his other hand.
Name: Book 1

text: Counting reasons for his argument.
Name: Book 1

text: The figure turned his head as if scanning for an audience.
Name: Book 1

text: As his eyes hit mine, I had the feeling I was intruding, that I should look away, but something kept me staring.
Name: Book 1

text: It was him again.
Name: Book 1

text: I swallowed hard and forced myself to continue walking, this time determined not to trip.
Name: Book 1

text: Following the path as it wound closer to them, I became excruciatingly aware it was going to split, heading to either the gate or to the library.
Name: Book 1

text: I hadnt decided how to make my escape when Chevelle turned back toward Virden and spoke something low, cutting the conversation off.
Name: Book 1

text: Virden shot me one quick look and stormed into his tree.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle remained standing where he was, his back to me.
Name: Book 1

text: I had to decide.
Name: Book 1

text: Walk within feet of him going to the library to research him or run home and hide.
Name: Book 1

text: I took a deep breath and kept walking, approaching the split.
Name: Book 1

text: He turned to me, scarcely a few feet away.
Name: Book 1

text: He nodded as he spoke, his voice as smooth as velvet.
Name: Book 1

text: I managed to snap my slack jaw shut at the same moment I realized I had angled my body toward him when hed addressed me.
Name: Book 1

text: I mentally cursed, but I could recover this; I would just keep going in the same direction as if I were on my way to town, because I was on my way to town.
Name: Book 1

text: There was no need for him to know it was to research someone associated with the Council.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to respond to his greeting, but felt choked and instead only nodded back, my mouth tight as I endeavored to grin with a now clenched jaw.
Name: Book 1

text: I groaned internally, keeping on the path, not daring to look back in case he was behind me.
Name: Book 1

text: I was convinced he was.
Name: Book 1

text: He wouldnt be taking the back way to Junnies as I had come, and he wouldnt be leaving the village without a pack; he was likely going to a Council meeting.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, he was certainly right behind me, following me into town.
Name: Book 1

text: Somehow I made it to the library without tripping or looking back, though I was nearly overcome with the temptation to turn at the door to see him one more time.
Name: Book 1

text: The library steps curled around the interior of the tree, shelves cut into every space above and below, tables and racks and patrons scattered about the remaining areas.
Name: Book 1

text: I found a dark, empty corner on the third level and relaxed onto a seat, leaning against the inside wall of the old tree and taking in the scent of ancient paper and binding.
Name: Book 1

text: After a momentary pause to blot out the latest incident of poor self-control, I decided to attempt to locate the missing pages by magic.
Name: Book 1

text: I had, after all, succeeded in growing only days ago.
Name: Book 1

text: I concentrated as hard as I could and, though nothing flitted out of the shelves and onto my desk, I had a strong feeling I knew where the documents were.
Name: Book 1

text: It also could have been that I knew where they had fallen from the day before.
Name: Book 1

text: Regardless, I made my way over and took a few volumes and scrolls back to my secluded table.
Name: Book 1

text: I was able to find several documents on the northern clans and even one of the missing pages of namesL.
Name: Book 1

text: I had spread them out on the table and was studiously examining them when a shadow crossed my desk.
Name: Book 1

text: I realized someone was standing there and distractedly glanced up to see who.
Name: Book 1

text: My instinct to breathe deserted me.
Name: Book 1

text: It was Chevelle Vattier.
Name: Book 1

text: Chapter Three Black Roots.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle stood there, staring down at me, as I leaned halfway across the table of documents concerning the northern clans.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried not to betray myself by glancing down at the papers, but the only other place to look was into his eyes, and it felt like that was all Id found myself doing since Id first seen him.
Name: Book 1

text: He didnt look away.
Name: Book 1

text: I had no way of knowing if hed read the documents before I realized he was there, and I stared at him, frozen for what seemed like an eternity.
Name: Book 1

text: But I was unable to decipher his expression, or guess how I should explain having the documents.
Name: Book 1

text: Words abandoned me when I opened my mouth to speak.
Name: Book 1

text: He finally broke the silence.
Name: Book 1

text: Hed used one of Junnies pet names for me.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt believe how much I liked that.
Name: Book 1

text: He reached his hand out to me.
Name: Book 1

text: I am Chevelle Vattier.
Name: Book 1

text: I nodded a slow, stuttering nod.
Name: Book 1

text: He wasnt smiling, his face unreadable.
Name: Book 1

text: I am an old friend of Junnie.
Name: Book 1

text: I saw her at Council this morning.
Name: Book 1

text: She was disappointed she has been too occupied by clan business of late to guide you.
Name: Book 1

text: I offered to help her.
Name: Book 1

text: The stranger I had been obsessed with was going to help me with my studies.
Name: Book 1

text: I melted, sliding down into my chair.
Name: Book 1

text: He was still holding his hand out to me.
Name: Book 1

text: My back pressed against the wall, and as he took a step forward I became wholly aware of how small and isolated the library space I had chosen was.
Name: Book 1

text: He turned the outstretched hand palm up, indicating the stool beside me, as if that had been his intention all along.
Name: Book 1

text: I nodded once and he slid onto the stool, facing me, not the table spread with documents.
Name: Book 1

text: Have I still not spoken.
Name: Book 1

text: His eyes moved down to the pendant against my chest and then quickly back to my face, as if he had committed an indiscretion.
Name: Book 1

text: We sat there for a few more moments, but my words would not return, not with this imposing stranger inches before me.
Name: Book 1

text: When he finally spoke again, I realized his offer of help wasnt a request.
Name: Book 1

text: Lets begin with histories.
Name: Book 1

text: He flicked the middle finger of his left hand and a thick ivory tome flew from a shelf, opened, and steadied between us as if on a table.
Name: Book 1

text: There was something so wrong about it, but I couldnt say why.
Name: Book 1

text: I pushed away the urge to question an associate of Council, instead asking, Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: It was only one word, but he understood.
Name: Book 1

text: I was asking if I could address him in the common dialog, not the official titles and formalities of the Council he might have been used to.
Name: Book 1

text: His head tilted in a nod.
Name: Book 1

text: And we sat so, tucked in the narrow space behind a small library table, for hours.
Name: Book 1

text: He pulled books between us and returned them to the shelves, never once glancing at the papers spread out beside us referencing the northern clans.
Name: Book 1

text: Nothing we studied touched on the histories of those clans.
Name: Book 1

text: Nothing of his histories, nothing of mine.
Name: Book 1

text: But conversation had become easy as soon as I had spoken that first word, as soon as I had said his name and hed smiled in return.
Name: Book 1

text: I found myself leaning toward him as he spoke, actually paying attention in places; he had a pleasant voice and an unusual dialect.
Name: Book 1

text: He wove histories as if they were stories of his childhood friends instead of useless facts, and I became enthralled.
Name: Book 1

text: It felt as if we were alone there in the quiet corner of the third level, the occasional murmur below and whisper of flipping pages the only other sound in the dim setting.
Name: Book 1

text: A small knothole made a window in the wall across from me and some light from the cloudy day occasionally came through, putting Chevelles face in shade.
Name: Book 1

text: I had been right; his eyes appeared nearly black in the shadows.
Name: Book 1

text: I leaned forward, listening to him as a small gray bird landed on the lip of the knothole.
Name: Book 1

text: Not many animals feared the elves.
Name: Book 1

text: It even seemed curious as to what we were doing.
Name: Book 1

text: I winced at the annoying chirps, working to focus on Chevelles story.
Name: Book 1

text: My teeth gritted, but I could not block out the irritating sound.
Name: Book 1

text: It broke into a melody that pierced my ears and I barely restrained the growl of frustration as I cursed the devil thing.
Name: Book 1

text: That was when I heard the hollow thud of its body smacking the floor.
Name: Book 1

text: My ears were still ringing from the harsh song, but the bird lay dead on the wood planks below the window.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle started to turn to find the source of the muffled thump and, before I realized what I was doing, I flicked my right hand and the birds body flopped behind a shelf out of sight.
Name: Book 1

text: When Chevelle turned back to me, I stared right into his eyes as if I had not seen or heard a thing, wondering why he wasnt still explaining the histories of Grah.
Name: Book 1

text: He glanced past me or maybe at the crown of my head.
Name: Book 1

text: Like he was avoiding my eyes.
Name: Book 1

text: I was too worried about being caught to feel guilty about the bird, to think about its soft gray feathers, that wing that was bent not-quite-right beneath it.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know about where Chevelle was from, but around here you didnt just kill birds.
Name: Book 1

text: Especially not for singing.
Name: Book 1

text: After a moment, my tutor continued the lesson, but his demeanor had changed.
Name: Book 1

text: He watched the book and, occasionally, when his gaze was on my face, it wandered back up and out of focus, just above me.
Name: Book 1

text: But he did not look directly into my eyes as before.
Name: Book 1

text: It bothered me, and I didnt think it was because of my conscience.
Name: Book 1

text: When he reached the end of the book, it returned to its home on the shelf and he stood, placing a hand briefly on the top of my head.
Name: Book 1

text: It was only a momentary touch, but electricity surged though me.
Name: Book 1

text: A flash of confusion or frustration passed over his features, too fast to identify.
Name: Book 1

text: He looked into my eyes one last time as I sat, stunned and speechless, my skin still tingling from the contact.
Name: Book 1

text: Enough for today, he said, nodding as he turned, his long strides taking him too quick from my view.
Name: Book 1

text: I sat motionless as I watched him go, and remained so for some time after.
Name: Book 1

text: I hadnt realized how exhausted Id been.
Name: Book 1

text: When I finally rose to leave, I stashed a few more of the northern clan documents from the table under my shirt.
Name: Book 1

text: My head was swirling with all that had happened, not simply my new tutor but the magic.
Name: Book 1

text: On my way out I walked past the shelf that hid the body of the now-dead bird.
Name: Book 1

text: Id never been able to move objects, but it seemed I had done it without thinking.
Name: Book 1

text: And it wasnt just that, but the thistle.
Name: Book 1

text: I needed to see Junnie.
Name: Book 1

text: The door was partially open when I reached Junnies house, so I peeked my head in and called for her.
Name: Book 1

text: When she didnt answer, I slipped in to check the back room.
Name: Book 1

text: As I walked through the sparsely decorated living area, I passed a carved mirror on the wall and noticed something off in my reflection.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew I was flushed, I could feel the frustration and worry, but I stopped to get a closer look.
Name: Book 1

text: There was something not right with my complexion, but what was really off was just above my face.
Name: Book 1

text: I squinted, leaning toward the mirror as my hands reached up of their own accord.
Name: Book 1

text: The first quarter inch of my hair was blackened.
Name: Book 1

text: I parted my hair in a different area and then again, but the base of my hair was dark over my entire scalp.
Name: Book 1

text: My fingers began to tremble against my skin; I could come up with no plausible explanation for the change.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie, I called out again.
Name: Book 1

text: The study was empty.
Name: Book 1

text: I let out a shaky breath and glanced around.
Name: Book 1

text: Nothing was out of place except for a thistle on the table.
Name: Book 1

text: It was thriving, but unplanted.
Name: Book 1

text: I examined it closer.
Name: Book 1

text: It was rather large, and though the blooms looked healthy, the exposed roots were black, seemingly rotted.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt understand how a plant could survive without soil and with those decayed roots.
Name: Book 1

text: I scanned the table, but it was the only plant aside from Junnies potted ivies and flowers, hanging as they always had.
Name: Book 1

text: At my touch, the thistle leaves crumbled.
Name: Book 1

text: There were some seeds and bulbs lying where the ashes fell, and I recognized the scene.
Name: Book 1

text: It was the thistle I had grown.
Name: Book 1

text: I rushed out, leaving the door open as I had found it.
Name: Book 1

text: I hurried from the village, trying to remember where the abandoned garden was located, almost running under the clouding skies.
Name: Book 1

text: It wasnt hard to find because of its new size, but if I hadnt been half expecting, half fearing the excessive growth, I might not have recognized it.
Name: Book 1

text: Each of the strains I had grown the day Evelyn choked was flourishing.
Name: Book 1

text: Noxious weeds were taking over the meadow.
Name: Book 1

text: As I stood there, frozen before this changed garden, I was overwhelmed by the scene, overtaken by emotion, and had to press my eyes closed.
Name: Book 1

text: Light rain began to fall and I raised my head to the sky, drawing in a deep breath.
Name: Book 1

text: The cool water trickled down my face, calming the heat of my pulse.
Name: Book 1

text: But it didnt clear my head.
Name: Book 1

text: I still couldnt understand.
Name: Book 1

text: A painful fear shot through me, and I tilted my head forward to run through the growth.
Name: Book 1

text: Vines, thorns and leaves turned to muddy ash as they touched my outstretched arms, wet with rain.
Name: Book 1

text: When I reached the edge of the onetime garden, I stopped to kneel, digging my fingers deep into the soil to form a trench.
Name: Book 1

text: When I saw the bared roots, black and rotted, I was suddenly exhausted.
Name: Book 1

text: It was too much.
Name: Book 1

text: It took me to that familiar, mindless place, and I turned to walk toward home, void of any sensation save the slow rain on my skin.
Name: Book 1

text: When I entered the house, Fannie was there, but I only trudged past her on the way to my room.
Name: Book 1

text: I barely took notice of her expression, her tight grin and suspicious eyes as she took in my mud-streaked clothes, dripping hair.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt speak; I was spent and I just couldnt make myself care.
Name: Book 1

text: In the dark of my room, I collapsed onto the bed, dropping asleep to the thrum of falling rain.
Name: Book 1

text: I woke gasping from another dream of my mother and destruction.
Name: Book 1

text: The rain had stopped, and the sun was rising, so I wiped the sweat from my brow and went to the hall pitcher to splash my face.
Name: Book 1

text: The dark roots of my hair were stark in the mirrors reflection, and I recalled the dream.
Name: Book 1

text: The memories of my mother were fuzzy, but Id always thought shed had light hair, beautiful and golden like Junnies.
Name: Book 1

text: In the dreams, it was black as black as the roots of my hair were now.
Name: Book 1

text: I stood there for a long moment, staring at the darkness, and then spun as I made another stupid, rash decision.
Name: Book 1

text: Slinking past Fannies room, I headed for her makeshift vault.
Name: Book 1

text: She kept all the things I wasnt allowed to touch in that room; it was supposed to be off limits.
Name: Book 1

text: Not that Id bothered trying much, because there was a large flat stonecovering where it hid in the floorthat Id never been able to move.
Name: Book 1

text: But that was before.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt sure how the magic had worked with the bird, but I knew it had, so I dropped to my knees, held my hands above the stone, and closed my eyes, concentrating with everything I had.
Name: Book 1

text: Nothing happened right away, and my mind wandered a bit with thoughts of what might be inside, how I wanted to see and needed to touch my family heirlooms.
Name: Book 1

text: The things that belonged to my mother.
Name: Book 1

text: The stone lid scraped across the floor as it shifted.
Name: Book 1

text: It didnt go far, but I hadnt needed much.
Name: Book 1

text: I reached down and drew out a small leather pouch, its bronzed decorations weathered and worn.
Name: Book 1

text: I laid it aside, reaching back in.
Name: Book 1

text: My fingers closed around a tube, probably a scroll case.
Name: Book 1

text: I had started to take it out when I heard the wheezing growl behind me.
Name: Book 1

text: The stream of profanities that followed was long and harsh; part sounded like it was in another tongue.
Name: Book 1

text: I released the tube and turned slowly toward Fannie.
Name: Book 1

text: She was livid, red-faced and shaking.
Name: Book 1

text: She stepped toward me, and I slid the pouch that lay against my leg behind my sash.
Name: Book 1

text: She didnt seem to notice.
Name: Book 1

text: The blow was quick, and I hadnt seen it coming.
Name: Book 1

text: My head turned with the contact, whipping back toward her before I had a chance to rein in the shock and anger.
Name: Book 1

text: Fannies eyes lit with anticipation.
Name: Book 1

text: Like she wanted me to fight back.
Name: Book 1

text: I had never even talked back to Fannie.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt have the size to fight her, let alone the magic.
Name: Book 1

text: And she was conniving.
Name: Book 1

text: When Id first come to live with her she had sent me to Council repeatedly, complaining of my behavior.
Name: Book 1

text: I had undergone hours of evaluations under the scrutiny of Council members.
Name: Book 1

text: Exams and trials and endless questions.
Name: Book 1

text: Black blots on parchment that made abstract shapes.
Name: Book 1

text: What do you see, Elfreda.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew what they wanted to hearbutterfly and flower species.
Name: Book 1

text: But I was so resentful toward Fannie for putting me there, I usually saw a black blob of death consuming her.
Name: Book 1

text: A Monarch, Id say.
Name: Book 1

text: She looked beyond me at the few inches of open floor, and I took the opportunity to bolt past her down the hall, straight out the door at full speed.
Name: Book 1

text: I ran from the house, ignoring the paths; other elves would be no help to me.
Name: Book 1

text: I kept running until I was certain she wasnt coming, and then I collapsed at the edge of a meadow, breathless.
Name: Book 1

text: I dropped my face into my hands, and might have wept if Id not been so fueled by fear and adrenaline.
Name: Book 1

text: Freya.
Name: Book 1

text: a soft voice asked.
Name: Book 1

text: I looked up, startled.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle stood just in front of me.
Name: Book 1

text: He dropped to his knees and reached out to touch the mark across my cheek.
Name: Book 1

text: Shame flooded me, and I turned my head to hide the evidence, but his hand cradled the side of my face.
Name: Book 1

text: Freya, he repeated in a softer voice as he lifted my chin.
Name: Book 1

text: He appeared to have real concern as he glanced from what I was sure was now a welt to my eyes, and I struggled to keep the tears that were welling up from falling.
Name: Book 1

text: Id not had a caring touch from anyone for so long I didnt know how to react.
Name: Book 1

text: And I was ashamed.
Name: Book 1

text: Fannie had authority over me, but I wasnt a child.
Name: Book 1

text: It was only that I had nowhere else to go.
Name: Book 1

text: That I couldnt leave.
Name: Book 1

text: Youll need to learn protection spells.
Name: Book 1

text: I cant We wont tell Francine or the Council, he promised, and I didnt miss that hed used Fannies real name.
Name: Book 1

text: Then, softer, We wont even tell Junnie.
Name: Book 1

text: The cold, wet ground seeped through the material covering my legs, and I shifted, fidgeting as I looked up at him.
Name: Book 1

text: I mean I cant do magic, just useless stuff lighting candles Then we start with fire, he said.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle lowered his hand to mine and stood, pulling me up and toward the center of the clearing.
Name: Book 1

text: When wed distanced ourselves from the tree line, he stopped and turned back to me, still holding my right hand.
Name: Book 1

text: My eyes followed his as he looked down at our clasped hands and a cool blue flame lit on my right sleeve.
Name: Book 1

text: Immediately, my free hand jerked up to extinguish it.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle took it to keep me from smacking at the flame, which had already disappeared.
Name: Book 1

text: No, he said, use the magic.
Name: Book 1

text: I nodded and he returned his gaze to our hands, now both connected.
Name: Book 1

text: He couldnt have been much older than I, but his hands dwarfed mine and it made me feel suddenly, fleetingly, like a child again.
Name: Book 1

text: A spark lit at the hem of my left sleeve and slowly worked its way up my arm.
Name: Book 1

text: I wanted the fire off me, needed it put out.
Name: Book 1

text: When I concentrated on that, the flame flickered.
Name: Book 1

text: It flared again and Chevelle squeezed my hands; I had to be able to do this.
Name: Book 1

text: I focused hard on the base of the flame as it wavered and then fell back toward the hem, where it finally choked off.
Name: Book 1

text: I glanced up at Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: Again, he said as he stepped back and released my hands.
Name: Book 1

text: The meadow seemed to open as a circle of fire grew in front of me.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to see past it, through the flames to Chevelle, and then it was gone.
Name: Book 1

text: He was further back now, raising his right hand so a stream of fire followed it, arcing in my direction.
Name: Book 1

text: I was afraid I wouldnt be able to extinguish it before it hit me.
Name: Book 1

text: My feet were frozen in place.
Name: Book 1

text: I could only think of one thing: Fight fire with fire.
Name: Book 1

text: I flung my arm toward the incoming stream of flames and a tongue of fire akin to a dragons shot out and collided with it.
Name: Book 1

text: Id only used my power to light candles and lanterns.
Name: Book 1

text: Id had no idea I could produce such a vicious plume of flames.
Name: Book 1

text: I looked to Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: He raised his arms above his head to construct a massive circle of blazing heat.
Name: Book 1

text: When his eyes returned to mine, he smiled.
Name: Book 1

text: He liked playing with fire.
Name: Book 1

text: And then he shoved the fireball toward me with frightening speed.
Name: Book 1

text: I threw both hands in front of me, palms out, and forced the largest mass I could in response.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle flicked his wrist and the flame dodged up and angled back toward me.
Name: Book 1

text: I shook my hands frantically, spitting sharp bullets of heat at it, hoping to break it up.
Name: Book 1

text: But he pulled his hands apart and the thing split, each side curving toward me; there were two now, closing in fast.
Name: Book 1

text: I leapt forward just as they collided where Id been standing and lost my footing while I watched the fireworks behind me.
Name: Book 1

text: Spinning into a tumble to keep from landing flat on my face, I rolled to my feet, still thrilling from the fire play.
Name: Book 1

text: I let out a breathless laugh and Chevelle joined in, though in all fairness, he might have merely been amused by my fall.
Name: Book 1

text: We spent the next several hours there in the meadow, sculpting my craft.
Name: Book 1

text: The exercises grew increasingly more difficult, but it seemed Chevelle was only toying with me.
Name: Book 1

text: He must have had experience with fire magic; the flames he produced behaved like an obedient dog.
Name: Book 1

text: Mine, on the other hand, were about as compliant as a wet cat.
Name: Book 1

text: Exhausted by the days work, I began to sway a bit.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle led me to the base of an old willow tree and I slumped against the trunk, sliding down to lie on my back.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle reclined against the tree, his legs coming to rest just above my head in the soft grass.
Name: Book 1

text: I gazed through the immense mass of leaves and branches overhead and breathed deeply.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt the need to explain the welt, and my eyes rose toward him as I lightly touched my cheek.
Name: Book 1

text: I was searching for my mothers things.
Name: Book 1

text: He didnt respond, staring straight out into the meadow, so I returned to watching the canopy of leaves.
Name: Book 1

text: I cant remember her, I said.
Name: Book 1

text: I hadnt discussed this with anyone before, but once I started talking, I couldnt seem to stop.
Name: Book 1

text: Without his response, I kept on, explaining my dreamspurposefully leaving out the part I had read about the northern clansand closed my eyes in an attempt to see them clearer.
Name: Book 1

text: I was recalling the details, her dark hair blowing in the wind, the feeling of being trapped, when my thoughts faded into the blackness of sleep.
Name: Book 1

text: I woke in my own bed, the room lit by the dim light of a single flame suspended above my table.
Name: Book 1

text: A flash of embarrassment hit as it dawned on me Chevelle must have placed me there; he must have seen my home, my room.
Name: Book 1

text: And then I smiled, because he had left me a flame.
Name: Book 1

text: I stretched my entire body, rejuvenated from the rest.
Name: Book 1

text: I was unsure how long Id slept but it looked like the sun was rising again and I wanted to be out of the house before I ran into Fannie.
Name: Book 1

text: It was probably too early to hope to see Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: Id spent the last two days with him, but he hadnt revealed anything of himself and that had only made me more curious.
Name: Book 1

text: I retrieved the documents Id hidden after my second trip to the library to find out whether they added anything to the report from the Councils record-keeper.
Name: Book 1

text: There wasnt much new there, mostly more names, but I did notice a watermark on one of the pages.
Name: Book 1

text: I held it up to the light to better see.
Name: Book 1

text: It was a Council marking and something else.
Name: Book 1

text: I dug out the first pages from under my mattress and examined them closer.
Name: Book 1

text: The pages directly from the record-keepers report all included the same Council mark plus a string of characters.
Name: Book 1

text: Trying to decode them, I realized one of the symbols might simply be a page number.
Name: Book 1

text: And the others, they were probably locators.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt like a fool.
Name: Book 1

text: They were just like the codes used in the library, only more elaborate.
Name: Book 1

text: No one really used the ciphers, you didnt need them with magic, but they had been added to many of the pages when the fairies had started tracking clan histories.
Name: Book 1

text: I was holding in my hand the information I needed to find the northern clans in the Councils library.
Name: Book 1

text: My stomach tightened, but I found myself getting up and heading toward the village, regardless of the consequence.
Name: Book 1

text: I argued with that impulsive part of me the entire way to town.
Name: Book 1

text: I shouldnt do it.
Name: Book 1

text: I was going to do it.
Name: Book 1

text: And if I got caught.
Name: Book 1

text: I could claim ignorance.
Name: Book 1

text: The entire clan thought I was an imbecile in any case.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe I would just see how close I could get.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe just to try.
Name: Book 1

text: And then I was there, standing in front of the Council building and walking in.
Name: Book 1

text: My attempt at stealth was a poor endeavor, but no one ever seemed to pay much attention to me anyway.
Name: Book 1

text: I casually leaned around a doorway to see into the next room, where a small group of villagers stood, blocking my way.
Name: Book 1

text: They spoke in low voices, and as I tried to figure a way past, something seized my attention.
Name: Book 1

text: Evelyn has been a model citizen doesnt seem right.
Name: Book 1

text: My nerves twitched as the worry from that day returned.
Name: Book 1

text: As I remembered the risk Id put myself under coming here.
Name: Book 1

text: I strained to listen but could only pick out parts of the conversation.
Name: Book 1

text: Well on her way to becoming a Council member if anyone should leave Yes, but who can trust him Why cant we simply banish who knows if the spells will even hold dark magic cant be trusted.
Name: Book 1

text: I was trying to hear them, irritated they were talking so low, and the harder I listened, the more I perceived a dull, buzzing hum.
Name: Book 1

text: And then, at once, the group began to scratch at themselves feverishly, clawing at forearms, abdomens, and necks.
Name: Book 1

text: Each wore an uncomfortable, even frightened, expression as they hurried out of the room and into an inner Council chamber.
Name: Book 1

text: I was considering the strangeness of it as I made my way through the now-vacant room, but was distracted by the sight of the library door.
Name: Book 1

text: I had no way of knowing if there would be a protection spell on the entry.
Name: Book 1

text: When I walked through, there were no obvious repercussions and I assumed that, with so many Council members around, they must not have thought it necessary.
Name: Book 1

text: The Council library was overwhelming.
Name: Book 1

text: It housed copies of all the books in the village library as well as hundreds more that were too delicate or important for public use.
Name: Book 1

text: And if you believed Fannies theories, they held secret documents here as well, things they didnt want commonly known.
Name: Book 1

text: The walls were stark white, like carved marble, and the room felt cold and empty, despite the abundance inside.
Name: Book 1

text: I found a shelf to hide behind and placed my pilfered documents on the floor.
Name: Book 1

text: I examined the shelves in front of me, looking for a match to the symbols, and found the sections to be arranged by groups, each shelf divided by categories within.
Name: Book 1

text: I walked the library in search of the section marked for either of the characters listed on my documents, and was about to give up when I noticed some encased racks in the center of the room.
Name: Book 1

text: I checked the small section, seeing immediately the symbols fit.
Name: Book 1

text: I smiled, thinking how easy it had been as I slid my fingertips across the volumes on that shelf.
Name: Book 1

text: My fingers tingled as they crossed a thin section of pages bound together.
Name: Book 1

text: I slid them out just as I became aware of some sort of commotion that sounded like it was getting closer.
Name: Book 1

text: No, not a tingle indicating what I was looking for.
Name: Book 1

text: It was a protection spell.
Name: Book 1

text: As I shot through the rooms, all I could think of was not getting caught.
Name: Book 1

text: I shoved the pages under my shirt before I made it through the last door.
Name: Book 1

text: The village was crowded with elves, oblivious to my horror.
Name: Book 1

text: The protection spell must have only alerted council.
Name: Book 1

text: I ran from town and pushed through the brush at the edge of the village, taking the shortest direction out of the boundaries.
Name: Book 1

text: I kept running until I became winded and then hastily searched for some kind of shelter.
Name: Book 1

text: Burrowing deep in a briar patch, struggling to catch my breath, I wrenched the wad of papers from under my shirt, buried them in the soil beside me, and then waited for my punishment to come.
Name: Book 1

text: But no one was coming.
Name: Book 1

text: I was nave to think they would chase me like hounds on a fox.
Name: Book 1

text: They had magicthey were High Council.
Name: Book 1

text: I stayed in the patch of briars for most of the day, cowering despite myself, but as the sun lowered in the sky, I crawled out on my belly to start the long walk toward home.
Name: Book 1

text: It was late by the time I reached the tree and I was tired enough I didnt care as much about being caught.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt even know if they knew who broke the seal, if they knew I was the guilty party.
Name: Book 1

text: But I was still quiet as I entered the house, then my room, and slid into bed.
Name: Book 1

text: The next morning I slipped out early to call on Junnie.
Name: Book 1

text: When I reached her door, it was cracked open again.
Name: Book 1

text: I pushed it aside and scanned the front room, to no avail.
Name: Book 1

text: I walked through to check the back, but still found nothing.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie was exceedingly clean and organized, so I couldnt tell if shed even been home.
Name: Book 1

text: I wandered back to the front door and was surprised by a tall figure there.
Name: Book 1

text: The elaborate robe and tassels of a decorated council member blocked my way and the fear returned.
Name: Book 1

text: I cautiously dipped my head in respect.
Name: Book 1

text: Juniper Fountain has received the calling.
Name: Book 1

text: I stared at him in disbelief, stuttering out a, Wha But then I caught myself, because I had heard clear enough.
Name: Book 1

text: The more important question was, When.
Name: Book 1

text: He grimaced at my disrespectful manner.
Name: Book 1

text: Not long from now.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew I was testing his patience, but I had to keep pushing.
Name: Book 1

text: That is council business, Elfreda.
Name: Book 1

text: That is Juniper Fountains path, not your own.
Name: Book 1

text: He stepped aside and rolled his hand to encourage me out.
Name: Book 1

text: I pushed past him feverishly, starting toward town.
Name: Book 1

text: But I quickly recalled the incident at the library and turned, heading toward home.
Name: Book 1

text: Until I remembered my run-in with Fannie.
Name: Book 1

text: I had nowhere to go.
Name: Book 1

text: A pain throbbed deep in my chest.
Name: Book 1

text: Instinct pushing me, I ran for the clearing where Id learned with Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: He was there, waiting for me.
Name: Book 1

text: The pain in my chest dulled a little.
Name: Book 1

text: Or maybe it was only overwhelmed by a new pressure.
Name: Book 1

text: I crossed to him slowly.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie was all Id had since I came here and now she was gone.
Name: Book 1

text: For a hundred years, shed be gone.
Name: Book 1

text: I wanted nothing more of Fannie.
Name: Book 1

text: Nothing more of any of this.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know what I would do, but by the time I reached Chevelle, I knew what I wanted: to retrieve my mothers things from the vault.
Name: Book 1

text: I would leave this wretched place behind.
Name: Book 1

text: I made my stance more formal to match his as I said, I want to learn transfer magic.
Name: Book 1

text: His mouth tightened and he turned his head, a half shake.
Name: Book 1

text: You taught me fire, I argued.
Name: Book 1

text: For protection, Freya.
Name: Book 1

text: Please, I begged.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know how to convince him.
Name: Book 1

text: Was it too soon for me to learn.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew there was an order to the spells, knew you must earn the knowledge.
Name: Book 1

text: If you went too fast or out of sequence you could endanger yourself.
Name: Book 1

text: There is no hurry, he tried to persuade me.
Name: Book 1

text: There is, I insisted.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know why I chose that word.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt bound here.
Name: Book 1

text: Leaving would have sufficed, but it felt like running, felt like escape.
Name: Book 1

text: And I knew I was trapped.
Name: Book 1

text: Someone would stop me.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, I was running.
Name: Book 1

text: My head swung to locate a noise at the edge of the clearing behind me.
Name: Book 1

text: Long robes two council members.
Name: Book 1

text: My throat went dry and Chevelle grabbed my shoulders as he spoke in a low voice.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt hesitate, I sprinted straight home without looking back.
Name: Book 1

text: The house seemed empty but I didnt check.
Name: Book 1

text: Heart pounding, I went directly to my room and closed the door behind me.
Name: Book 1

text: The single flame still flickered above my bedside table, and as I walked closer, I noticed a package on my bed.
Name: Book 1

text: I spun my hand and lit the room to better see.
Name: Book 1

text: It was a large ivory box tied with tweed.
Name: Book 1

text: There was a small note under the knot.
Name: Book 1

text: Dearest Elfreda, I must away without saying goodbye.
Name: Book 1

text: I am sure you cannot understand, but please trust in me.
Name: Book 1

text: I tugged at the tie and the string fell away.
Name: Book 1

text: I sucked in air as I opened the lid.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed like I couldnt quite catch my breath anymore.
Name: Book 1

text: Reaching inside to draw out the long white gown, I could not fathom Junnies reasoning.
Name: Book 1

text: But she must have gone through much to get me this package.
Name: Book 1

text: Numbly, I stared at her words while I unfastened my shirt and sash.
Name: Book 1

text: The pouch I had rescued from the vault fell to the bed.
Name: Book 1

text: How had I forgotten.
Name: Book 1

text: I kicked off my shoes and pulled my top and pants off before sliding the gown over my head, straightening the length with my hands.
Name: Book 1

text: The corset laced tight at my waist, the plunging neckline lower than anything I would ever wear.
Name: Book 1

text: I retrieved the leather pouch from the bed to examine the contents, but before I loosened the binding I heard a crash behind me; three council guards had busted open my door.
Name: Book 1

text: I tucked the pouch under the long bell sleeve of the dress as they crossed the room to seize me by the arms.
Name: Book 1

text: I stood in the center of a council chamber I had never before seen.
Name: Book 1

text: Vast libraries lined the walls, interspersed with decorated frames and ornate mirrors.
Name: Book 1

text: A great vaulted ceiling rose overhead, embellished with intricate carvings, painted in every detail.
Name: Book 1

text: Across the empty space before me was an elaborate table that seated six leaders of High Council.
Name: Book 1

text: The guards who had brought me here were standing behind me, within arms reach on either side.
Name: Book 1

text: Left of them were council members and, as I glanced right, Chevelle walked in to stand at attention, facing the council table.
Name: Book 1

text: I could hear others enter behind us, presumably witnesses, and I wondered if Junnie was among them.
Name: Book 1

text: Elfreda Georgiana Suzetta Glaforia stands before High Council.
Name: Book 1

text: The formal tone of the speaker severed my rambling thoughts, dragging me back to a frightening reality.
Name: Book 1

text: What would they do to me.
Name: Book 1

text: How bad could the punishment be for sneaking into a library.
Name: Book 1

text: And stealing a book.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe it wasnt even about that, maybe Fannie had told them I broke into the vault.
Name: Book 1

text: But they were my familys things too, it couldnt be that bad.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe it was about something else.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe something else entirely.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe a dead bird.
Name: Book 1

text: A guard approached me.
Name: Book 1

text: I had been drifting again, lost in thought.
Name: Book 1

text: What had they said.
Name: Book 1

text: The council leaders were focused on the pendant at my chest, where it lay exposed against my skin in the V of the low cut gown.
Name: Book 1

text: They had ordered the guard to remove it.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt understand why they would want my mothers pendant, but I knew not to ask.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew what happened when you spoke before being instructed.
Name: Book 1

text: The guard stood, facing me, both hands poised to take the leather chain over my head as I stared on insensibly.
Name: Book 1

text: His touch lingered and I glanced down, surprised to see he had a firm grip on the necklace but wasnt lifting it, couldnt lift it.
Name: Book 1

text: I looked to the council leaders as the guard turned toward the table and decisively stepped away from me.
Name: Book 1

text: The crystal will not be removed, he said.
Name: Book 1

text: Though he spoke only to the elders, it set into motion behind us a wave of murmurs that filled the room, reverberating up the high ceiling.
Name: Book 1

text: A council elder silenced the witnesses and then trained on me.
Name: Book 1

text: Who instructed you in fusion.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt have an answer.
Name: Book 1

text: Id never heard of fusion.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt sure what to do, and I looked toward Chevelle out of desperation.
Name: Book 1

text: He was watching me, surprise clear on his face.
Name: Book 1

text: Whatever Id been accused of, he hadnt expected it.
Name: Book 1

text: The council elders mistook the exchange as an answer.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle Vattier, you have led this fusion.
Name: Book 1

text: His head whipped back toward the council table and he shot out a forceful, No.
Name: Book 1

text: They focused once more on me.
Name: Book 1

text: I ask again, Elfreda, who taught you the magic to seal yourself to the crystal.
Name: Book 1

text: I was at a loss.
Name: Book 1

text: I stood, helpless, as Chevelle spoke up.
Name: Book 1

text: Hed used my given name, I hoped simply because we were in a formal setting and not because of whatever horrible thing I had been accused of.
Name: Book 1

text: He was pleading now.
Name: Book 1

text: Where did you learn how to fuse the pendant with your blood.
Name: Book 1

text: Fuse the pendant with my blood.
Name: Book 1

text: What was he talking about.
Name: Book 1

text: I heard someone behind me.
Name: Book 1

text: how did she know to keep it from being removed.
Name: Book 1

text: And someone else.
Name: Book 1

text: who even left it with her.
Name: Book 1

text: It came together then, the feeling Id had when I woke and placed it around my neck, the part of the dream Id shaken off as I stood before the basin washing up, cleaning the blood from my hands, from the pendant.
Name: Book 1

text: I wanted to explain, tell of what Id seen in the dream, but it was foggy and I was too slow to pull it into thought.
Name: Book 1

text: I was too late; they had already passed judgment on me.
Name: Book 1

text: The deep voice boomed with finality.
Name: Book 1

text: convicted of practicing dark magic.
Name: Book 1

text: The elders staff slammed against its wood base, echoing into the tumult of discord rising behind me.
Name: Book 1

text: I reached out my hand to plead for mercy, to beg to be given a chance to explain, and he began to list my lineage for the records.
Name: Book 1

text: I was flooded with fury at the injustice as I heard my mothers name and my outstretched hand became a fist.
Name: Book 1

text: The speakers voice cut off.
Name: Book 1

text: He grabbed his throat as the other council leaders rushed to him.
Name: Book 1

text: His choking face stared directly at me, unquestionably an accusation, and I realized with a start that he was right.
Name: Book 1

text: I was cutting off his windpipe, as if it were there in my outstretched fist.
Name: Book 1

text: I released my grip.
Name: Book 1

text: He was surrounded now, and the room was filled with a roar of commotion and terror.
Name: Book 1

text: My ears rang sharply.
Name: Book 1

text: I had to look away from it all.
Name: Book 1

text: When I turned, I caught my reflection in one of the larger mirrors, but it wasnt me.
Name: Book 1

text: No, it must be me, but unrecognizable.
Name: Book 1

text: Not unrecognizable, a voice inside me whispered.
Name: Book 1

text: My hair was dark and windblown.
Name: Book 1

text: The bell sleeve of the long white gown hung from my still outstretched arm.
Name: Book 1

text: It was the dream, alive and here.
Name: Book 1

text: The pendant against my chest seemed to glow at my revelation.
Name: Book 1

text: As I raced from the chamber, I couldnt tell if anyone had even noticed.
Name: Book 1

text: They all appeared to be staring at the speaker but, regardless, I concentrated furiously on not being followed.
Name: Book 1

text: Do not catch me, do not find me, let me go, I was almost chanting in my thoughts.
Name: Book 1

text: Out the building, out of the village, running as fast as I could, I kept thinking it over and over and over.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know where I would go, I just wanted away.
Name: Book 1

text: I found myself heading in the same direction I had the day before.
Name: Book 1

text: But hiding in a briar patch wouldnt work this time.
Name: Book 1

text: They would come for me.
Name: Book 1

text: As I frantically tried to decide where to go, my previous conclusion snaked through my mind.
Name: Book 1

text: They would find me if they wanted to.
Name: Book 1

text: There was no stopping them.
Name: Book 1

text: I had no magic, no tracking skills, no clue.
Name: Book 1

text: My heart pounded, the wind cutting against the damp sweat on my skin.
Name: Book 1

text: I wanted to understand what had just happened, but I couldnt process it.
Name: Book 1

text: It was just too painful.
Name: Book 1

text: I was confused, drained to the point of exhaustion.
Name: Book 1

text: I had no way out.
Name: Book 1

text: When they found me, I would have to surrender.
Name: Book 1

text: I could see no other option.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt fool enough to go back voluntarily, but for some reason, they hadnt followed.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know what to do with myself.
Name: Book 1

text: I had nothing outside of home, outside of the village.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt even know where to go, didnt know where I was.
Name: Book 1

text: It was just another clearing outside of the only town Id ever known, the only town I remembered knowing.
Name: Book 1
