text: I wandered toward the briar patch, finding it easily.
Name: Book 1

text: It hadnt been far, despite my exhaustion.
Name: Book 1

text: I crawled through the narrow path Id made the previous time.
Name: Book 1

text: It hadnt seemed such a tight fit in only pants.
Name: Book 1

text: I settled in, jerking a length of skirt free from the thorns with a spray of colorless beads.
Name: Book 1

text: Brushing the loose dirt off the papers I had buried, I laid the soiled documents across my lap and untied the laces binding them together.
Name: Book 1

text: I stared at the words on the ancient parchment, unable to believe what I was reading was true.
Name: Book 1

text: It had to be; it was signed with the official seal, staring back at me from the smudged white fabric of my skirt, the letters on the page as real and words as patent as they could be.
Name: Book 1

text: The documents held the details of a trial, and not only a trial, a punishment.
Name: Book 1

text: The punishment of Francine Katteryn Glaforia, found guilty of practicing dark magic.
Name: Book 1

text: Her sentence included some sort of service to council and a spell binding her from using magic of any kind except practical.
Name: Book 1

text: It had never crossed my mind before, but as I considered it, searching for proof the documents were wrong, I realized Aunt Fannie had never used magic for anything but service.
Name: Book 1

text: It hadnt seemed unusual to me, it was just the way it had always been.
Name: Book 1

text: And besides, I could barely do anything aside from lighting candles.
Name: Book 1

text: Was this why council was so quick to accuse me of practicing dark magic.
Name: Book 1

text: It was rarely even discussed and never tolerated.
Name: Book 1

text: What had Fannie done.
Name: Book 1

text: I flipped through more of the pages, realizing something was out of place.
Name: Book 1

text: It didnt make sense official documents about Fannie would be among those relating to the apparent extinction of the northern clans.
Name: Book 1

text: And why had all the documents Id found about the tragedy been separated, mixed up, and missing pages.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to sort it out, but found there were other council documents there too.
Name: Book 1

text: I kept reading, quickly scanning for something of interest.
Name: Book 1

text: My eyes caught on his name a second before my mind recognized it.
Name: Book 1

text: As I backed up to read, my shock and disbelief turned to fury before I could even finish the page.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle Vattier had been a volunteer watcher.
Name: Book 1

text: He had volunteered to watch me.
Name: Book 1

text: Swift, white-hot anger flooded through me and the pages I held burst into flames.
Name: Book 1

text: The brush around me caught next, burning away as I stood to push free of the blazing patch of briars.
Name: Book 1

text: They had set a watcher on me.
Name: Book 1

text: Because Fannie had practiced dark magic.
Name: Book 1

text: Were they afraid shed teach me.
Name: Book 1

text: Id show them dark magic.
Name: Book 1

text: Id learn and go back.
Name: Book 1

text: How could I learn without a teacher.
Name: Book 1

text: The fire died as I thought of the concern hed shown me in the clearing, the tender moment wed shared.
Name: Book 1

text: With one word, the flames caught again, burning with a vengeance through the field.
Name: Book 1

text: None of it had been real.
Name: Book 1

text: He was a watcher, hed volunteered to watch me, to keep me in line.
Name: Book 1

text: So Id teach myself, take the risk and learn the magic without guidance.
Name: Book 1

text: What did I have to lose.
Name: Book 1

text: The plan was formed: Id practice until I was strong enough to return to the village.
Name: Book 1

text: There was nothing holding me back.
Name: Book 1

text: Nothing to do but this one thing.
Name: Book 1

text: I spotted a small toad as it leapt across the clearing in a desperate attempt to escape the inferno.
Name: Book 1

text: I concentrated on it, willing it to change.
Name: Book 1

text: Its wide body started to swell, sides bubbling out, puffing it into a tiny green balloon.
Name: Book 1

text: It did not transform into that monarch butterfly I had imagined.
Name: Book 1

text: It burst, spewing entrails across the hem of my dress.
Name: Book 1

text: My head fell into my hands as I groaned.
Name: Book 1

text: It took a while, but the anger eventually faded to a point where I realized Id need a new plan.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt help but regret the flames had consumed the documents that had caused all this to begin with.
Name: Book 1

text: I should have fully read them first.
Name: Book 1

text: My heart tripped at the sound of cracking tinder beneath boot across the clearing.
Name: Book 1

text: The fire had burned out, but the ashes were plenty evidence Id been here.
Name: Book 1

text: I ducked under the cover of a large spruce and watched.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle walked through the tree line and my jaw clenched tight against a silent curse.
Name: Book 1

text: He kept walking as he looked my direction, surveying the damage from the fire.
Name: Book 1

text: I was convinced he would know it had been me, but he didnt stop or even slow.
Name: Book 1

text: It made no sense.
Name: Book 1

text: Why hadnt he investigated further.
Name: Book 1

text: Was he not here looking for me.
Name: Book 1

text: He was my watcher and I was missing.
Name: Book 1

text: So where else would he be going.
Name: Book 1

text: Before I had, regrettably, torched the documents, I had seen Junnie noted as his contact.
Name: Book 1

text: My pulse sped at the idea that he might be going to her, to get her help in finding me.
Name: Book 1

text: If he was my watcher, Id be his responsibility, and she was the only one who knew me at all aside from Fannie.
Name: Book 1

text: He was a good fifty yards farther as I considered.
Name: Book 1

text: My feet were moving before Id actually decided to follow him.
Name: Book 1

text: How far should I go.
Name: Book 1

text: What if he wasnt going to find Junnie.
Name: Book 1

text: And then I thought, What else do you have to do, sit here and blow up frogs.
Name: Book 1

text: It was all the convincing I needed.
Name: Book 1

text: Slinking out from the branches of the spruce, I crept low along the trees and brush as I followed my watcher north.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle kept a quick pace and I found myself struggling to keep up.
Name: Book 1

text: Unlike me, he wasnt dodging between rocks and trees, bending out of sight and watching the ground to keep from breaking twigs while he tried to keep from being spotted.
Name: Book 1

text: I cursed the formal dress Id been dragging as it snagged on a low-lying thicket, flinging another string of beads into the soft dirt.
Name: Book 1

text: I considered dumping it, but didnt think it was the best idea to be sneaking around the forest unclothed.
Name: Book 1

text: After crossing a few soggy patches of moss, the hem was damp and darkened.
Name: Book 1

text: I might have ripped some of the excess material off, but Chevelles movement wasnt leaving me time for that.
Name: Book 1

text: Finally, just before nightfall, he approached a small village.
Name: Book 1

text: It didnt look like more than half a dozen structures scattered against the base of a large hill.
Name: Book 1

text: He dropped the simple pack hed been carrying beside a tree and hunched down as he slowed his pace.
Name: Book 1

text: The stance mirrored mine, and gave me pause.
Name: Book 1

text: He was sneaking into this village.
Name: Book 1

text: I watched as he crept around the back of a small hut, knowing that if he was hiding, I definitely didnt want to get caught here.
Name: Book 1

text: He leapt into a rear window and I followed as low and slow as I could.
Name: Book 1

text: When I reached the last tree I could use for cover, I darted up against the hut and peered through a gap in the twigs that patched it together.
Name: Book 1

text: They were whispering.
Name: Book 1

text: mustnt let them find you shouldnt have come.
Name: Book 1

text: It was dim inside, but I caught a glimpse of a figure through the wall.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle was whispering his reply to her, and though I couldnt quite hear, he must have given her a short account of the mornings events.
Name: Book 1

text: I moved closer to the window, finding a larger gap there.
Name: Book 1

text: Were you able to track her.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie asked in a low voice.
Name: Book 1

text: Heat flooded my face.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt believe hed fooled me again.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt care what else they had to say.
Name: Book 1

text: I stood and marched away, fuming at the idea that both of them were in on it.
Name: Book 1

text: They might have been council, but it didnt stop the feeling of betrayal.
Name: Book 1

text: Theyd lied to me, acted as if theyd cared.
Name: Book 1

text: I was done with them.
Name: Book 1

text: I wanted as far away from all of it as possible.
Name: Book 1

text: But I didnt make it far.
Name: Book 1

text: Exhaustion caught up with me a few miles later and I found an old oak tree, sliding down its massive trunk to rest my aching legs.
Name: Book 1

text: Id never run so far in my life and my head throbbed.
Name: Book 1

text: I was seething with anger and frustration and the feeling of being ensnared.
Name: Book 1

text: I sat, leaned against the tree, like a petulant child.
Name: Book 1

text: I held a hand up and flipped a flame, tossing it up and down, rolling it above my palm.
Name: Book 1

text: I was hungry, but I didnt eat.
Name: Book 1

text: Too stubborn and angry to go find food, too resentful I didnt have the magic to bring it to me.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, like a child.
Name: Book 1

text: A foolish, sulky child.
Name: Book 1

text: Bright sun and chirping birds tore into my finally still senses.
Name: Book 1

text: My eyes squinted open as I resisted the urge to stop the birds.
Name: Book 1

text: It was the first time Id slept away from my bed; disoriented, I glanced around.
Name: Book 1

text: Id never been far from home and the new landscape was unsettling.
Name: Book 1

text: But when I looked away, I noticed the neatly stacked pile of fabric and loaf of bread that had been positioned beside me.
Name: Book 1

text: I silently cursed the watchers who had apparently found me during the night.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt see them anywhere, so I assumed theyd left me out here as punishment.
Name: Book 1

text: Some part of me wanted to burn the pile for spite, but my stomach overruled the thought.
Name: Book 1

text: Reaching out to grab the bread, and then, since I had already defied my belligerence, the stack of clothes, I stood to find a creek to clean up and finally get out of this ridiculous dress.
Name: Book 1

text: It took a moment to locate the trickle of water, but the creek was only a short distance away.
Name: Book 1

text: I walked down the softened earth to where the water had pooled and knelt, leaning over to splash my face.
Name: Book 1

text: Panic shot through me as someone looked back at me.
Name: Book 1

text: I nearly bolted upright, planning to flee, but caught myself.
Name: Book 1

text: The woman in the reflection was me.
Name: Book 1

text: That was my dark hair and flushed skin.
Name: Book 1

text: Cautiously leaning over the pool once more, I convinced myself it was only the dark water, a trick of light and shadow.
Name: Book 1

text: My eyes were not that green, my hair not black.
Name: Book 1

text: I straightened and held a lock of it forward to examine.
Name: Book 1

text: It shimmered in the bright sunlight, glossy black.
Name: Book 1

text: My hand fell away.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe I could just wash it out.
Name: Book 1

text: Nauseous, I stepped into the pool, sinking beneath its surface.
Name: Book 1

text: A thought crossed my mind that was darker than the rest, that said maybe I should stay under, but the pressure to draw air stung my lungs.
Name: Book 1

text: I could not drown the desire to breathe.
Name: Book 1

text: I pushed through the water, gasping and cold, struggling to climb from the muck as I stood and walked out.
Name: Book 1

text: I was drenched, the material of the long gown soaked and heavy and more uncomfortable than ever.
Name: Book 1

text: I loosened the wet corset ties and dropped the dress into a pile at my feet, shivering as I stepped free of it and onto a rock.
Name: Book 1

text: I grabbed a shirt from the pile, and then the slim pants, aware of how nice the fabric felt, how good the cut.
Name: Book 1

text: A leather vest laced over the top.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed they were tailored for me.
Name: Book 1

text: Id never had such luck making my own clothes.
Name: Book 1

text: These were trim and fit, made for traveling.
Name: Book 1

text: Not that I knew where I was going.
Name: Book 1

text: My desire to trail Chevelle had been smashed, but there was no way I could return to the village.
Name: Book 1

text: Still no sign of the watchers as I slid my shoes on.
Name: Book 1

text: I should have kept running during the night, but Id been too exhausted.
Name: Book 1

text: There was a pack in the pile as well, but I didnt have anything aside from a soaking wet dress.
Name: Book 1

text: I stretched it over a low branch to dry, and the pouch I had hidden before the trial fell free.
Name: Book 1

text: I sat on the rock, picking up the small, weathered bag.
Name: Book 1

text: Id carried it for days now and still didnt know what was inside.
Name: Book 1

text: I pulled the binding loose to dump the contents into my hand: a small dark ruby, a silver medallion, and a tiny scroll.
Name: Book 1

text: I held the stone up to the light.
Name: Book 1

text: Aside from the depth of color, it didnt seem extraordinary.
Name: Book 1

text: I also examined the medallion, but didnt recognize the emblems.
Name: Book 1

text: Dropping them back into the pouch, I opened the scroll, reading the first line of the tiny script, Fellon Strago Dreg.
Name: Book 1

text: Electricity shot through my hands and I dropped the scroll.
Name: Book 1

text: My hands felt like they had been scorched.
Name: Book 1

text: The unmistakable stench of charred flesh turned my stomach and I twisted my palms inward to inspect the damage.
Name: Book 1

text: There were curving lines and symbols covering the skin.
Name: Book 1

text: Id been around fire magic for as long as I could remember.
Name: Book 1

text: It had never burnt me or any other elf as far as I knew; it would only burn what it was meant to burn.
Name: Book 1

text: I glanced back down at the scroll, realizing the fire magic had been meant to burn.
Name: Book 1

text: I should never have read the words aloud.
Name: Book 1

text: I carefully picked it up and rolled it back in place, certain I would never read from it again.
Name: Book 1

text: Binding the pouch as I had found it, I tucked it into the pack.
Name: Book 1

text: When I checked my hands to decipher the lines, I realized I was seeing a map.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, it was burned into my palms, but it was a map.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt fathom why anyone would have a ridiculous spell like that, and then it struck me that it had come from the vault, from my own familys things.
Name: Book 1

text: I bit down hard on my lip, fighting the impulsive urge that always got me into trouble.
Name: Book 1

text: But I didnt want to go back to the village, not ever.
Name: Book 1

text: And I only had this one chance, this small moment before they came to retrieve me.
Name: Book 1

text: I grabbed the dress off the tree branchthe last evidence of me being hereand threw it into the pack.
Name: Book 1

text: Swinging it around onto my back, I started to run.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know where I was or where the map would take me, but I finally had a purpose.
Name: Book 1

text: There were mountains burned into my palms, and there was only one place to find mountains: In the north.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt remember much of life before going to live with my aunt Fannie.
Name: Book 1

text: The village and surrounding meadows and forests were the only home Id had, the only place Id known.
Name: Book 1

text: It wasnt exactly a comforting place, but there was something to be said for knowing where you were, where to find food, shelter, and water.
Name: Book 1

text: Id been filled with determination when Id started running, concentrating on north and nothing else.
Name: Book 1

text: But as I made my way, I became aware of the sheltered life Id been living.
Name: Book 1

text: The land here started to roll, the trees a deeper green, their trunks too narrow.
Name: Book 1

text: It didnt seem as if Id gone that far, only half a day following Chevelle and then this time on my own.
Name: Book 1

text: The changes here made me anxious to see the North.
Name: Book 1

text: I glanced at my palm once more.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought Id figured out most of the linescreeks curving through the landscape, mountains a jagged ridge across the topbut there were still a lot of unanswered questions.
Name: Book 1

text: My hand squeezed into a nervous fist, but I kept moving.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried not to think about all that had happenednot Fannie or the trial, not Junnie and especially not Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: I just kept putting one foot in front of the other.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt even imagine what lay in the mountains where I was heading, but there was no going back.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt tired anymore, not as I had been every day since Id been using magic.
Name: Book 1

text: But I forced those thoughts away, counting steps as I ran.
Name: Book 1

text: I was miles from home.
Name: Book 1

text: A home I might never return to.
Name: Book 1

text: I pushed myself forward through the day, only stopping when I found a patch of sweet berries and a small, babbling creek.
Name: Book 1

text: The berries were wild, small and much less palatable without the guiding hand of an elf, but the water Id gathered from the stream was cool and refreshing.
Name: Book 1

text: As evening approached, so grew the underlying discomfort with the idea of the coming darkness.
Name: Book 1

text: Not that I hadnt spent my share of time alone at home, just not alone in the middle of a strange forest outside.
Name: Book 1

text: I might have run through the night and slept at day, but it made little sense to struggle out of fear.
Name: Book 1

text: It didnt stop me from seeking out a decent shelter before nightfall, though.
Name: Book 1

text: Slowing my pace, I gave the surroundings more attention.
Name: Book 1

text: The strangeness of the land was a little shocking, and I had to surrender the idea of finding a proper tree.
Name: Book 1

text: But a half mile or so later, I came upon a suitable hollow in a low embankment guarded by the curling roots of a sycamore.
Name: Book 1

text: It wasnt a bad start, but I gathered some shrubbery to cover the entryway, the bitter stench of its sharp green leaves giving me a little more securityor at least the feeling of it.
Name: Book 1

text: The sun hadnt set when Id finished lining the floor with vines, but I went ahead and settled in, sitting so I could see through an opening in the frond-covered entry.
Name: Book 1

text: It was quiet, harder to fight the thoughts that were trying to creep in.
Name: Book 1

text: I began to run songs through my head for distraction, mangling the lyrics and humming through the parts I couldnt remember at all.
Name: Book 1

text: My fingers tapped soundlessly into the dirt, until a flicker of movement just outside stopped me.
Name: Book 1

text: I held my breath for what I was sure was impending, and painful, death, and saw it again.
Name: Book 1

text: I released the breath, which was not, in fact, my last.
Name: Book 1

text: A soft white rabbit loped in front of the bushes Id posted for a doorway.
Name: Book 1

text: My stomach was interested, but Id never prepared meat.
Name: Book 1

text: Id only ever gathered berries and vegetables that someone else had grown.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt have the first idea how to make a bow, let alone shoot one, and Id never killed anything.
Name: Book 1

text: But I had no idea if an animal killed by magic was edible.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought of the thistle, its black roots, how it had turned to ash.
Name: Book 1

text: The rabbit sniffed at the air in my direction and continued on its way, answering the matter for me.
Name: Book 1

text: I was sitting in a hole, utterly alone, and it was beginning to get dark.
Name: Book 1

text: Night bugs chittered, their high-pitched keens rising with the loss of light.
Name: Book 1

text: I lit a thin flame to practice fire magic, leaning forward as I danced it back and forth above the ground.
Name: Book 1

text: My control had progressed a good deal since my training had begun; it seemed almost easy to navigate a small flame.
Name: Book 1

text: I smoothed it out into a line and traced arcs and then more intricate designs.
Name: Book 1

text: The designs started to resemble portraits and I had to concentrate hard to keep from seeing them, so I focused on landscapes, but those grew from tiny village houses and trees to rolling hills and curving creeks.
Name: Book 1

text: Before long, the hills rose to mountains that melted into unidentifiable monsters.
Name: Book 1

text: I snuffed the flame with a wave and the den was black with night.
Name: Book 1

text: Eventually, the clouds broke and the soft glow of moonlight filtered in through the opening.
Name: Book 1

text: I leaned onto an elbow to examine the glistening patches of light on the skin of my outstretched hand, twisting it from day to night, pale to dark.
Name: Book 1

text: Weary and trancelike, I lowered my head, tucking my arm back as a pillow, and fell into a deep sleep.
Name: Book 1

text: The early morning sun streaked through every break in the makeshift door, lighting the entirety of the hollow.
Name: Book 1

text: I considered covering my head with that damp dress and sleeping the rest of the day, but my stomach ached for food and Chevelle might not be far behind.
Name: Book 1

text: I crawled out, rubbing and squinting my eyes, and was able to locate a few roots and greens.
Name: Book 1

text: It would have to be enough to tide me over until I could figure out a way to hunt.
Name: Book 1

text: After knocking the brush away from my shelter, I slung the pack over my shoulder and trudged north once more.
Name: Book 1

text: There was an abundance of streams running through the hills, and a few patches of fat, amethyst berries along the way, so I couldnt complain.
Name: Book 1

text: And the route was undemanding; the ground was smooth, nothing too overgrown to make passage difficult, none of those nasty snarls that could form from a maze of thorn trees or the network of vines that could tangle your legs.
Name: Book 1

text: The grass was tall, but soft, so it rolled over, hiding no more than the occasional field mouse or vole.
Name: Book 1

text: Sporadic wildflowers dotted the hills, small sprays of pinks or spiky yellowbird.
Name: Book 1

text: The sky was cloudless and blue, the sun a constant companion as I carried on through the days and hills.
Name: Book 1

text: Each new day was something unexpected, and the trip became less daunting than it might have otherwise been.
Name: Book 1

text: I was moving every moment of light, and so exhaustion pulled me into sleep every moment of darkness.
Name: Book 1

text: I concentrated on each step, breathing in the new scents, counting trees, anything I could to keep myself on task and the past out of mind.
Name: Book 1

text: I was counting fallen catclaw seeds when I crested another hill and spotted a bridge in the valley.
Name: Book 1

text: I hesitated, slowly making my way down.
Name: Book 1

text: A bridge might mean a village was nearby, and a village meant elves.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt want to get caught, not after all this, so I was fully prepared to run by the time I reached the crossing.
Name: Book 1

text: Its stacked gray stones were bulkier than those that had been appearing more frequently on my path.
Name: Book 1

text: Water flowed beneath, smoothing the stones at the base.
Name: Book 1

text: They were so worn, it must have been in place for centuries.
Name: Book 1

text: The leather soles of my shoes skimmed over ancient stone, the bridge curving gently before flattening out into a worn dirt path on the other side.
Name: Book 1

text: It was more traveled than I would have liked, so I swung wide, through the trees instead.
Name: Book 1

text: The wind shifted and the scent of roasting meat assaulted me, dragging my attention, my feet, its way.
Name: Book 1

text: Despite my concerns about other elves, my stomach tightened, my mouth watering as I followed it through the trees.
Name: Book 1

text: They broke into a small clearing, and there in the center stood a cloaked figure, kneeling down as he turned a meat-covered spit.
Name: Book 1

text: Pressed tight behind an oak tree, I shuffled sideways to get a better view.
Name: Book 1

text: I was sure it was an elf, male, from his size.
Name: Book 1

text: The smell of real food was consuming, and I was watching the cooked meat roll over the flame as I moved again.
Name: Book 1

text: A dry leaf crushed beneath my foot.
Name: Book 1

text: Come then, theres plenty for both of us, the figure called.
Name: Book 1

text: Caught, I walked cautiously out of the trees.
Name: Book 1

text: He turned, tossing the cloak aside as he propped one leg onto a rock.
Name: Book 1

text: I had the strangest notion he was posing.
Name: Book 1

text: He scrutinized me, and I resisted the urge to straighten my hair and brush the dirt from my clothes.
Name: Book 1

text: The stranger beckoned, gesturing to an upturned log beside the fire.
Name: Book 1

text: The meat sizzled and popped as I crossed to him and sat obediently.
Name: Book 1

text: It was too late to hide; I might as well at least have something decent to eat.
Name: Book 1

text: Its smell was unfamiliar, but I didnt care.
Name: Book 1

text: It smelled like food.
Name: Book 1

text: He reached down and tore a hunk from the spit, tossing it to me with a wink.
Name: Book 1

text: When I blushed, he smiled a wicked smile.
Name: Book 1

text: My mouth went dry.
Name: Book 1

text: He was tall and broad with dark hair and eyes.
Name: Book 1

text: Handsome too, I supposed, though I could tell even from these few gestures he was a bit cocky.
Name: Book 1

text: He reminded me of Evelyn, always so proud of herself for finding me out.
Name: Book 1

text: The stranger watched me as I ate.
Name: Book 1

text: When I devoured the first piece, he laughed and threw me another.
Name: Book 1

text: I hoped I looked appropriately abashed.
Name: Book 1

text: As I finished the second serving, he stepped closer to sit on the misshapen rock that rose through the earth beside me.
Name: Book 1

text: He held his hand wide and a canteen flew up from a pile of things on the other side of the fire.
Name: Book 1

text: He passed it to me, and I tilted it back, expecting cool water.
Name: Book 1

text: I almost choked when warm wine hit my throat.
Name: Book 1

text: He leaned forward to get a better look at me as I lowered the container.
Name: Book 1

text: He looked as if he thought I might spook, otherwise I guessed he had plenty to say hidden beneath that smirk.
Name: Book 1

text: It didnt stop him from moving uncomfortably close, though, or eyeing me with what I was certain was the same look Id just given my meal.
Name: Book 1

text: I cleared my throat, thinking Id made my sense of discomfort clear when he started to move, but he only stood, which brought him even closer.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, parts of him.
Name: Book 1

text: I turned toward the fire, tugging the pack tight against my shoulder as I prepared for a graceful exit.
Name: Book 1

text: For departure from food and warmth.
Name: Book 1

text: I jumped a little when the first tree uprooted across the clearing.
Name: Book 1

text: It was only a sapling, but the second and third tree followed.
Name: Book 1

text: You look like youll need shelter, sunshine, he explained.
Name: Book 1

text: I stared in disbelief as the trees split to form a low lean-to.
Name: Book 1

text: He shot me another wink; I couldnt be sure he was kidding.
Name: Book 1

text: The tearing and popping noises ceased, and I examined his creation.
Name: Book 1

text: He didnt even seem to be watching, let alone concentrating.
Name: Book 1

text: And no blessings on it, no thanks to Mother Earth.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed he was just enjoying himself, not being responsible to the magic.
Name: Book 1

text: Magic that I needed.
Name: Book 1

text: He was good enough, there was no question of that.
Name: Book 1

text: Hed definitely be able to teach me.
Name: Book 1

text: I started to ask, but fell short.
Name: Book 1

text: I had no idea who this was and I probably shouldnt let on who I was.
Name: Book 1

text: He noticed my open mouth, blank expression, and sat again, eyeing me questioningly, all humor gone.
Name: Book 1

text: You seem to be really good at magic, I offered.
Name: Book 1

text: Is that so.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, well, I.
Name: Book 1

text: I need to learn.
Name: Book 1

text: Learn.
Name: Book 1

text: The humor was gone again.
Name: Book 1

text: What do you mean learn.
Name: Book 1

text: Ive never, well, except for fire, and I need someone to teach me and youre.
Name: Book 1

text: I waved a hand in his direction.
Name: Book 1

text: I dont understand, he said, clearly concerned about my mental state.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe I was a few nuts short of a bushel.
Name: Book 1

text: Ive lost my mentor.
Name: Book 1

text: Can you teach me magic.
Name: Book 1

text: Help me, so I dont do something out of order, hurt myself.
Name: Book 1

text: His eyebrows drew down, coming together as he began his reply, but a fallen branch cracked at the edge of the clearing and his head snapped toward it.
Name: Book 1

text: I sucked in a harsh breath as Chevelle strode toward us.
Name: Book 1

text: The elf who had been sitting with me was now in a fiercely protective stance in front of me.
Name: Book 1

text: I leaned around him to see, placing my hand on his leg as I angled my head past it.
Name: Book 1

text: That broke his stare and he glanced down at me.
Name: Book 1

text: I watched Chevelle, still walking casually toward us, as if there werent two angry panthers preparing to pounce on him.
Name: Book 1

text: But I must have appeared about as threatening as a kitten, because the leg I was gripping shook with laughter.
Name: Book 1

text: My angry gaze turned on my new acquaintance and he raised his hands in surrender, still chuckling.
Name: Book 1

text: I take it you know him.
Name: Book 1

text: he asked.
Name: Book 1

text: Hes following me, I announced, too loud.
Name: Book 1

text: His eyes were concerned, so I let down my guard, moving to stand behind him.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle approached us, staring directly at me as if there were not the broad, tall form of the stranger between us.
Name: Book 1

text: He let me see his irritation for one long moment before his features melted back into their standard sternness.
Name: Book 1

text: For some reason, it infuriated me, and I nearly berated him right there.
Name: Book 1

text: But I remembered I was on the run.
Name: Book 1

text: I remembered this strange elf in front of me.
Name: Book 1

text: I decided to keep my mouth shut before I dug a deeper hole.
Name: Book 1

text: An arm wrapped around my shoulder and drew me forward.
Name: Book 1

text: My companion was certainly enjoying himself.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle held his hand out in a formal greeting.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle Vattier.
Name: Book 1

text: Vattier, eh.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought I heard the stranger mutter under his breath, Well, you can call me Bonnie Bell.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle waited unmoved for his response.
Name: Book 1

text: He finally held his hand out in return.
Name: Book 1

text: They shot me a glare as my giggle slipped out.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed stared at me.
Name: Book 1

text: He especially didnt seem to think it was funny.
Name: Book 1

text: Our lineage is long and we breed the best stallions in the land.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, I have heard much regarding the lines of Free Runner and Grand Spirit.
Name: Book 1

text: Tell me, is that what brings you out this far.
Name: Book 1

text: They carried on the exchange and Chevelle explained wed be needing horses.
Name: Book 1

text: I sat back down, defeated.
Name: Book 1

text: He was here to drag me back to the village.
Name: Book 1

text: For my sentence by council.
Name: Book 1

text: I listened as plans were made for a trade, Steed agreeing to bring in the herd so Chevelle would be able to choose in the morning.
Name: Book 1

text: They kept talking, settling into conversation.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed offered Chevelle what was left of the roast and they sat, Chevelle beside me and Steed across from us.
Name: Book 1

text: I picked up the canteen and choked down more wine.
Name: Book 1

text: The evening carried on and though the conversation still held a formal tone, neither man talking of anything personal, they seemed to be getting along.
Name: Book 1

text: I faded in and out of the various discussions, listening occasionally but never talking.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed seemed very aware of me, watching me in a way no one ever had.
Name: Book 1

text: It must have been obvious, because when he excused himself to check the herd, Chevelle studied me, sliding a strand of my now-black hair through his fingers.
Name: Book 1

text: It was a familiar gesture and it should have made me flinch.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe it was the wine, but as I looked at him, my anger was fading.
Name: Book 1

text: The way hed reacted when Fannie had struck me, the caress against my cheek, those were not the actions of a council elder.
Name: Book 1

text: As we sat so near, it was hard to believe the concern wasnt real.
Name: Book 1

text: His eyes burned with intensity; they seemed even darker now.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed broke in through the trees, gesturing toward the direction hed come from.
Name: Book 1

text: Ready and able for a morning adventure.
Name: Book 1

text: As he approached, he glanced at me and then Chevelle, still close beside me.
Name: Book 1

text: We can get an early start.
Name: Book 1

text: He lifted a pack from beside the fire and said, Bluebell.
Name: Book 1

text: I stood, following this stranger without question, not missing the irritation on Chevelles face.
Name: Book 1

text: He unclasped the pack to roll the blankets out with a flip, smiling and nodding good evening before stepping away from my hastily constructed hut.
Name: Book 1

text: I unlaced my vest and threw it down, kicked off my shoes and fell into the blankets, stretching happily to finally have something like an actual bed.
Name: Book 1

text: The conversation outside quieted and I slipped off to sleep, trying not to think about my capture and coming return to the village.
Name: Book 1

text: A low voice broke into my dreams of gently rolling hills and soft gray stone.
Name: Book 1

text: I peered through slitted eyes to see Chevelle standing outside the entrance, back to me as he watched a dull red horizon.
Name: Book 1

text: I sat up, lacing the vest over the thin material of my blouse, and slid on my shoes to join him.
Name: Book 1

text: Its dawn, I complained.
Name: Book 1

text: And good morning, sunshine, Steed called from atop a large, black stallion.
Name: Book 1

text: The beasts nostrils flared, breath steaming in the cool morning air.
Name: Book 1

text: Two more of the animals pawed in the distance behind him.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed chirped a whistle and they walked forward, the slim, muscular one moving to stand beside Chevelle as a mammoth crossed in front of me and knelt.
Name: Book 1

text: I drew in a startled breath at the sheer size and nearness of it.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed shot me a mischievous wink.
Name: Book 1

text: I was speechless, mouth agape.
Name: Book 1

text: The thing seemed as large and black as a starless night.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed was pleased with my reaction, but Chevelles eyes rolled heavenward.
Name: Book 1

text: He didnt comment, though, simply holding out a hand to help me mount before swinging onto his own.
Name: Book 1

text: I will ride with you as far north as Naraguah and then make my way east to trade with the imps at Bray, Steed told Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: I swung a shocked look at my watcher, who simply nodded.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed saw my confusion and gave a disapproving glance in Chevelles direction.
Name: Book 1

text: He sat straighter, leaving me alone with Chevelle as rider and horse shot past us, a long black tail whipping in their wake.
Name: Book 1

text: I stared at Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: He looked back at me, his calm a contradiction to the thundering beat of my heart.
Name: Book 1

text: You arent taking me back.
Name: Book 1

text: You are going we are going north.
Name: Book 1

text: Im sorry, Freya, he said.
Name: Book 1

text: I let you down at the creek.
Name: Book 1

text: His gaze fell to my hands, which closed instinctively into fists, protecting the newly-scarred palms.
Name: Book 1

text: I should have been paying closer attention.
Name: Book 1

text: I should have prevented this.
Name: Book 1

text: Regret was thick in his voice.
Name: Book 1

text: I could only stare at him, mystified.
Name: Book 1

text: He explained, Its too late now.
Name: Book 1

text: Youll never rest until youve followed the map.
Name: Book 1

text: He was wrong; Id forgotten my plans, surrendered to my captor.
Name: Book 1

text: I had thought it was over.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, I answered boldly, the word echoing with the thrum of my pulse.
Name: Book 1

text: It made no sense, but I didnt take the time to think it through, didnt give him a chance to change his mind.
Name: Book 1

text: I smiled, kicking my heels hard into the horses sides.
Name: Book 1

text: The animal jolted forward.
Name: Book 1

text: I gripped the saddle with all my might as its hooves cut the earth.
Name: Book 1

text: Id never ridden a horse.
Name: Book 1

text: There werent any near the village and Id only ever seen one from the occasional visitor.
Name: Book 1

text: This beast was huge and I could feel his power as the ground rushed beneath us.
Name: Book 1

text: We were gaining on Steed as I glanced over my shoulder to find Chevelle, his horse running, but not with the same determination as mine.
Name: Book 1

text: Wind whipped my hair as we caught Steed, who gave me a wide smile and edged beside us.
Name: Book 1

text: I smiled in return, but as the horse kept up speed, we started to pass him, and I realized I didnt know how to slow down.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know how to stop.
Name: Book 1

text: For nuts sake, I didnt know how to ride.
Name: Book 1

text: My head jerked back to find Steed, the exhilaration replaced by fear.
Name: Book 1

text: Recognizing my panic, he let out a short, sharp whistle and the horse slowed at once, falling in beside his.
Name: Book 1

text: Our legs almost touched as the animals loped in tandem.
Name: Book 1

text: My voice was shaky, along with my hands and legs.
Name: Book 1

text: We only train them with commands for the imps.
Name: Book 1

text: Just use your magic.
Name: Book 1

text: I tamped down an image of the horse bursting into flames.
Name: Book 1

text: I havent learned animal magic.
Name: Book 1

text: His lip pursed, one brow dropping low, the same strange look hed given the first time Id mentioned learning magic.
Name: Book 1

text: Just feel it, Elfreda.
Name: Book 1

text: I ignored the slight annoyance that Chevelle must have told him my full name.
Name: Book 1

text: I dont understand, I told him.
Name: Book 1

text: You dont learn magic, Steed said.
Name: Book 1

text: Its a part of you.
Name: Book 1

text: Think about what you want the horse to do.
Name: Book 1

text: My confusion must have still been evident.
Name: Book 1

text: He shook his head.
Name: Book 1

text: Its like a muscle.
Name: Book 1

text: You didnt think about lifting your leg to get on the horse, you just knew you wanted to climb on and your leg lifted.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle caught us then, riding up and cutting off Steeds explanation with a clipped, This isnt the time for a magic lesson.
Name: Book 1

text: All three horses slowed to a walk as Chevelle shot Steed a glance.
Name: Book 1

text: I could only think of our lessons, of the fire in the clearing.
Name: Book 1

text: It had been so obvious once Chevelle had urged me to control a stronger flame, I guessed because I had been using the power in small doses for so long.
Name: Book 1

text: What about your hands.
Name: Book 1

text: What do you mean.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed said, ignoring Chevelles warning glance.
Name: Book 1

text: Why do you use your hands, if you just think it, I mean.
Name: Book 1

text: Thats simply a quirk, I guess.
Name: Book 1

text: Like when youre playing flip ball and you want your piece to go in so bad you lean hard to help it.
Name: Book 1

text: I remembered the game from when Id first come to the village.
Name: Book 1

text: The children would be bound from magic and have to throw an odd-shaped piece into the corresponding hole on a game board across from them.
Name: Book 1

text: They would lean forward after they threw, sometimes bouncing and chanting, Come on, come on, twisting like somehow wishing would make the ball respond.
Name: Book 1

text: The game had held no interest for me.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt have to be bound to not have magic.
Name: Book 1

text: It wasnt a novelty, it was everyday life.
Name: Book 1

text: We should stop for breakfast, Chevelle said.
Name: Book 1

text: We hadnt been riding long, but it wasnt a suggestion.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt mind; Id eaten mostly berries for days and I wasnt quite sure about riding yet.
Name: Book 1

text: I suppose youre right.
Name: Book 1

text: Might as well enjoy the journey, Steed said, throwing me a private grin.
Name: Book 1

text: We stopped under the canopy of a red oak and Steed grabbed me as I slid awkwardly from the horse.
Name: Book 1

text: You may ask him to kneel, Elfreda.
Name: Book 1

text: Not that he appeared to mind handling me about the waist to help me down.
Name: Book 1

text: Looking up at him, I pushed the hair away from my face.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, well, I guess I should start practicing.
Name: Book 1

text: Heat brushed my skin as the fire Chevelle was building flared.
Name: Book 1

text: It returned to its proper size and Chevelle commanded, Sit, Elfreda.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed followed as I walked to a fallen limb by the fire and settled atop the widest part, drawing my legs up from the ground.
Name: Book 1

text: He sat as well, apparently not concerned about who was finding us breakfast.
Name: Book 1

text: Irritation rolled off Chevelle as he ran into the thick line of trees that bordered the clearing.
Name: Book 1

text: In only a moment he was back, carrying three large, white birds.
Name: Book 1

text: Where is your bow.
Name: Book 1

text: Steeds laugh was loud.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle looked as though he could be in danger of losing his temper.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt get the joke.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed said, humor vanished as he gaped at Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: What, shes a bright lighter.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle was across the gap and in his face almost before Steed could stand.
Name: Book 1

text: I jerked back in response, but a screeching siren pierced my ears and I doubled over, covering them.
Name: Book 1

text: It was inside, a screaming, terrible howl coming from my ears.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to force my eyes open, hoping someone would help me, but they were just standing there, chest to chest, arguing.
Name: Book 1

text: Did they not see me.
Name: Book 1

text: I ached to scream for help, but couldnt get a sound out, couldnt breathe.
Name: Book 1

text: They leaned toward each other, oblivious to anything else.
Name: Book 1

text: My eyes closed as I curled into a ball.
Name: Book 1

text: The seconds dragged on and I began to wonder if I would die.
Name: Book 1

text: And then it stopped.
Name: Book 1

text: I sucked in a ragged breath, then another.
Name: Book 1

text: I seemed fine, maybe a little dizzy, but otherwise it was gone.
Name: Book 1

text: Unclenching my body, I looked around, expecting someone to be leaning over me, attempting to help.
Name: Book 1

text: But nothing appeared out of place.
Name: Book 1

text: I pushed up on shaky limbs.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle was by the fire, preparing to roast the birds.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed stood beside his horse, adjusting the saddles straps.
Name: Book 1

text: Both had their backs turned to me as if theyd not even noticed.
Name: Book 1

text: A wave of vertigo hit when I tried to speak and I fell back against the tree limb to steady myself.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed only a moment, but when my eyes opened again the scene had changed.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed reclined beside me, elbow resting on a bent knee as he lazily wound a feather in his hand.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle was across the fire.
Name: Book 1

text: He looked up at me through his lashes, past his furrowed brow, and then brought me a piece of meat.
Name: Book 1

text: Had they nothing to say.
Name: Book 1

text: Had they actually not known.
Name: Book 1

text: I wanted to scream, but the words wouldnt come.
Name: Book 1

text: I was too drained.
Name: Book 1

text: And I was scared.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know what had happened, what was wrong with me, but I was certain whatever it was, Chevelle would take me straight back to the village.
Name: Book 1

text: We stayed there for some time, a fact for which I was grateful.
Name: Book 1

text: Even though whatever had happened seemed to have passed, neither man seemed in a hurry to go.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle glanced at me occasionally but kept himself busy around the fire.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed still played with his feather, eventually entertaining me with it.
Name: Book 1

text: It spun toward me and turned down, tickling my arm and then my nose.
Name: Book 1

text: I giggled despite my wariness, and reached up to rub my nose where the plume had brushed it.
Name: Book 1

text: I noticed the map on my palms.
Name: Book 1

text: He eyed my hands.
Name: Book 1

text: Been working spells.
Name: Book 1

text: Not on purpose.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, spells can be dangerous.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, I agreed, but why do you need words for spells and not magic.
Name: Book 1

text: A spell can be left, set with a trigger, or larger than your magic.
Name: Book 1

text: They are complicated and wicked things.
Name: Book 1

text: And the ancient language is tricky.
Name: Book 1

text: Definitely something you should stay away from.
Name: Book 1

text: Years of learning and practice and you can still wreck a spell pretty good.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought about that for a moment.
Name: Book 1

text: He held out a hand to me.
Name: Book 1

text: What do you say we water the horses.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt have to ask my horse to kneel; Steed just grabbed my waist and threw me up.
Name: Book 1

text: He was mounted before I had settled into the saddle and our horses took off, galloping north in synchronization.
Name: Book 1

text: I looked back for Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: He was leaning forward, legs nearly straight in the stirrups as his stallion raced to catch us.
Name: Book 1

text: We were covering distance so quickly I could barely take in the new surroundings.
Name: Book 1

text: It wasnt long before we came up on a wide creek.
Name: Book 1

text: I assumed Steed had control of my horse; I was simply concentrating on staying in the saddle as we ran beside him.
Name: Book 1

text: The horses edged closer to the creek, splashing along the muddy bank and then the shallows of the water.
Name: Book 1

text: Silt and cold water sprayed my face as we ran.
Name: Book 1

text: I wondered if this was what it felt like to fly like the fairies.
Name: Book 1

text: We followed the creek until it turned west and we kept north, slowing to a walk.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to catch my breath.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed was watching me, smiling appreciatively, and I realized I was wearing a huge grin.
Name: Book 1

text: And about three pounds of mud.
Name: Book 1

text: The slower pace gave me time to take everything in.
Name: Book 1

text: The ground had leveled off again, clearing to open meadows of low grass and a few scattered trees.
Name: Book 1

text: Large gray rocks dotted the landscape.
Name: Book 1

text: There was a haziness on the horizon but as we rode it began to clear, revealing a mammoth lake ahead.
Name: Book 1

text: It was a hundred times bigger than the tiny forest ponds I was used to, as smooth as glass.
Name: Book 1

text: Behind it the haze thinned just enough I could see the outline of mountains.
Name: Book 1

text: The image was like a punch in the chest.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle rode up beside us.
Name: Book 1

text: The hills of Camber.
Name: Book 1

text: I looked at him, my watcher, and thought his features were peaceful for the first time.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie had said he was from the North, and I wondered if this was his home.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe that was why hed truly brought me here, a much-needed vacation from the duties of council, the task of being a watcher.
Name: Book 1

text: Theyd never know, as long as he got me back soon.
Name: Book 1

text: When we reached the lake, the horses stopped and in the quiet shadow of this dreamlike encounter, I forgot I was riding.
Name: Book 1

text: The mountains and lake were almost too much to take in; none of it seemed real.
Name: Book 1

text: This time, Chevelle was next to me before Steed had the chance.
Name: Book 1

text: As my horse knelt, he held out his hand and I stepped down beside him.
Name: Book 1

text: The three stallions followed Steed to a nearby tree where he fed them small green-skinned apples from its branches.
Name: Book 1

text: I glanced back to Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: He was watching me.
Name: Book 1

text: I wanted to ask if this was where he was from, but was afraid to set off any conversation that might end with me being hauled back to council that much quicker.
Name: Book 1

text: I looked again out over the lake to the mountains.
Name: Book 1

text: If I was incarcerated for a thousand years in the village, I would want this memory.
Name: Book 1

text: I breathed deep; the air was cool, moist, and smelled so unlike the harsh floral scents that saturated every part of the village.
Name: Book 1

text: I could sense the deep green moss covering the rocks at my feet, the fir trees that edged the east bank.
Name: Book 1

text: Even the soil smelled richer.
Name: Book 1

text: My eyes were closed as I took it in, and a soft touch brushed my cheek.
Name: Book 1

text: I opened my eyes and realized he had swept debris from my face.
Name: Book 1

text: I wiped a hand across my forehead and dried mud crumbled away.
Name: Book 1

text: I looked down; it was caked on the fabric of my pants and splattered nearly everywhere.
Name: Book 1

text: Moving to the edge of the bank to walk in, clothes and all, I waded out until I was waist deep and then relaxed, falling back and gliding under the dark water before it lifted me to float at the surface.
Name: Book 1

text: The water covered my ears, lapping at my mouth and chin, and I stared upward, marveling at the size of the mountains as they seemed to dissolve into the blue haze of the sky.
Name: Book 1

text: I wondered if it would ever seem real.
Name: Book 1

text: Eventually, I made my way back, wrapping my arms around myself to control the shivers.
Name: Book 1

text: I was surprised and more than a little grateful to find a shelter had already been set up for me.
Name: Book 1

text: The idea of being drenched hadnt mattered until the cool air cut across the lake.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle nodded toward the hut as he prepared a fire, and I found my pack on a bed of birch branches, along with a pile of dry clothes.
Name: Book 1

text: As I tugged off my soaked pants to exchange them for the new ones, I wondered if Chevelle had brought both sets or if theyd been packed by Junnie in that small, strange village.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt fathom why I hadnt considered hed so easily be able to follow me when Id run from there, how Id been oblivious to the dangers of being caught.
Name: Book 1

text: The shirt was fitted to my shape but of a heavier fabric, and a pair of boots was at the bottom of the stack; it must be much colder in the mountains.
Name: Book 1

text: It reminded me of stepping out of the cold wet gown on the bank of the creek, finding the scroll, the map.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles words echoed in my mind.
Name: Book 1

text: I let you down at the creek.
Name: Book 1

text: I was distracted should have been paying closer attention should have prevented this too late now.
Name: Book 1

text: The smell of cooked meat cut through my thoughts.
Name: Book 1

text: I ran a hand through my wet hair and walked out to the fire.
Name: Book 1

text: The scene wasnt any less impressive this time, and I sat on one of the large, flat rocks facing the lake.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle brought me a plate of food, settling in beside me.
Name: Book 1

text: There were berries and roots, and a rich, savory meat that dripped onto my hands as I tore into it.
Name: Book 1

text: It was a feast compared to what Id been eating.
Name: Book 1

text: And even though he was my watcher, my captor, I had to admit I felt less alone with Chevelle there.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed pulled his own ration from the spit and sat on my other side as we all watched the surface of the lake.
Name: Book 1

text: And beyond it, mountains.
Name: Book 1

text: The mountains at dawn were so much more intimidating and I was hesitant to leave our camp.
Name: Book 1

text: Everything had begun to seem real.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to distract myself as we rode east around the lake, attempting to name the species of plants as Junnie might have made me, but there were so many I had never seen that it started to remind me of the difference rather than distract me from it.
Name: Book 1

text: So I bantered with Steed regarding horses and imps and everything I could come up with to keep him talking.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle rode quietly behind us, scanning our surroundings.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt sure if he was enjoying the scenery or playing lookout.
Name: Book 1

text: We rode a few days into the base of the mountains.
Name: Book 1

text: We had stopped to camp when, over dinner, Steed announced he would be leaving us the next morning, heading east.
Name: Book 1

text: His easy humor had become a comfort to me during the long days, our quiet evenings a pattern I knew I would miss.
Name: Book 1

text: The disappointment must have shown on my face.
Name: Book 1

text: He reached a hand up and brushed my hair behind an ear.
Name: Book 1

text: Dont worry, sunshine, I will see you again.
Name: Book 1

text: I smiled a little and he winked at me.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle stiffened at my side as he often did when Steed touched me so casually, and I couldnt help but think of being alone with him after tonight.
Name: Book 1

text: My stomach tightened and suddenly in comparison the mountains didnt seem like such a big deal.
Name: Book 1

text: The next morning Steed said goodbye privately to Chevelle and then came to where I stood with the horses, stroking ones neck.
Name: Book 1

text: Youll remember me, butterfly.
Name: Book 1

text: I smiled in return.
Name: Book 1

text: Always.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, well, at least as long as hes yours.
Name: Book 1

text: He patted the horse.
Name: Book 1

text: He smiled and swung onto his horse, nodding farewell as he spun and galloped east.
Name: Book 1

text: My horse knelt and Chevelle offered his hand to help me get seated.
Name: Book 1

text: My grin widened as he mounted his horse and he looked back at me questioningly.
Name: Book 1

text: Ill name him Steed, I announced proudly.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle pressed his eyes closed, shaking his head as I patted the horses neck once more.
Name: Book 1

text: We rode through the morning hours.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle seemed content not to talk, but I was wound up in anguish, trying to decide whether I was brave enough to ask him questions.
Name: Book 1

text: I had no idea how much he would put up with before he called it all off and hauled me back to the village for sentencing.
Name: Book 1

text: Our path became more defined, pushing us through trees and between rocks, trailing upward so minutely I didnt even realize until I glanced back and saw the base of the mountains beneath us.
Name: Book 1

text: I appraised the narrow path ahead, snaking high through a vast rock-strewn mountain, and turning back didnt seem so bad after all.
Name: Book 1

text: Fists clenched, I pushed out the question Id been most concerned about asking.
Name: Book 1

text: I was so tied up, it twisted into an accusation.
Name: Book 1

text: My skin flushed hot when the word came out harsh.
Name: Book 1

text: Regardless of how hed treated me, Chevelle was still a member of Council.
Name: Book 1

text: He spun on me, but I could not place the expression on his face.
Name: Book 1

text: Panicked, I tried to recover.
Name: Book 1

text: It still sounded angry, so I added, Why.
Name: Book 1

text: His voice was gentle and he seemed to be searching for a way to answer.
Name: Book 1

text: He must have decided I had no right to anger, because his face turned hard, his tone formal.
Name: Book 1

text: The council was concerned after you tried to choke Evelyn of Rothegarr.
Name: Book 1

text: I drew a sharp breath.
Name: Book 1

text: What are you talking about.
Name: Book 1

text: It caught me off guard; I was more than offended.
Name: Book 1

text: Does he really think I choked Evelyn.
Name: Book 1

text: I bit down against my words, remembering the trouble I was already in with Council.
Name: Book 1

text: But that brought on an image of the speakers discolored face as he struggled for air, the blackened thistle in the back room at Junnies.
Name: Book 1

text: Evelyns expression as she ran from the garden was accusing, and it suddenly seemed right.
Name: Book 1

text: I swayed, my vision losing focus.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt even realize I was falling until Chevelles arms were around me; he was quick, catching me before the rocks did.
Name: Book 1

text: He was kneeling, cradling me in one arm as my back rested against his leg.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought how could you not know.
Name: Book 1

text: Humiliation flooded through me.
Name: Book 1

text: He was right, and not only had I wished her to choke, I had been too much a fool to see I had caused it, just as I had caused the speaker to choke.
Name: Book 1

text: I squeezed my eyes closed tight in misery, rolling away from him to curl onto a rock.
Name: Book 1

text: He let me, stepping away to unsaddle the horses and settle onto a seat of his own.
Name: Book 1

text: We were both still until nightfall, when he retrieved a blanket from the pack and laid it over me.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt thank him, fearing what would come out if I spoke.
Name: Book 1

text: The next morning was quiet as Chevelle saddled our horses.
Name: Book 1

text: I had plenty to think of besides the questions that had seemed so important the previous day.
Name: Book 1

text: Id been convicted of practicing dark magic.
Name: Book 1

text: I had thought it was a mistake.
Name: Book 1

text: The images rolled through my mind as we continued up the mountain.
Name: Book 1

text: The lifeless body of a small gray bird.
Name: Book 1

text: A garden of weeds with roots as black as soot.
Name: Book 1

text: The faces of council as their speaker struggled to breathe.
Name: Book 1

text: A thistle growing in Evelyns throat, slowly choking off her airway.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles face when he had asked who had showed me to fuse the crystal with blood.
Name: Book 1

text: His expression as hed looked down at me the night before.
Name: Book 1

text: How could you not know.
Name: Book 1

text: That image haunted me the most.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed familiar somehow.
Name: Book 1

text: Hed let his guard down, and though strained with worry and fear, there was something else there, sadness or maybe just plain sympathy.
Name: Book 1

text: This is a good place to stop for the night, Chevelle said, breaking my trance.
Name: Book 1

text: Id barely noticed the day pass.
Name: Book 1

text: A glance at the path behind us showed the lake far in the distance below.
Name: Book 1

text: It shook me from my stupor.
Name: Book 1

text: I climbed down from my horse to stretch my legs over the trunk of a fallen tree, facing the mountain top instead of the view below, some part of me unable to accept the distance and height we had traveled.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle led the horses to a thickset tree, its limbs stretching low and wide above the rocks.
Name: Book 1

text: His hand spun to form a trough from the bark and tinder scattered beneath, the horses drinking as he used the same method to gather grasses from the sparse patches on the incline.
Name: Book 1

text: Movement up the mountain caught my eye and I looked to Chevelle in alarm.
Name: Book 1

text: Though he appeared calm, he was staring in the same direction.
Name: Book 1

text: A dark cloaked figure advanced in the dusk, the full cape covering every part of its owner, drawn hood shielding their face.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle nodded in greeting as I scanned the area for others who might approach.
Name: Book 1

text: The stranger seemed alone, and reached Chevelle first, since he stood nearer to the horses than me.
Name: Book 1

text: The newcomer whispered to him, and Chevelles eyes flicked my direction more than once.
Name: Book 1

text: Curiosity burned through me.
Name: Book 1

text: And then a delicate hand reached out to pass Chevelle a package.
Name: Book 1

text: Her fingers lingered against his during the exchange and my chest felt like it was blistering inside.
Name: Book 1

text: They were whispering about me.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles gaze brushed mine once more and I hungered to hear what they were saying.
Name: Book 1

text: I was fixated on it, my mind spinning, convinced that if I were as invisible as everyone thought, if they truly couldnt see me, at least I could get closer and finally know.
Name: Book 1

text: As I shook my head at the idea, my eyes fell downward.
Name: Book 1

text: A small scream escaped.
Name: Book 1

text: My arms were covered in tree bark, blending seamlessly with the stump on which I sat.
Name: Book 1

text: I bolted upright, batting at them as if my shirt were on fire.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle and the cloaked woman ran toward me and I looked up in panic.
Name: Book 1

text: When my eyes fell again to my arms, they were normal.
Name: Book 1

text: Had I imagined it.
Name: Book 1

text: Was I losing my mind.
Name: Book 1

text: My head came up once more, and the woman gasped.
Name: Book 1

text: Her cloak had fallen, her golden curls a welcome sight.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie.
Name: Book 1

text: Freya, she murmured, reaching out to stroke a strand of my black hair.
Name: Book 1

text: The shock of seeing her disappeared at the reminder.
Name: Book 1

text: Are you here for council.
Name: Book 1

text: My voice was colored with the shame of being a criminal.
Name: Book 1

text: Surprised, she glanced at Chevelle and then back to me, forcing a smile.
Name: Book 1

text: Are you all right, Frey.
Name: Book 1

text: I stood there baffled, and then remembered screaming.
Name: Book 1

text: I cleared my throat.
Name: Book 1

text: I was covered in bark.
Name: Book 1

text: Her eyebrows turned up as she looked again at Chevelle, who was mirroring her concerned expression.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe its time to allow her a few small lessons.
Name: Book 1

text: It took longer than it should have to realize Id unwittingly camouflaged myself.
Name: Book 1

text: This whole thing was going to take a while to get used to.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie grinned as she reached an arm back, her cloak moving aside as she drew a bow from beneath.
Name: Book 1

text: Ill get my own, thanks.
Name: Book 1

text: He nodded, a knowing smile stretched across his face.
Name: Book 1

text: They turned in opposite directions, each disappearing behind the trees and rocks that strewed the mountain, as I stood alone and confused.
Name: Book 1

text: I sat, shaking my head as I stared down at the bark of the tree.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle returned quickly with two small, furred animals slung over his back.
Name: Book 1

text: As his gaze reached the log that lay in front of me, it burst into an orange flame, thin branches forming a spit as he skinned and attached the animals.
Name: Book 1

text: The process was so smooth, I couldnt say exactly what had happened.
Name: Book 1

text: Or, more likely, he was becoming more himself.
Name: Book 1

text: He wasnt as formal.
Name: Book 1

text: He seemed relaxed, and apparently magic, quick and powerful, was intertwined into his every routine.
Name: Book 1

text: He didnt need to do much by hand; I would have spent hours trying to build a spit and skin an animal.
Name: Book 1

text: An old question came back to me and I asked, How do you hunt.
Name: Book 1

text: Hmm.
Name: Book 1

text: You dont have a bow, I explained.
Name: Book 1

text: What do you use to hunt.
Name: Book 1

text: He hesitated, as if deciding what to tell me.
Name: Book 1

text: I use magic, Frey.
Name: Book 1

text: He looked like he was waiting for me to be upset.
Name: Book 1

text: I contemplated his answer.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought maybe you had a knife.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, well, that would have been easy enough.
Name: Book 1

text: And Junnie prefers to hunt for sport.
Name: Book 1

text: He had that look again and I wondered why he would be so cautious.
Name: Book 1

text: Because I was dangerous.
Name: Book 1

text: A practitioner of dark magic.
Name: Book 1

text: Some prefer the meat not to be tainted by magic.
Name: Book 1

text: They feel it is more pure.
Name: Book 1

text: He pronounced tainted with an edge.
Name: Book 1

text: Tainted I, mean.
Name: Book 1

text: I have lived on it for His words caught midsentence and he said, Well, it doesnt seem to be, but to each his own.
Name: Book 1

text: He turned back to the fire.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie came back into view, a large animal slung over her shoulders, bow in hand.
Name: Book 1

text: She dropped her burden on a smooth gray rock near the fire and whispered a short thanks before removing the arrow to skin the animal.
Name: Book 1

text: My gaze moved between the sizeable carcass and her lithe form.
Name: Book 1

text: Ill be traveling fast and far and dont intend to stop and hunt.
Name: Book 1

text: I will pack the extra with me.
Name: Book 1

text: I managed a sheepish smile.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed like I needed things explained a lot lately.
Name: Book 1

text: Where will you go.
Name: Book 1

text: Back to the village.
Name: Book 1

text: To council.
Name: Book 1

text: They sent you to find me.
Name: Book 1

text: Her bright blue eyes flicked to Chevelle and back.
Name: Book 1

text: They will not know I saw you.
Name: Book 1

text: They are looking for me.
Name: Book 1

text: Terror crept into my voice.
Name: Book 1

text: I was Chevelles captive, but hed given me some sort of reprieve.
Name: Book 1

text: The thought of council brought the danger of my situation to the forefront.
Name: Book 1

text: They will not risk it.
Name: Book 1

text: They are afraid, Chevelle said from his spot by the fire.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie shot him a warning glance.
Name: Book 1

text: Afraid of what.
Name: Book 1

text: The mountains.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnies answer was curt as she returned to her work on the gazelle.
Name: Book 1

text: They were quiet the rest of the evening, but as I dozed by the fire, their conversation restarted in hushed voices.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to listen, but exhaustion won out and their words began to meld into dreams.
Name: Book 1

text: I could hear them as I was drifting, floating in a great shadowed lake.
Name: Book 1

text: My white gown spread around me in the water, now-dark hair swaying with the ripples on the surface.
Name: Book 1

text: I rose above, peering down at myself, and the image turned into my mother, the dark water going black, the ripples transforming to wind.
Name: Book 1

text: I recognized the scene as her pendant began to glow, the wind howling, screams piercing my ears.
Name: Book 1

text: It was the same dream, but different now.
Name: Book 1

text: I glanced around to find a village I didnt know.
Name: Book 1

text: Someone was coming toward me, an expression of fear and sadness on his handsome face.
Name: Book 1

text: He reached out to me and I stepped toward him, tears streaming down my cheeks.
Name: Book 1

text: He wrapped his arms around me as I turned again to see my mother.
Name: Book 1

text: A howl of rage escaped her and I started to go to her, but he held me.
Name: Book 1

text: He was restraining me.
Name: Book 1

text: I thrashed against him as I tried to scream, to tell him to let me go, but I had no voice.
Name: Book 1

text: She reached her hand out and I could not move, could not help her, though I knew she was dying.
Name: Book 1

text: I was imprisoned there, unable to move unable to scream unable to save her.
Name: Book 1

text: And then I couldnt see her.
Name: Book 1

text: Something was covering my eyes.
Name: Book 1

text: I struggled yet again but my body felt like leadheavy, useless.
Name: Book 1

text: Darkness enveloped me and I was underwater, struggling to reach the surface, desperate for air.
Name: Book 1

text: A husky voice woke me.
Name: Book 1

text: It must have been early dawn.
Name: Book 1

text: The faint light revealed worry on Chevelles face as he stood over me.
Name: Book 1

text: A look of fear and sympathy.
Name: Book 1

text: The memory smashed into my chest like a thousand-pound ram, stealing my breath.
Name: Book 1

text: He backed away as I sat up and glared at him with fire in my eyes.
Name: Book 1

text: You held me back as my mother died.
Name: Book 1

text: You held me and made me watch her die.
Name: Book 1

text: I could almost taste the acid in my voice.
Name: Book 1

text: He was still backing away, holding his hands in front of him palms out.
Name: Book 1

text: A wordless hiss escaped my throat as I felt the fire coursing through me light in my hands.
Name: Book 1

text: He would burn for this.
Name: Book 1

text: Burn.
Name: Book 1

text: I was standing now, walking step for step toward him as he backed away.
Name: Book 1

text: He said nothing, his face calm as the fire flared and I raised my hands to strike.
Name: Book 1

text: And then everything went black.
Name: Book 1

text: That was when I heard the chanting.
Name: Book 1

text: My ears had been roaring with anger, but all that was left was a soft recitation.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie was chanting something.
Name: Book 1

text: I was engulfed with an empty, lethargic feeling.
Name: Book 1

text: My eyes batted open and I was lying on the ground, looking up at Junnie and Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnies words ran together as Chevelle mumbled.
Name: Book 1

text: Gian Zet Foria Gian Zet Foria Gian Zet Foria.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed so familiar.
Name: Book 1

text: Like Georgiana, Suzetta, Glaforia.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie was talking slowly.
Name: Book 1

text: Stay calm and lie still.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to convey my incredulity as I lay there, unable to move.
Name: Book 1

text: Explain to me what happened.
Name: Book 1

text: All the anger and excitement turned numb.
Name: Book 1

text: What came out sounded no more than a statement of fact.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle held me back and made me watch my mother die.
Name: Book 1

text: Junnie didnt have the outraged look I expected.
Name: Book 1

text: I sifted through the dreamthe memorysearching for a way to explain so she would be stunned and infuriated.
Name: Book 1

text: They stared at me, and I was suddenly sure they were the reason I was lying on the ground incapacitated.
Name: Book 1

text: They had control over me.
Name: Book 1

text: My thoughts shifted, running through it again, going backwards from where I was.
Name: Book 1

text: Their faces, the chanting from behind me, Chevelle backing away, the dream.
Name: Book 1

text: I remembered being trapped underwater just before waking, but I hadnt been drowning.
Name: Book 1

text: It wasnt a dream.
Name: Book 1

text: I was horrified as more of the memory returned.
Name: Book 1

text: The cloaks who had surrounded my mother, killed her, had been circling me.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew theyd intended to destroy me, too, though I couldnt see why.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle had held me, pulled me into the water.
Name: Book 1

text: He had tried to keep them from finding me as they attacked, tried to keep me from calling out to her.
Name: Book 1

text: The look of fear, the look of sympathy.
Name: Book 1

text: Hed held me back to save me.
Name: Book 1

text: Tears streamed down my face and my body began to release from the dead weight.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle had saved me from my mothers fate.
Name: Book 1

text: How long had he been my watcher.
Name: Book 1

text: In the memory, hed fought to keep me from seeing, tried to cover my eyes.
Name: Book 1

text: And later, hed pulled me from the water, dragged me away as we fled.
Name: Book 1

text: I shook with sobs and a pair of arms wrapped around me, supporting me as my limbs became heavy, my body and mind spent from the stress or whatever trauma the spell had caused.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt say which, because I was pulled from consciousness into a black, dreamless sleep.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle was still holding me when I woke in the late morning.
Name: Book 1

text: I wondered if hed slept at all.
Name: Book 1

text: Cradled in his arms, I reached up to rub my bleary eyes.
Name: Book 1

text: As I glanced up at him, it struck me how close we were.
Name: Book 1

text: My hand dropped from my face to fall against his chest.
Name: Book 1

text: Heat rose in my neck; I could feel the corded muscle beneath his shirt.
Name: Book 1

text: I had to look away.
Name: Book 1

text: He must have thought I was searching for Junnie.
Name: Book 1

text: She left just after dawn, when she knew you were safe.
Name: Book 1

text: Oh, I breathed.
Name: Book 1

text: We were alone in the middle of nowhere and I was sitting in his lap.
Name: Book 1

text: My flush deepened and I hastily stood to straighten my clothes.
Name: Book 1

text: He watched me fidget.
Name: Book 1

text: Um, so I guess we should get going.
Name: Book 1

text: My breath caught and I forced myself to look at him, still edgy from the closeness the moment before.
Name: Book 1

text: I convinced myself I was imagining the way he studied me as he sat against the downed tree.
Name: Book 1

text: He had no idea what I was thinking.
Name: Book 1

text: It was the furthest thing from his mind.
Name: Book 1

text: I asked, unable to mask the tremor in my voice.
Name: Book 1

text: That wasnt exactly a relief.
Name: Book 1

text: It was obvious he saw my anxiety, but I couldnt be sure he wasnt enjoying it.
Name: Book 1

text: He just remained sitting there.
Name: Book 1

text: What should I do.
Name: Book 1

text: A sly grin crossed his face and he rolled his hand out in front of him.
Name: Book 1

text: You are only limited by your imagination, Freya.
Name: Book 1

text: Great, so if I screwed up it was just a problem with my mind.
Name: Book 1

text: I considered that, recalling what Steed had said about feeling it, thinking about what you wanted to happen.
Name: Book 1

text: But what did I want to happen.
Name: Book 1

text: I had to catch that line of thought before it spiraled out of control; I concentrated on finding something small.
Name: Book 1

text: A tiny pebble lay on the ground at my feet.
Name: Book 1

text: I focused on it hard, willing it to rise.
Name: Book 1

text: When nothing happened I looked for Chevelles reaction.
Name: Book 1

text: He watched me, his serene mask back in place.
Name: Book 1

text: Do you need motivation.
Name: Book 1

text: I was afraid of the kind of motivation hed provide, remembering the fireballs flying at me in the meadow.
Name: Book 1

text: My answer was too quick, and he laughed.
Name: Book 1

text: I knelt closer to the gray rock.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought it moved a little, as if trembling in fright, and the notion had me shaking my head.
Name: Book 1

text: Youre trying too hard, Freya.
Name: Book 1

text: Let us play a game.
Name: Book 1

text: He held out his hand and a stone flew up from the ground to land in the center of his open palm.
Name: Book 1

text: He closed his fist around it and when he opened it a moment later, the stone was floating a half inch above his palm, slick black and shaped to form a tiny hawk sculpture.
Name: Book 1

text: Its beautiful, I said, moving to touch it.
Name: Book 1

text: He held up his other hand up to stop me.
Name: Book 1

text: I wanted to hold the trinket; I reached forward and concentrated on moving it from his palm to mine.
Name: Book 1

text: It floated shakily across the space between us, which seemed so odd at first I thought Chevelle must have moved it.
Name: Book 1

text: I squeezed my fingers around it, as if to verify it was real, but when I opened my hand again it was only the dull gray rock.
Name: Book 1

text: Disappointment filled my face as I looked back at him.
Name: Book 1

text: He tilted his head toward the stone; I would have to make this sculpture myself.
Name: Book 1

text: I closed my fist around it, mostly because I had seen him do the same, and instantly I knew what I wanted to see.
Name: Book 1

text: I opened my palm up, grinning triumphantly, and exposed my creation for Chevelle to see.
Name: Book 1

text: Balancing there was a slightly misshapen but undeniable sculpture of a small black horse.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle rolled his eyes.
Name: Book 1

text: Still smiling, I looked back to the stone, but it had returned to its uninteresting round shape.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle answered my unspoken question.
Name: Book 1

text: He smiled a little at using Steeds word.
Name: Book 1

text: You cant change somethings makeup, but you can change the way it appears.
Name: Book 1

text: You can move it, but only if youre near.
Name: Book 1

text: You can stop someones heart, but you cant make them feel happy about it.
Name: Book 1
