text: He hesitated after that last part, contemplating, and then continued, You can manipulate the elements, move water, draw it from the ground, but you cannot easily make it appear from nothing though one can usually collect moisture from the air.
Name: Book 1

text: It spreads so fast.
Name: Book 1

text: You can pull a small spark from anywhere to create a flame, fueled by the air and.
Name: Book 1

text: He trailed off as I leaned closer to him, listening intently.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle looked into my eyes, words forgotten.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know what he had seen there, but he blinked, shaking his head.
Name: Book 1

text: He stepped a few paces away as he spoke.
Name: Book 1

text: Youll need to think clearly and stay calm.
Name: Book 1

text: The best fighters are the best thinkers.
Name: Book 1

text: Fighters.
Name: Book 1

text: He shook his head again, as if clearing it.
Name: Book 1

text: There was a long pause as I waited for his answer.
Name: Book 1

text: Id like you to practice just for protection.
Name: Book 1

text: I have fire.
Name: Book 1

text: He picked up a fallen branch, long and jagged, and snapped the smaller twigs from its side.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, but you should learn to think more openly.
Name: Book 1

text: It is an important resource and should be familiar to you.
Name: Book 1

text: You should have years of experience by now.
Name: Book 1

text: Why dont I.
Name: Book 1

text: I could tell by his expression he hadnt meant to say so.
Name: Book 1

text: Why cant I use magic.
Name: Book 1

text: Why couldnt I use it before.
Name: Book 1

text: There was another long pause and then he spoke carefully.
Name: Book 1

text: The word was so foreign in that context.
Name: Book 1

text: All I could think of was the young children in the village, binding themselves to play the games of fairy children, who were unmagical until coming of age.
Name: Book 1

text: I recalled seeing it in the documents in the briar patchFrancine Glaforia, bound against using all but practical magic.
Name: Book 1

text: They must have known not to trust me.
Name: Book 1

text: They must have known.
Name: Book 1

text: My knees gave out and I crumpled to the ground.
Name: Book 1

text: How many times could the earth be pulled from beneath my feet.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle took a step toward me and I held up a hand to stop him.
Name: Book 1

text: Bound against using magic.
Name: Book 1

text: My anger toward him returned, swift and unforgiving.
Name: Book 1

text: He had been a volunteer.
Name: Book 1

text: Lets just go, I said coldly, looking up the mountain.
Name: Book 1

text: We rode wordlessly on as I chewed over this new knowledge.
Name: Book 1

text: As my watcher, Chevelle would have been involved in the binding by Council.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe Fannie should have been punished for whatever she had done, but how could they assume I would follow in her footsteps.
Name: Book 1

text: So Id killed a bird, stolen a few papers from the council library.
Name: Book 1

text: My argument faltered, so I went back to anger, betrayal that he had lied to me.
Name: Book 1

text: And not just him.
Name: Book 1

text: The entire village must have known I was bound, known I couldnt perform magic, as they sat and watched me try.
Name: Book 1

text: Sending me to Junnie for lessons, allowing Evelyn to taunt me without recourse, giving me the blame for everything that happened.
Name: Book 1

text: Because they expected me to turn.
Name: Book 1

text: The horses slowed to a stop, irritating me further.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt even have control over that.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle stepped down and started a fire.
Name: Book 1

text: When he walked away, I recalled what he had said earlier in the day, that you could stop someones heart.
Name: Book 1

text: It hadnt occurred to me that might be how he killed his prey.
Name: Book 1

text: He made his way back over the scrubby brush, two small rabbits in hand.
Name: Book 1

text: He dropped them and a branch covered in fat, blood-red berries by the fire, and I posted myself on the edge of an uneven rock to watch.
Name: Book 1

text: He didnt speak, but I couldnt tell if he intended to give me my space or was just indifferent.
Name: Book 1

text: I had, after all, apparently been guilty of the charges.
Name: Book 1

text: I was a criminal.
Name: Book 1

text: I silently wished Steed was here to build me a shelter so I could crawl in and hide until morning.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt about to try to build one on my own and risk embarrassing myself in front of Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: A gust of wind pushed the flames beneath the spit, causing them to writhe and jump.
Name: Book 1

text: They formed shapes that pulled at my memories.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to follow them, but couldnt seem to get my thoughts to cooperate.
Name: Book 1

text: I could remember my dreams, the wind and fire surrounding my mother.
Name: Book 1

text: But the memories that came back when I woke from those vivid nightmares were dull.
Name: Book 1

text: The harder I clutched at them, the more they drew away.
Name: Book 1

text: When recognition dawned, I leapt from the rock, cursing Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: He turned to me as I yelled, Give it back.
Name: Book 1

text: He didnt appear to know what I was talking about, but I was so angry I was having trouble forming the demand.
Name: Book 1

text: Give my memories, my mind back.
Name: Book 1

text: His confusion cleared, but Chevelle didnt offer a response.
Name: Book 1

text: The fire in me itched to burn him.
Name: Book 1

text: Unbind my thoughts.
Name: Book 1

text: Freya.
Name: Book 1

text: His voice was smooth.
Name: Book 1

text: I fumed, Well, Im sure that has nothing to do with you rummaging around in there.
Name: Book 1

text: He shook his head and his complete lack of agitation caused me to take pause.
Name: Book 1

text: I supposed it was possible he actually couldnt free my thoughts.
Name: Book 1

text: If the council had bound me, likely all of them would need to reverse it.
Name: Book 1

text: And they wouldnt do that.
Name: Book 1

text: Because they had convicted me.
Name: Book 1

text: I might have asked how the process would work, but I was too furious to pursue conversation with any kind of composure.
Name: Book 1

text: And it didnt matter, because theyd already counted me guilty.
Name: Book 1

text: I was staying bound.
Name: Book 1

text: I let out a frustrated growl, clenching my jaw shut.
Name: Book 1

text: He was one of them.
Name: Book 1

text: I had to remember that.
Name: Book 1

text: I might have run back to the village right then, but they would never release me.
Name: Book 1

text: I glanced down the mountainside.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt have found my way back if Id wanted to.
Name: Book 1

text: I had no idea where I was.
Name: Book 1

text: I stared at my palms, some spell-bought map carved into my skin, and was hit full force with the knowledge that I didnt even know where I was going.
Name: Book 1

text: I was about as low on options as I could get.
Name: Book 1

text: If not for Chevelles desire to skip out on Council business for a few days, or whatever we were doing here, Id already be imprisoned.
Name: Book 1

text: I could hope that with the dreams, with the mountains, with wherever my familys map was taking me, I could remember more, could break some part free.
Name: Book 1

text: It was all I would have in my captivity.
Name: Book 1

text: It was the mountains or nothing.
Name: Book 1

text: I could see no other way.
Name: Book 1

text: It was days before I spoke to Chevelle again, though he didnt seem to mind the lack of conversation.
Name: Book 1

text: He simply rode as he always did, with intermittent glances in each direction, as if I werent even there.
Name: Book 1

text: In truth, he hadnt appeared to notice my behavior at all.
Name: Book 1

text: When I finally broke the silence, we were navigating a narrow pass.
Name: Book 1

text: How long will we be riding.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt specific in my question, not wanting to reveal I had no idea where we were headed.
Name: Book 1

text: If hed been under the false impression hed had to take me, I wasnt about to mess that up only to be dragged back to the village.
Name: Book 1

text: Especially after everything that had happened.
Name: Book 1

text: My horse quickened his pace to ride alongside his and I made a mental note to learn how to control the horse on my own.
Name: Book 1

text: The constricted path forced us close together, our stirrups and legs brushing as we rode.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle nodded at my hand and I held it out, palm up.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle indicated a spot on one of the mountains.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried not to let my disappointment show.
Name: Book 1

text: The information wouldve only helped if Id known where I started on the map or its endpoint.
Name: Book 1

text: But at least I knew we were closer.
Name: Book 1

text: When we came through the pass our path widened, but the horses didnt separate as I had expected them to.
Name: Book 1

text: I decided Id had enough of that.
Name: Book 1

text: How do I control Steed.
Name: Book 1

text: I could see the humor in his eyes at my phrasing, but he kept a straight face.
Name: Book 1

text: Think of where you want him to go and lead his head so.
Name: Book 1

text: I concentrated on turning left and we were instantly spinning, the unexpected twirl throwing me half from my saddle.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle caught my arm and righted me on my now-still horse.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe not so severe next time.
Name: Book 1

text: My face heated, but I focused on the horses head again, turning him back to our course as I gave a small nudge with my heels.
Name: Book 1

text: I was cautious after that but it became easier to control his movement as we rode.
Name: Book 1

text: I practiced guiding him, eventually even maneuvering him back and forth between the misshapen rocks and spiky brush on our way.
Name: Book 1

text: I was still afraid to have him kneel when we stopped for the evening, though, imagining him rolling on top of me if I tried.
Name: Book 1

text: I slid down and stretched my legs, glad for a rest after the hours of tensing every time the horse changed direction.
Name: Book 1

text: The air was brisk.
Name: Book 1

text: I ran my hands over my arms to warm them.
Name: Book 1

text: I started as black swirled around me.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle had thrown a cloak over my shoulders.
Name: Book 1

text: He moved in front of me to hook the clasp, his dark eyes piercing as he stood so close.
Name: Book 1

text: My heart stuttered when he leaned in, our faces unbearably near.
Name: Book 1

text: Just before he touched me, his cheek slid alongside mine, his mouth at my ear.
Name: Book 1

text: I froze as he spoke low, his breath on my neck sending a shiver through me.
Name: Book 1

text: He moved so fast it took a moment to understand.
Name: Book 1

text: The hood of the cloak was drawn over my head, Chevelle standing a good distance away, facing the trees.
Name: Book 1

text: I was watching him as two men drew near.
Name: Book 1

text: I hadnt seen them; they must have been concealed, or camouflaged by magic as I had been days before.
Name: Book 1

text: The tassels decorating their long robes identified them as members of council, but I wasnt familiar with the two.
Name: Book 1

text: They mustnt have been from the village.
Name: Book 1

text: As they approached Chevelle cautiously, I examined their insignia.
Name: Book 1

text: Even if they werent from the village, I still needed council members to unbind me, and I had a sudden urge to go to them.
Name: Book 1

text: But I remembered my warning to be still.
Name: Book 1

text: Shes not going back.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles tone, level and uncompromising, caught my attention.
Name: Book 1

text: I pushed the hood back to better hear and the taller figure glared at me as he hissed, Youre protecting her when you know what shes capable of.
Name: Book 1

text: I flinched at his words, but something else had caught my eye.
Name: Book 1

text: The robes were ornate, the tassels interwoven with color.
Name: Book 1

text: He was Grand Council.
Name: Book 1

text: I studied the other newcomer, who acted as if I wasnt present.
Name: Book 1

text: He was incredulous, staring at Chevelle when he spoke.
Name: Book 1

text: Her mother slaughtered your clan, your family.
Name: Book 1

text: Why release this terror The mans words were cut short, his face contorted in pain.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle had gone rigid, every muscle tense.
Name: Book 1

text: The councilman struggled, suffering from some unseen force.
Name: Book 1

text: Blood poured from his nose and I gasped.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles head jerked toward me and I couldnt catch my breathhis eyes were as black as onyx.
Name: Book 1

text: When his focus returned to the men, they eased away, the first supporting other by an arm as both bowed slightly, stepping and stumbling in their retreat.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle watched them until they spun to disappear, and then he turned to me.
Name: Book 1

text: One look at his face and I knew the cause of the devastation.
Name: Book 1

text: I still couldnt remember, but I knew what I had heard was truth.
Name: Book 1

text: My mother had killed his family, his entire clan.
Name: Book 1

text: Hed been there in the village in my dreams, in my memories.
Name: Book 1

text: He had saved me.
Name: Book 1

text: His family was there as well.
Name: Book 1

text: The people running and screaming and dying were his clan.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew the cloaks in that vision now, too.
Name: Book 1

text: They were Grand Council.
Name: Book 1

text: The council was circling my mother to stop her.
Name: Book 1

text: She was killing the northern clans.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know why.
Name: Book 1

text: And I didnt know how I knew, but I was certain I didnt want my memories back.
Name: Book 1

text: What I had was already too much.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt fathom the pain Chevelle had suffered, surely a hundred times mine at the loss of my mother.
Name: Book 1

text: His mother his father each member of his family.
Name: Book 1

text: How much loss had he endured.
Name: Book 1

text: Tears streamed down my face.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle took a step toward me and I was struck by fear.
Name: Book 1

text: He must despise me.
Name: Book 1

text: That was why hed become my watcher.
Name: Book 1

text: He gave a curt nod at my reaction, his head still dipped as he walked away.
Name: Book 1

text: I wanted to speak but the words choked me.
Name: Book 1

text: I wrapped myself tighter into the cloak as Chevelle constructed a hasty shelter.
Name: Book 1

text: I was his responsibility, but surely he loathed me.
Name: Book 1

text: How could he not.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought back to the scenarios I had envisioned after the memories of my mother being killed came back to me what I would do to those men if I were to ever find them.
Name: Book 1

text: Now I remembered the truth.
Name: Book 1

text: They were saving the North.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt say I didnt still want revenge though.
Name: Book 1

text: What he must feel toward me for taking so much from him.
Name: Book 1

text: My mind was reclassifying every look hed ever given me, everything that had happened since Id met him.
Name: Book 1

text: Why he hadnt looked at me as Id lain under the tree in the meadow, explaining why Fannie had struck me.
Name: Book 1

text: Why Id wanted to learn transfer magic to get my mothers things.
Name: Book 1

text: The look hed given the pendant on my neck my mothers pendant.
Name: Book 1

text: Of course hed volunteered to be my watcher.
Name: Book 1

text: I had taken everything from him.
Name: Book 1

text: My thoughts began to muddle as my mother and my dreams and my own life twisted together.
Name: Book 1

text: I still couldnt retrieve my memories; I only had the last years, which seemed a haze now.
Name: Book 1

text: The only parts clear to me were the days since Chevelle walked through Junnies door.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought of how I had cursed him when Id found he was my watcher.
Name: Book 1

text: The hate in my voice when Id demanded my memories back.
Name: Book 1

text: The memories of his familys murder.
Name: Book 1

text: My mind writhed with anguish through the night.
Name: Book 1

text: As I emerged from the shelter late the next morning, I was resigned.
Name: Book 1

text: I would continue my journey with him and let him return me to the council without resistance.
Name: Book 1

text: It was all I could do.
Name: Book 1

text: I found him sitting near the shelters entrance, distress apparent in his features.
Name: Book 1

text: Thank you, I said, indicating the shelter.
Name: Book 1

text: He nodded, but his face didnt quite return to the serene mask he usually wore.
Name: Book 1

text: My stomach knotted; I hadnt eaten since our ride the day before.
Name: Book 1

text: Ill get you some food, he said.
Name: Book 1

text: A fire lit beside us as if of its own accord.
Name: Book 1

text: He strode off in search of food, and I sat close, tucking my cheeks into the material of the cloak for warmth.
Name: Book 1

text: A moment later, he was back, our breakfast roasting over the flames.
Name: Book 1

text: We ate in silence and mounted the horses as we had each day before, but it was obvious nothing was the same.
Name: Book 1

text: How could it ever be.
Name: Book 1

text: I was racked with guilt as we made our way up the mountain.
Name: Book 1

text: I purposefully rode behind him, glad at least to be able to control the horse on my own.
Name: Book 1

text: Small patches of snow had started to dot the landscape, the vegetation a darker, sharper green.
Name: Book 1

text: Occasionally the sun would break through the mist, making me squint, and I would appreciate the calmer, hazier atmosphere.
Name: Book 1

text: Gloom, as they called it at home, in the usually sunny village where I would spend my eternity.
Name: Book 1

text: I wondered where I would be kept as a captive, if there would be windows, if I was unfit for public view.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle picked up speed after we passed through the more difficult part of the trail and then we rode fast the rest of the day.
Name: Book 1

text: I struggled to keep up.
Name: Book 1

text: I was sure I knew the cause of his hurry.
Name: Book 1

text: Hed decided he wanted to get this journey over with, end it and return me to the council for punishment, to be done with me.
Name: Book 1

text: We rode long into the evening, well past sunset, and I began to wonder if he would stop at all.
Name: Book 1

text: I was contemplating possible ways to sleep on a horse when he finally stopped.
Name: Book 1

text: We were riding through a small pass, the moonlight barely lighting our way, and Chevelles horse disappeared.
Name: Book 1

text: My head swiveled, searching for any sign of them, and then my own horse turned beneath an overhang and stopped in a cavern so dark I hadnt seen it until we were there.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle tossed out a small flame, giving us enough light to dismount.
Name: Book 1

text: The horses walked to one end of the cavern, their hoofbeats echoing softly, as we remained in the other.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle turned to me as he spoke.
Name: Book 1

text: Yesterday the council trackers.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to focus on what he was saying and not let my mind run wild with the new information.
Name: Book 1

text: They will send someone for what I have done.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought of the councilmans face, distorted in pain.
Name: Book 1

text: We should continue your training.
Name: Book 1

text: Training.
Name: Book 1

text: Even I could hear the dread in my question.
Name: Book 1

text: You should be able to protect yourself.
Name: Book 1

text: I remembered his words from before the revelation that ended my magic lessons.
Name: Book 1

text: A chill ran down my spine as I nodded my assent.
Name: Book 1

text: Id skinned out of a few run-ins with council and it was no secret how they operated.
Name: Book 1

text: I might be safe enough with Chevelle, but if the others retrieved me.
Name: Book 1

text: We will work again at first light and possibly as we ride.
Name: Book 1

text: Part of me wanted to argue, As we ride.
Name: Book 1

text: But I knew how serious it was.
Name: Book 1

text: I was a fugitive.
Name: Book 1

text: And now it appeared even Grand Council was looking for me.
Name: Book 1

text: I had no idea what my punishment would be.
Name: Book 1

text: This wasnt the village.
Name: Book 1

text: This would be far worse than anything High Council would have planned.
Name: Book 1

text: What will they do if I cant protect myself.
Name: Book 1

text: His face was grim.
Name: Book 1

text: He didnt reply and I suddenly didnt want him to.
Name: Book 1

text: We settled onto the floor of the small den, our backs against the wall, the rock overhang blocking the light of the moon.
Name: Book 1

text: That is my flame, Chevelle said, try to extinguish it.
Name: Book 1

text: And my training began.
Name: Book 1

text: Early the next morning, even before first light, Chevelle woke me for training.
Name: Book 1

text: Gone were the games we had played.
Name: Book 1

text: These lessons were intense and stressful.
Name: Book 1

text: Id been unable to generate magic on demand so hed started lunging at me with weapons, sticks, fire, forcing me to respond to protect myself.
Name: Book 1

text: After each attack, he would come right back at me and if I tried to repeat a tactic for defense, he would overpower my magic and push me to find a new maneuver.
Name: Book 1

text: I was beat, winded, drained.
Name: Book 1

text: Mount up, he announced.
Name: Book 1

text: When I started to climb on my horse, the horse shot off like an arrow, almost knocking me to the ground.
Name: Book 1

text: I glared at Chevelles back, but he was already galloping away.
Name: Book 1

text: I reached out with magic, drawing Steeds head around to press him back to me, climbed up, and clicked my heels hard to catch Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: He was riding too fast again and I was not looking forward to the day, sure it would be worse than the already miserable morning.
Name: Book 1

text: I rode up beside him, planning a snide remark about the trick, but was distracted by a black stone in his hand.
Name: Book 1

text: It was odd-shaped and just smaller than my balled fist.
Name: Book 1

text: Onyx, I thought, though Id never seen the stone that big.
Name: Book 1

text: His gaze was intent.
Name: Book 1

text: Be prepared at all times.
Name: Book 1

text: This will come at you from every direction.
Name: Book 1

text: It is the only way you can learn to respond quickly.
Name: Book 1

text: You need to get past that block, to use your defense as instinct.
Name: Book 1

text: I really didnt want to play anymore.
Name: Book 1

text: But before I could protest, a black rock hurtled toward me.
Name: Book 1

text: My hand jerked up automatically to swat it away but my arm hit an invisible wall.
Name: Book 1

text: The rock slammed into my face.
Name: Book 1

text: I was fairly certain my nose was bleeding from the impact.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to slow my horse but no longer had control of him.
Name: Book 1

text: The rock was coming for me a second time.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to duck out of the way but the wall was there once more, blocking me from moving.
Name: Book 1

text: I cursed as the stone glanced off my cheek.
Name: Book 1

text: This isnt fair, I complained.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed he was holding me in place just to strike me.
Name: Book 1

text: Its the only way, Freya.
Name: Book 1

text: This is for your protection.
Name: Book 1

text: I highly doubt they will pummel my face with rocks, I spat out.
Name: Book 1

text: No, he said, they will bind you and burn you alive.
Name: Book 1

text: A vision of the Grand Council cloaks circling me was convincing enough, but he continued.
Name: Book 1

text: You will not know their thoughts; you must be ready for any attack.
Name: Book 1

text: I nodded, even though part of me was certain there was a less painful way.
Name: Book 1

text: The rock came at me again.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt respond quick enough, couldnt counter and hold on to a galloping horse in the instant it took him to decide.
Name: Book 1

text: It wasnt dangerous, but it was like being slapped, and the irritation had me itching to burn something.
Name: Book 1

text: The volley continued and whenever my anger showed, the rock came harder, faster, so I tried to control the emotion or at least hide it.
Name: Book 1

text: That was the hardest part.
Name: Book 1

text: Eventually, I found the best defense was to block the attacks by deflecting them with other objects.
Name: Book 1

text: His magic was too powerful to counter directly and hed prevented me from ducking away.
Name: Book 1

text: When I was blocking about half the strikes successfully, he pocketed the stone and progressed with sticks, water, fire, anything he found on the trail.
Name: Book 1

text: We were still riding too fast and I was exhausted from the mental and physical exertion when he switched to full-body attacks.
Name: Book 1

text: By nightfall I wasnt able to fend off anything that came at me and he mercifully stopped the horses beneath another hollow in the mountain.
Name: Book 1

text: I was asleep practically before I slid off my horse.
Name: Book 1

text: The next morning I woke to the sound of rock against rock.
Name: Book 1

text: There was no sign of Chevelle or his horse in the dim stone hollow.
Name: Book 1

text: I sat up, rubbing my sore legs, unable to believe hed left me.
Name: Book 1

text: And then the rock wall struck me in the face.
Name: Book 1

text: I cursed, my voice hoarse from sleep.
Name: Book 1

text: The wall came at me again.
Name: Book 1

text: Okay, okay, I shouted.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles camouflage dissipated and he stared down at me, disappointed.
Name: Book 1

text: He smiled as the beast nipped at the back of my head, yanking my hair.
Name: Book 1

text: Grumbling, I swatted the horse away and ran my hand over my face, sure it was mottled with bruises and scratch marks.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle offered me a hide flagon and I took it, swallowing a mouthful before the taste hit me.
Name: Book 1

text: Gah, that tastes like cat pee smells.
Name: Book 1

text: It will help with the healing.
Name: Book 1

text: It would be another day of bombardment with mountain fixtures maybe whole trees this time.
Name: Book 1

text: My face pinched with annoyance and Chevelle threw me a piece of dried meat, barely holding back a smile as he jumped on his horse.
Name: Book 1

text: Youd better get started, he said, its going to be a long walk.
Name: Book 1

text: As he kicked his heels, I spun toward the corner where my horse had been.
Name: Book 1

text: He was galloping up the mountain now, just over a hundred yards away.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to think quickly, to keep the anger from slowing my response.
Name: Book 1

text: Using magic to pull Chevelles horse by the tail, I ran after him, hoping to leap on.
Name: Book 1

text: A tree branch came from nowhere and smacked me flat across the face.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles horse whinnied as they rode away.
Name: Book 1

text: Why always the face.
Name: Book 1

text: I yelled at his back.
Name: Book 1

text: I winced as a second branch, this one young and green and more like a lash, struck me from behind.
Name: Book 1

text: A fierce growl escaped me and I took off, running at full speed in the direction my horse had gone.
Name: Book 1

text: By midday, I was completely spent.
Name: Book 1

text: I had eventually caught my horse, but the training hadnt let up.
Name: Book 1

text: I was too exhausted for any anger to remain, but I had the sneaking suspicion Chevelle was enjoying my lessons.
Name: Book 1

text: We stopped by a patch of snow that had gathered in a rock basin, warming it to water for the horses.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle jumped down from his horse as I melted off the side of mine and onto a rock, my limbs like molasses.
Name: Book 1

text: He came to sit across from me and I flinched, expecting another attack.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, at least youre anticipating assault.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt have the energy for casual banter, but I did manage to glare at him.
Name: Book 1

text: The village is a few hours ride from here.
Name: Book 1

text: He retrieved a fresh set of clothes from his pack and handed it across to me.
Name: Book 1

text: Go ahead and get cleaned up.
Name: Book 1

text: Ill be back in a few moments.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to pull myself together as he strode away, but I felt so drained.
Name: Book 1

text: I stood, easing my clothes off, soiled and tattered from the days of batterings.
Name: Book 1

text: The damage on my bare skin was minimal.
Name: Book 1

text: I had imagined much worse as Id failed to block so many of the strikes.
Name: Book 1

text: I satisfied my ego by giving the cat pee-smelling elixir more credit than was probably due, but some part of me knew the training had not been hard because it was physical.
Name: Book 1

text: It had been the use of magic.
Name: Book 1

text: I put the new shirt on, made of soft black leather and corseted tight around my waist.
Name: Book 1

text: Slim, dark wool pants and tall boots went on next and I wondered at the village wed be entering where black was appropriate.
Name: Book 1

text: I could think of no one at home who had worn black; I envisioned the dainty blond elves dancing around in dark leather and giggled.
Name: Book 1

text: I glanced up to find Chevelle, wearing an unfathomable expression.
Name: Book 1

text: I hurried to finish lacing the boots, throwing the cloak around my shoulders as he left more rations and went to ready the horses.
Name: Book 1

text: I stretched out on the ground to eat, examining the carved medallion clasped to my boot.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle stepped away again, disappearing behind the rocks that had become more jagged and taller along our way.
Name: Book 1

text: When he returned, the sight of him stole my breath.
Name: Book 1

text: His worn traveling clothes were gone, exchanged for dark gray and black, a leather vest covering his shirt, the laces loose at his chest.
Name: Book 1

text: A long, dark cloak was clasped at his shoulders, the material thick and coarse, so unlike the soft robes the rest of council wore.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew I was gaping at him, but there was something so strange about it.
Name: Book 1

text: He caught my eye and I let my gaze fall to his sword belt, struggling to gather my composure.
Name: Book 1

text: I had to remind myself that he despised me.
Name: Book 1

text: By late afternoon, our path opened to look down on the village nestled in the rocks of a narrow valley ahead.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle stopped on a ridge to allow us a better view.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt think I would have called it a villageI couldnt count the structures from our vantage point but it must have been ten times the size of home.
Name: Book 1

text: The buildings were the dull stone of the mountain.
Name: Book 1

text: There was really no vegetation at all, no greens, no browns.
Name: Book 1

text: The entire layout was dark, ashen stones and aged wood that seemed to melt right in to the blue-gray of the mountain.
Name: Book 1

text: The cloudy mist filtered the sun.
Name: Book 1

text: I decided it was beautiful.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle nodded toward my hands as he started down the path.
Name: Book 1

text: The map on my palms was gone.
Name: Book 1

text: My skin was unmarked, no indication whatsoever it had even been burned.
Name: Book 1

text: Is this our destination.
Name: Book 1

text: My gaze shot up to find the village, and then I hastily clicked my heels when I realized I was being left behind.
Name: Book 1

text: As we advanced, I could see movement amongst the elves.
Name: Book 1

text: There was much activity, but it was nothing like home.
Name: Book 1

text: No flags of quilts and rugs blowing in the breeze, no bright sunlight on a rainbow of colors, no dancing in the village center.
Name: Book 1

text: A raucous sound traveled up to us and Chevelle waved a hand, his magic bringing the hood of my cloak up to cover my head and then his own.
Name: Book 1

text: At once, my stomach was a knot again.
Name: Book 1

text: We rode into town at a walk; Chevelle was sitting straight and tall in his saddle but his arm hung casually, hand resting on his leg.
Name: Book 1

text: I was more comfortable watching him, looking for a reaction, than the passing elves.
Name: Book 1

text: Two men walked by in the opposite direction, their dark eyes on us.
Name: Book 1

text: My cape blew back, exposing the shape of my leg, and they hissed indecent comments.
Name: Book 1

text: I gasped, shocked, and my horse picked up its pace to ride beside Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle held up two fingers slightly to silence me.
Name: Book 1

text: We hadnt ridden more than a quarter of the way into town when he turned the horses to a medium-sized structure, stopping before a water trough.
Name: Book 1

text: He dismounted effortlessly and pulled me from my horse and into the building in a few quick steps, closing the door behind us.
Name: Book 1

text: It was dark inside, his fingers lingering on my arm.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt him shift, waving a hand as several lanterns around the main room lit, giving off a soft glow.
Name: Book 1

text: He indicated a door on the rear wall.
Name: Book 1

text: I drew back my hood, nodding.
Name: Book 1

text: I have some business to take care of before we move on.
Name: Book 1

text: So this wasnt our destination.
Name: Book 1

text: Or did he mean back to the village.
Name: Book 1

text: He continued, apparently not noticing my perplexed expression as my mind ran through a list of possible scenarios.
Name: Book 1

text: The pouch from the vault.
Name: Book 1

text: There was a stone in it.
Name: Book 1

text: It was clear he was asking for the ruby, but I wasnt sure why.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt think I had much choice in the matter, given that I was a criminal, but could come up with no real reason to fight it.
Name: Book 1

text: Standing in the center of this strange room, in the middle of a mountain, had me thinking through fog.
Name: Book 1

text: I was going to be returned to the village for punishmentor worse, now that I was being tracked by Grand Council.
Name: Book 1

text: I was completely ignorant of where I was.
Name: Book 1

text: I had apparently lost part of my memories and magic because I had been bound, was still bound.
Name: Book 1

text: I realized Chevelle was watching me, waiting for the stone.
Name: Book 1

text: Shaking free of the thoughts, I removed the pouch from my pack to untie the lacing.
Name: Book 1

text: I reached inside, wondering momentarily what else might be written in the ancient language on the scroll.
Name: Book 1

text: I handed the dark red stone to Chevelle, who only nodded as he took it from me, not examining it before he slipped it into a pocket to hide it away.
Name: Book 1

text: There was a sound at the door and his fingers slid over my lower back, urging me into my room.
Name: Book 1

text: I was closed in just as the main door opened, giving me no more than a glimpse of deep red curls.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried not to be annoyed about being closed in a room.
Name: Book 1

text: I was a prisoner after all.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles voice was barely audible as he spoke to his visitor in a formal tone.
Name: Book 1

text: Before I could stop myself, I was at the door peering through the frame.
Name: Book 1

text: A tiny crack of light allowed me about three-quarters of Chevelles back and all of his guest.
Name: Book 1

text: She looked to be a little shorter than me, a little smaller, but seemed larger somehow.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought I knew why.
Name: Book 1

text: Around her petite face, by some means both wicked and charming, was a mane of deep crimson hair flowing in curls.
Name: Book 1

text: I considered her name, given that mass of hair, but any sympathy disappeared as she reached out a hand toward Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: There was something sinful about it, the way her hand turned seductively in the simple task of retrieving the stone from him.
Name: Book 1

text: Anger swelled in me.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt sure if I had given it to Chevelle because Id trusted him, or because he was my captor, but I couldnt shake the feeling of betrayal.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt fathom why he would be giving my family heirloom to this woman.
Name: Book 1

text: The ruby had been in the vault with my mothers possessions, along with the map that had brought us here, and now he was giving this Ruby my ruby.
Name: Book 1

text: I shook my head; there must be a connection, some reason it would end here.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby drew a package from her cape and handed it to Chevelle, smiling a temptresss smile.
Name: Book 1

text: It was about two hands in size, wrapped in light brown cloth.
Name: Book 1

text: He slid it under his cloak and it disappeared from my view.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt imagine what she had given him, but it must have been in trade for my stone.
Name: Book 1

text: As I peered through the gap in the doorframe, the strangers eyes flicked to mine and I was sure she somehow saw me.
Name: Book 1

text: I held my breath and jerked away from view, plastering myself against the wall.
Name: Book 1

text: When she didnt speak up to expose me, my pulse began to slow.
Name: Book 1

text: But I wasnt brave enough to look again.
Name: Book 1

text: I stared into the room, the space relatively large and ornate compared to my bedroom at home.
Name: Book 1

text: There was a stone-framed bed wide enough for two, dark olive blankets in layers on top.
Name: Book 1

text: A side table held a few trinkets and a decanter set, and there was a hickorywood wardrobe in the corner.
Name: Book 1

text: A full mirror lined the east wall.
Name: Book 1

text: I took a few steps forward, staring in disbelief as my figure came into view.
Name: Book 1

text: I had seen the reflection in the water, had known my hair was dark, my eyes a strange shade of green.
Name: Book 1

text: But as I gazed at the woman in my reflection, I could not reconcile the two.
Name: Book 1

text: The dark silhouette, her figure emphasized by fitted clothes, black cape draped behind herthis woman was breathtaking.
Name: Book 1

text: I moved closer to examine her, nearly reaching out to touch the windblown sable hair.
Name: Book 1

text: Her eyesmy eyeswere dark.
Name: Book 1

text: That muddy fog was gone now and under my black lashes waited deep emerald jewels, flecked with the darkest of browns.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle had been right, this did suit me.
Name: Book 1

text: The image in the mirror was stunning.
Name: Book 1

text: It felt odd to marvel over my own reflection, but I couldnt pretend I didnt like it.
Name: Book 1

text: The changes were still unnerving though, and I tried to remember what I looked like in my oldest memories, to see before, to see my mothers face.
Name: Book 1

text: The door opened behind me.
Name: Book 1

text: Ah, yes, Ruby purred as she looked me over.
Name: Book 1

text: Her inflection left no doubt the word was not a compliment, only that she found it lovely shed discovered me here.
Name: Book 1

text: I could see Chevelle through the open door behind her, still in the main room and evidently annoyed.
Name: Book 1

text: I, of course, am Ruby, she said.
Name: Book 1

text: Im pleased youll be staying with me during your visit.
Name: Book 1

text: This was her house.
Name: Book 1

text: I was sure I was wearing the same irritated look as Chevelle now.
Name: Book 1

text: I was also certain, by the way she watched me, that Ruby had seen me spying.
Name: Book 1

text: Her mouth was twisted in a smile, loaded with false honey.
Name: Book 1

text: I noticed her eyes then, looking past the heavy paint they wore, to dark green jewels emeralds.
Name: Book 1

text: They were so like those I had just examined in the mirror that I had to look away.
Name: Book 1

text: Frey, I replied softly.
Name: Book 1

text: Thank you for the room.
Name: Book 1

text: She seemed disappointed I had no further comment.
Name: Book 1

text: She flitted her hand in dismissal as she swirled out of the room and back to Chevelle, the metal bracelets around her wrists tinkling like chimes.
Name: Book 1

text: Im off to town then.
Name: Book 1

text: You know, a handsome hunk of horsemeat was asking about you this morning.
Name: Book 1

text: My ears perked up.
Name: Book 1

text: Someone was asking about Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: That must have been why we were here.
Name: Book 1

text: And then I realized she had called someone a hunk of horsemeat and I had to stifle a giggle.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle nodded, but made no remark on the inquirer.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby winked at him on her way out and the gesture lit a burn in my chest.
Name: Book 1

text: I turned back to my room and climbed into bed, angry at myself more than anything else, and determined not to let him see.
Name: Book 1

text: I covered my head with a corner of the blanket, suffocating my fractured thoughts with the absence of light.
Name: Book 1

text: I was unsure how long Id slept.
Name: Book 1

text: The house was quiet when I slipped from bed, trying not to make a sound.
Name: Book 1

text: I peeked into the main room, finding Chevelle sitting against the front wall, a small window over his head.
Name: Book 1

text: He leaned over, working on something in the palm of his hand, a steady scratching accompanying the movement of his wrist.
Name: Book 1

text: I started forward and my boot scuffed the floor, alerting him to my presence.
Name: Book 1

text: As he glanced up, he slid whatever hed been working on into a pocket at his hip.
Name: Book 1

text: It dawned on me then that the main room had only the entrance and two other doors.
Name: Book 1

text: If we were staying with Ruby then the second room must be hers.
Name: Book 1

text: I meant to offer Chevelle my room to sleep in, but the look on his face was so unnerving I could not stop myself from offering something else.
Name: Book 1

text: You dont you dont have to protect me.
Name: Book 1

text: I hoped it was true.
Name: Book 1

text: I can turn myself in, take myself to the village, or.
Name: Book 1

text: I was trying to say Grand Council, but the words stuck in my throat.
Name: Book 1

text: No part of me wanted to surrender to my mothers killers, but I could not make Chevelle suffer more than he already had.
Name: Book 1

text: My hands trembled and I tightened them into fists.
Name: Book 1

text: He was my watcher; he must have felt he needed to fulfill his duties, to keep his honor.
Name: Book 1

text: He would finish our journey and return me to the village.
Name: Book 1

text: He said my name as if it were tearing at him and my chest ached.
Name: Book 1

text: His eyes closed for a long moment before they found me again.
Name: Book 1

text: You cant submit to Grand Council.
Name: Book 1

text: You can never submit.
Name: Book 1

text: He was right, I didnt understand.
Name: Book 1

text: Did he intend to return me to the village, to High Council.
Name: Book 1

text: To keep me safe from the others.
Name: Book 1

text: You remembered what they did to your mother.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt my face pale.
Name: Book 1

text: Id known they were dangerous, but did he mean to submit was to accept her fate.
Name: Book 1

text: The image of flames and a circle of cloaks surrounding her was there again and I had to force it away before it turned to an image of me.
Name: Book 1

text: Protection, hed kept saying as we worked on magic.
Name: Book 1

text: Theyre going to burn me.
Name: Book 1

text: They would kill me because of the pendant, the library.
Name: Book 1

text: No, Frey.
Name: Book 1

text: You have broken some of your bonds.
Name: Book 1

text: They will not risk trying to bind you again.
Name: Book 1

text: I struggled with an intake of breath.
Name: Book 1

text: He stood and started toward me, about to speak againjust as the door swung open.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles face flushed with anger.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed was through the door and to me in three long strides.
Name: Book 1

text: He grabbed me at the waist, picking me up and spinning me so that my cloak swirled behind.
Name: Book 1

text: The shock and exuberance of his greeting was too much and I couldnt help but let out a breathless laugh.
Name: Book 1

text: He put me down but kept me close, his hands still at my waist.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed, I said, very nearly winded.
Name: Book 1

text: What are you doing here.
Name: Book 1

text: He glanced at Chevelle, who was still plainly annoyed, and his carefree smile dissolved.
Name: Book 1

text: I was heading to Bray and ran across some trackers.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles eyes flicked to my face and then back to Steed.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed dropped his hands from my waist as he winked at me.
Name: Book 1

text: I saw the horses out front and couldnt resist.
Name: Book 1

text: Knew youd be missing me.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to smile, but the thought of trackers had taken the thrill off the unexpected visit.
Name: Book 1

text: The vision of flames was threatening again and I swallowed hard.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle threw on his cloak, hood up.
Name: Book 1

text: Stay here, he ordered me.
Name: Book 1

text: He gestured toward Steed, who turned to follow him outside.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt sure how long theyd be gone; I went to one of the narrow windows on the front wall and peered cautiously out.
Name: Book 1

text: They were nowhere to be seen, but the sights of the village distracted me quickly enough.
Name: Book 1

text: It was so unlike home.
Name: Book 1

text: Night gave the gray stones an even darker appearance, the firelight glinting off their ragged edges like polished onyx.
Name: Book 1

text: Torches lit each walkway and building.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed late, but several villagers were still outside, loud and boisterous.
Name: Book 1

text: Nearly everyone dressed in black, a few of the men bearing large silver breastplates or wrist cuffs.
Name: Book 1

text: Most wore leather, laced tight against thick, muscled frames.
Name: Book 1

text: Few were thin or as petite as the elves I was used to seeing.
Name: Book 1

text: These were strong, like Chevelle and Steed.
Name: Book 1

text: All had dark hair as well.
Name: Book 1

text: And then there was red hair.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby.
Name: Book 1

text: She was approaching the house and I was alone.
Name: Book 1

text: Part of me wondered if I was fast enough to get to my room before she came in.
Name: Book 1

text: I hadnt made up my mind before the door opened beside me.
Name: Book 1

text: She smiled wickedly as she neared, coming uncomfortably close.
Name: Book 1

text: She leaned in further and something glistened in the air between us.
Name: Book 1

text: I froze, unable to move away.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles voice was sharp as the redhead was whisked away from me, laughing.
Name: Book 1

text: Her curls brushed my face on their way past, taking my head on a dizzying spin.
Name: Book 1

text: Just having a little fun, Vattier, she said.
Name: Book 1

text: It sounded too far away.
Name: Book 1

text: Or as if I were in a tunnel.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle was reprimanding her, and then at once they were gone.
Name: Book 1

text: My head swirled and I felt off balance.
Name: Book 1

text: I started to stumble, but a strong hand caught my arm.
Name: Book 1

text: Steeds voice beside me drew me from the stupor.
Name: Book 1

text: A little fairy dust.
Name: Book 1

text: Breath of the siren.
Name: Book 1

text: Wha.
Name: Book 1

text: My tongue was thick.
Name: Book 1

text: I could hear the smile in his voice.
Name: Book 1

text: My nose tingled and I scrunched it up, giggling at the feeling.
Name: Book 1

text: I shook my head, trying to clear it.
Name: Book 1

text: How do you feel.
Name: Book 1

text: Weird.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, thats normal.
Name: Book 1

text: Hot, I said, unclasping my cloak and tossing it off behind me.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe you should sit down, he warned.
Name: Book 1

text: That sounded like a good idea.
Name: Book 1

text: I asked, unable to form full sentences.
Name: Book 1

text: Half fairy, half elf.
Name: Book 1

text: He sat in a chair as he started to answer and I kept moving past the bench where I intended to land and crawled onto his lap, curling my feet up, knees to my chest.
Name: Book 1

text: His voice seemed mesmerizing as he continued, Her mother was a fairy from the West.
Name: Book 1

text: I wrapped my arms around my legs, holding my knees tight, and placed my chin there to rest my head.
Name: Book 1

text: It was all I could do to pay attention to his words, but I was fascinated by their sound.
Name: Book 1

text: Her father was a dark elf.
Name: Book 1

text: When her mother died during childbirth, he left her here in the village.
Name: Book 1

text: I suppose it was for the best, really, since she cant fly.
Name: Book 1

text: The fairies would have tormented her.
Name: Book 1

text: Shes still a bit of an outcast though.
Name: Book 1

text: He was still talking as I struggled to catch up in my head.
Name: Book 1

text: I interrupted him, unable to stop myself.
Name: Book 1

text: I had no idea why I was speaking.
Name: Book 1

text: I batted my eyes and tried to shake it off, concentrating on Steed again.
Name: Book 1

text: He seemed to notice I was back and continued his story.
Name: Book 1

text: I leaned my head on his chest, snuggling into his warmth.
Name: Book 1

text: My face felt numb.
Name: Book 1

text: Somewhere in the distance, the door opened and the vibration in Steeds chest quieted as his words cut off.
Name: Book 1

text: My head turned dazedly toward the door, keeping it steady against Steed.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles furious gaze flicked to my cloak piled on the floor before returning to us.
Name: Book 1

text: Us.
Name: Book 1

text: I was curled in Steeds lap.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle stormed toward us.
Name: Book 1

text: The arm wrapped around my back loosened but Steeds body didnt seem to tense.
Name: Book 1

text: I giggled a little for no apparent reason and then tried to straighten myself so I wasnt cuddling with him.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle held his arm out and I wondered foggily if he intended to strike one of us, which made me laugh again.
Name: Book 1

text: He shook his head, plainly disapproving, and a flagon landed in his open palm.
Name: Book 1

text: He knelt in front of us.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, I was thirsty.
Name: Book 1

text: I took a long pull and then another.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt seem to quench the thirst.
Name: Book 1

text: He took the container from my hand.
Name: Book 1

text: My stomach roiled and I realized what I had drunk.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought I might hurl.
Name: Book 1

text: How much of that healing crap had I drunk.
Name: Book 1

text: I heaved once and Steed shook beneath me with laughter.
Name: Book 1

text: I glanced up to find him looking at Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: For some reason it angered me, even though I knew Steed wasnt laughing at him.
Name: Book 1

text: I was talking again, without regard to thought.
Name: Book 1

text: His mother died, too.
Name: Book 1

text: It sounded so matter-of-fact, my head bobbing along with the words.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt seem to stop.
Name: Book 1

text: My mouth opened to speak once more but I was suddenly swept up, off Steeds lap and into Chevelles arms.
Name: Book 1

text: I managed fear for half a second but then lost the feeling to dizziness, followed quickly by only dull numbness.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle was laying me on my bed.
Name: Book 1

text: His words were gentle now, the anger gone.
Name: Book 1

text: Im sorry, I whispered.
Name: Book 1

text: He leaned over me to straighten the bedding, his face close to mine.
Name: Book 1

text: I stared at his mouth, wondering briefly what it might taste like.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt a sharp pain and realized I was biting my lip.
Name: Book 1

text: The thought made me giggle again, but Chevelles eyes shot to my face and all amusement ceased.
Name: Book 1

text: He stroked my cheek lightly with the back of his hand.
Name: Book 1

text: My dreams were vivid.
Name: Book 1

text: Crimson curls brushing my cheek and bouncing as a slender fairy danced across the floor, flitting her painted fingers.
Name: Book 1

text: Stone houses in the night, the glare of fire glinting off the rock.
Name: Book 1

text: Massive stones rising high above.
Name: Book 1

text: Dark leather, tight against my skin.
Name: Book 1

text: Cloaks flowing in the wind, forming a circle and then massing together, threatening.
Name: Book 1

text: Black hair glistening with sweat in the moonlight and rolling in rhythm as the horse ran, its mane rocking hypnotically with the motion.
Name: Book 1

text: Its heavy equine smell, so unlike any other.
Name: Book 1

text: I clung to Chevelles strong back as we rode at full speed.
Name: Book 1

text: The wind and rain cut at my face, my eyes sore, cheeks streaked with tears and ash.
Name: Book 1

text: I woke startled to the sound of laughter.
Name: Book 1

text: It took several minutes to gather my thoughts enough to know where I was.
Name: Book 1

text: In bed at Rubys.
Name: Book 1

text: I was drenched in sweat.
Name: Book 1

text: Something had happened to me.
Name: Book 1

text: Fairy dust, Steed had said.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, he had shown up last night.
Name: Book 1

text: Voices echoed through the open door.
Name: Book 1

text: He was in the main room.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle was there, too.
Name: Book 1

text: My mouth tasted sour.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to sit up but my head spun.
Name: Book 1

text: Before Id moved an inch I was back down.
Name: Book 1

text: My pulse pounded in my temples as I struggled to recall what had happened the night before.
Name: Book 1

text: I hissed out a low oath when I remembered Ruby leaning toward me, blowing her glitter in my face.
Name: Book 1

text: My eyes opened again to find Chevelle offering me a glass.
Name: Book 1

text: I winced, unsure of what exactly I had said to him.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew it was bad, but couldnt quite piece it back together.
Name: Book 1

text: I glanced up at him timidly.
Name: Book 1

text: Thank you, I croaked as I took the cup, my hand trembling.
Name: Book 1

text: Shouldnt have left you alone, he said quietly.
Name: Book 1

text: There was a tinkling laugh in the front room and I groaned.
Name: Book 1

text: She was here, too.
Name: Book 1

text: I was able to sit up with Chevelles assistance.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby swirled into the room, dressed in a red frock of sorts.
Name: Book 1

text: The color hurt my eyes.
Name: Book 1

text: Here, a bath will help.
Name: Book 1

text: Come with me, dear.
Name: Book 1

text: Her hair was tied halfway back with a scarf, the tattered ends mingling with crimson curls.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt dizzy again.
Name: Book 1

text: She hauled me off the bed, supporting me as I stood.
Name: Book 1

text: She was much smaller than I had thought, slipping easily under my arm.
Name: Book 1

text: I kept my head down as we walked, mostly trying not to get ill, but also unable to look Steed in the eyes.
Name: Book 1

text: I watched Rubys heeled boots as she led me through the main room and to the door to her bedroom.
Name: Book 1

text: A little cold for lake bathing here.
Name: Book 1

text: She led me to a large basin in the corner of her room.
Name: Book 1

text: Water streamed in from the window and filled it halfway.
Name: Book 1

text: Ive laid out some clothes for you and there are some lovely soaps on the table.
Name: Book 1

text: She spun and glided out of the room, closing the door behind her, and all I could think was, Lovely soaps.
Name: Book 1

text: I examined the room as I undressed.
Name: Book 1

text: A large bed topped with decorated pillows and colorful blankets centered the opposite wall, twice the size of the one Id been using.
Name: Book 1

text: A tall rack in the corner was draped with materialsdeep violet and emerald-green silks, dark wools, and a rainbow of patterned scarves.
Name: Book 1

text: Shelves alongside were filled full with curiosities and a few books lay on the bedside table near a lantern.
Name: Book 1

text: I stepped into the tub, sinking down as lavender-scented steam rose to dampen my face and hair.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed to be helping, so I closed my eyes and relaxed.
Name: Book 1

text: The water started to chill several times, but I was hesitant to get out.
Name: Book 1

text: At the risk of boiling myself, I eased the magic Id been using to reheat the bath.
Name: Book 1

text: Finally, I felt well enough to stand.
Name: Book 1

text: I picked up one of the soaps and washed quickly, then pulled the water from the tub to rinse the suds away.
Name: Book 1

text: Id not had much opportunity to practice with water; I added it to the list of things to work on.
Name: Book 1

text: It had been a long journey, and the bath was refreshing.
Name: Book 1

text: The soap left a light fragrance in the air, smelling like morning and cold, and I wondered if the fairy dust was still affecting me.
Name: Book 1

text: I dried off and dressed in the clothes Ruby had put out for me.
Name: Book 1

text: They were a little snug, but not enough to have been her castoffs.
Name: Book 1

text: The room had its own full-length mirror and I giggled at my reflection.
Name: Book 1

text: It was certainly not an outfit Id choose for myself.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt say I looked bad though.
Name: Book 1

text: I turned away, still painfully unaccustomed to my new appearance, and tugged down the hem of the short leather top.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed let out a whistle as I entered the main room.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby sat beside him, a warm smile on her face as if we were old friends.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle was near a window on the front wall, leaning on one shoulder, his body turned toward me, expression impossible to read.
Name: Book 1

text: I was polite, but it burned a little to thank her after what shed done.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed smiled, shaking his head from side to side with exaggerated slowness.
Name: Book 1

text: He looked like he was trying to keep a secret.
Name: Book 1

text: Heat crawled up my neck as I remembered climbing into his lap, and then again the second time Id gotten out of bed.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby grinned at him conspiratorially.
Name: Book 1

text: Had I talked in my sleep.
Name: Book 1

text: Could this get any worse.
Name: Book 1

text: It came back to me then.
Name: Book 1

text: I dropped into a chair, my head falling into my hands to cover my face.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby started to say something, but Chevelle cut her off.
Name: Book 1

text: Wont you offer your guest breakfast.
Name: Book 1

text: A plate of food landed on the table in front of me with a slap.
Name: Book 1

text: Thank you, I managed.
Name: Book 1

text: I was hungry, despite the embarrassment.
Name: Book 1

text: I grabbed the plate and started eating.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby and Steed were sitting across from me.
Name: Book 1

text: She was reclined, her bare legs showing where the material of her skirt was pulled to the side.
Name: Book 1

text: When I looked up, she resituated herself, leaning toward Steed and talking low about some nonsense.
Name: Book 1

text: She walked her fingers up his chest as she talked, glancing at me for a reaction.
Name: Book 1

text: She was trying to make me jealous.
Name: Book 1

text: I was suddenly furious.
Name: Book 1

text: Shed poisoned me and now this.
Name: Book 1

text: I wanted to burn her right then and there.
Name: Book 1

text: I caught Chevelles expression as I glared at her.
Name: Book 1

text: He had seen what she was doing, knew her motives most likely, but I could tell he thought it had worked.
Name: Book 1

text: He thought I was jealous.
Name: Book 1

text: I smelled something odd and glanced down.
Name: Book 1

text: The meat I was holding had burnt in my hand.
Name: Book 1

text: I cursed, dropping it onto the plate.
Name: Book 1

text: When I looked back to them, Steed was watching me, smiling.
Name: Book 1

text: I tossed the burned meat onto the table, considering going back to bed.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby laughed and it made my hair stand on end.
Name: Book 1

text: She might be our host now but Id get my chance.
Name: Book 1

text: She shifted and the markings on her leg caught my attention.
Name: Book 1

text: A thin painted vine trailed up to her thigh.
Name: Book 1

text: She noticed me looking.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, Frey, I feel like I know so much about you.
Name: Book 1

text: She smiled slyly at Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: But you know so little of me.
Name: Book 1

text: Let me tell you a few things, since we will be traveling together.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt my head jerk to find Chevelle, not believing what I had just heard.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby continued without pause.
Name: Book 1

text: Im sure youve heard by now Im an amalgamation, a half-breed.
Name: Book 1

text: She said the last part with distaste and glanced at Steed.
Name: Book 1

text: I will give you a short version of events so when the subject comes upand believe me, someone will askyou are not overcome by curiosity and forced to seek less than honorable venues to discover the facts.
Name: Book 1

text: I chose to ignore the jab about my eavesdropping.
Name: Book 1

text: My mother was a power-hungry wench seeking notoriety.
Name: Book 1

text: She was an elemental fairy and, like me, sported a fine head of red hair.
Name: Book 1

text: She ran a hand under the curls for emphasis.
Name: Book 1

text: She heard a story one day of a mixed-species birth and got it in her head she could breed a more powerful magic.
Name: Book 1

text: Apparently she thought she could control her offspring and use the magic to her advantage.
Name: Book 1

text: I suppose she thought she could rule the world.
Name: Book 1

text: She studied various species for a few moons and decided her best chance at conquest was a dark elf.
Name: Book 1

text: She made her way to this very village and happened across my father, poor unsuspecting sap.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby flitted her fingers, glasses and wine served before each of us as she continued.
Name: Book 1

text: So there he was and she, just a wisp of a woman, flew up to him and blew a little fairy dust well, you know about that.
Name: Book 1

text: I narrowed my eyes at her.
Name: Book 1

text: He was putty in her hands.
Name: Book 1

text: It was all over before he even knew her purpose.
Name: Book 1

text: She kept him under her enchantments and lies as long as she could.
Name: Book 1

text: She thought she was safe hiding here in the village but, as you know, an elf birth is a hefty event.
Name: Book 1

text: Upon the hour of my birth, the entire village had gathered to see the new elfat my fathers request, of course.
Name: Book 1

text: Can you imagine the shock when they found my mother was his intended.
Name: Book 1

text: She laughed, but her audience was quiet.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle, expression uncomfortable, turned to watch out the front window.
Name: Book 1

text: Needless to say, it did not go as she had planned.
Name: Book 1

text: At her death, my father was released from her bonds.
Name: Book 1

text: He was horrified at what he had done, at what had been done to him.
Name: Book 1

text: But he hadnt the heart to destroy his crop.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt the tug in my chest at her story, but Rubys eyes were dry and clear.
Name: Book 1

text: I wondered how many times shed told it.
Name: Book 1

text: I hear he wanders the mountain.
Name: Book 1

text: This time it sounded like genuine humor.
Name: Book 1

text: The tension in the room eased a bit.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles tone was respectful as he turned from the window.
Name: Book 1

text: Theyre here.
Name: Book 1

text: she asked.
Name: Book 1

text: He nodded and she rose gracefully from her seat.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, looks like we have some gathering to do.
Name: Book 1

text: We can finish this later.
Name: Book 1

text: She smiled at me as she followed Chevelle out the door.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed sat across from me, quiet.
Name: Book 1

text: Seems so sad, I said.
Name: Book 1

text: I was thinking of Chevelles loss, of my own, and now of Rubys.
Name: Book 1

text: How could we all be without family.
Name: Book 1

text: My mother died years ago, with a large part of the northern clans.
Name: Book 1

text: His mother had died because of my mother.
Name: Book 1

text: The same as Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: I was almost afraid to ask.
Name: Book 1

text: My father wanders the mountain killing fairies.
Name: Book 1

text: You mean Ruby is your sister.
Name: Book 1

text: Half-sister, he emphasized.
Name: Book 1

text: He let me roll that around for a while before he spoke again.
Name: Book 1

text: You know, Ruby told me shed had dealings with the infamous Chevelle Vattier, but I didnt believe her.
Name: Book 1

text: One can never believe the tales of a fairy.
Name: Book 1

text: But imagine my surprise when he walked out of the trees, following a green-eyed beauty.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed smiled at the memory and then turned serious.
Name: Book 1

text: When I ran into the trackers, I had hope Ruby had told the truth and might know where to find you.
Name: Book 1

text: She tried to hide you, but I recognized the horses out front.
Name: Book 1

text: She tried to hide us.
Name: Book 1

text: Ah, yes.
Name: Book 1

text: Fairies are full of treacheries and wickedness.
Name: Book 1

text: Always meddling in the affairs of others, causing trouble whenever possible.
Name: Book 1

text: They have quite a time.
Name: Book 1

text: At least Reds only half wicked.
Name: Book 1

text: I was having trouble wrapping my mind around it all.
Name: Book 1

text: Dont worry, shes had her fun with you.
Name: Book 1

text: Shell be helpful now.
Name: Book 1

text: He grinned and I wasnt sure if it was sarcastic.
Name: Book 1

text: Besides, sounds like youre the biggest trouble going.
Name: Book 1

text: Shed do well to stick around you.
Name: Book 1

text: Ill keep an eye on her, he promised.
Name: Book 1

text: I asked, remembering Rubys announcement.
Name: Book 1

text: Youre traveling with us.
Name: Book 1

text: You dont mind, do you.
Name: Book 1

text: No, of course not, I gushed.
Name: Book 1

text: It was too eager, so I explained, Chevelles been training me.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, we can certainly help with that.
Name: Book 1

text: I grimaced at the thought of Rubys training methods.
Name: Book 1

text: Shes actually very talented.
Name: Book 1

text: An asset, youll see.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby came through the door, in a movement that could nearly have been classified as whirling.
Name: Book 1

text: We need to set you up outside of town.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle is afraid were causing a scene in the village.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed like she was having fun.
Name: Book 1

text: I wondered if that meant she was causing trouble.
Name: Book 1

text: Dont think he trusts you with the girl, Ruby added, smiling playfully.
Name: Book 1

text: I prefer the outdoors anyway.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed dipped toward me, his hand folding his waist in a bow as he stood to go.
Name: Book 1

text: My head was not up for this at all.
Name: Book 1

text: I leaned forward, resting my head on my knees.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle said from beside me.
Name: Book 1

text: I hadnt even heard him come in.
Name: Book 1

text: He was sitting forward on the bench next to me and when I jerked up in surprise, it put us too close.
Name: Book 1

text: I tottered and he steadied me, but didnt move away.
Name: Book 1

text: You smell like morning.
Name: Book 1

text: I bit my lip, heat rising up my neck, but he lingered, breathing in the scent.
Name: Book 1

text: I had been reduced to one-word sentences.
Name: Book 1

text: He nodded, leaning back.
Name: Book 1

text: She does have a way with potions and such.
Name: Book 1

text: I enjoy the mixing, Ruby said, startling me again as she entered the house.
Name: Book 1

text: But not to worry, I keep it contained to elements and minerals, no breeding.
Name: Book 1

text: I leave that to Steed.
Name: Book 1

text: She laughed at her own words as she passed us on the way to her room.
Name: Book 1

text: I found myself reevaluating her now that I knew she was Steeds sister.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle noticed me watching her.
Name: Book 1

text: Do you mind staying with Ru My expression cut him off.
Name: Book 1

text: I have some business to take care of outside of town.
Name: Book 1

text: She has given me her word she will behave.
Name: Book 1

text: He eyed her as he spoke, a warning.
Name: Book 1

text: She replied from the open door of her room, Yes, yes.
Name: Book 1

text: And then, under her breath, On my part.
Name: Book 1

text: No qualifications, Ruby.
Name: Book 1

text: Just teasing.
Name: Book 1

text: Now go, we have stuff to do.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle appeared reluctant to get up.
Name: Book 1

text: For a moment, I thought he might reach out to me, but he only stood and left without another word.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt want him to hate me.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby whirled into the room and grabbed me around the waist from behind, spinning me up, over the back of the seat, and through her door before I could process what was happening.
Name: Book 1

text: She plopped me down in the center of her bed and swung around to sit in front of me.
Name: Book 1

text: My head was reeling from the spin as she smiled at me, waving her hands and bringing a plethora of bottles and canisters flying toward us to drop on the bed.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought with disappointment that I hadnt responded to her attack as Chevelle had taught me and laughed at the image in my head.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby gave me a genuine smile as she began twisting the lid on a small metal canister.
Name: Book 1

text: No mother to teach us the tricks of the trade, she sighed as she leaned in.
Name: Book 1

text: I jerked away from her, wanting to be angry about the comment.
Name: Book 1

text: But Ruby had just told me her own story, no less tragic.
Name: Book 1

text: She mistook my reaction.
Name: Book 1

text: Oh, dont be silly.
Name: Book 1

text: I wouldnt play the same design twice.
Name: Book 1

text: I relaxed, but only a little.
Name: Book 1

text: Besides, I will let you in on a little secret the fairys breath isnt really breath.
Name: Book 1

text: Can you imagine if it were.
Name: Book 1

text: Why, everywhere we go wed cause a terrible ruckus.
Name: Book 1

text: Its a blend, is all.
Name: Book 1

text: We keep it in a tiny capsule in our cheek and when we need it.
Name: Book 1

text: She chomped her teeth together with a click, the look surprisingly feral.
Name: Book 1

text: And then she smiled, her face melting back into something very near adorable as she held a finger to her lips, protecting the secret.
Name: Book 1

text: Old family recipe, you see.
Name: Book 1

text: My mother left a diary.
Name: Book 1

text: She was thoughtful for a moment.
Name: Book 1

text: Ah, what a thing, a mothers diary.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby went silent for too long and I wondered if she would be returning to this one-sided conversation any time soon.
Name: Book 1

text: Her eyes flicked back to me.
Name: Book 1

text: It was very fortunate for me shed kept a journal, you see, for I would have no fairy knowledge without it.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt my brows draw together and tried to smooth my face.
Name: Book 1

text: No, dont feel bad for me.
Name: Book 1

text: With you in such a position.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know what she meant exactly, but she continued, And my dear brother has been there for me all along, helping me with the elf parts.
Name: Book 1

text: She kept talking as she leaned forward, seemingly unaware Id not spoken a word in response.
Name: Book 1

text: Not that shed given me much opportunity.
Name: Book 1

text: I contemplated whether this was her usual behavior toward strangers or if she felt we had a special motherless bond.
Name: Book 1

text: She ran her finger through the substance in the canister and it came out coated in a deep, dark green that had the consistency of grease, which she smeared across the base of my eyelid.
Name: Book 1

text: She continued rambling as she coated various parts of my body with lotions and powders, smoothed my hair with a sweet-scented cream, painted my lips with a soft balm that smelled of spice.
Name: Book 1

text: After she ran out of areas to work with, she opened a tall glass container with black liquid inside and dipped a cut braid of hair into the bottle.
Name: Book 1

text: She drew it out, using the tip to brush an intricate design on the inside of my wrist.
Name: Book 1

text: When she was finished, she leaned over and blew gently on the paint.
Name: Book 1

text: I was anxious to see the finished work.
Name: Book 1

text: I waited impatiently for her to raise her head again and hoped whatever it was wasnt permanent.
Name: Book 1

text: She finally glanced up at me, smiling an easy smile.
Name: Book 1

text: I looked nervously at my wrist.
Name: Book 1

text: A simple outline of a bird with outstretched wings marked the delicate skin at the base of my palm.
Name: Book 1

text: Unbelievably tiny runes surrounded the bottom of its wings, making a pattern appear.
Name: Book 1

text: I smiled as I praised her.
Name: Book 1

text: One eyebrow shot up and she jumped from the bed, grabbing my wrist and pulling me with her.
Name: Book 1

text: I hoped she hadnt smudged the design.
Name: Book 1

text: I checked it as soon as she stopped in front of her mirror and let my arm go.
Name: Book 1

text: It wasnt a question.
Name: Book 1

text: She was proud of her work.
Name: Book 1

text: The eyes that stared back at me in the reflection grew large as they took in her mastery.
Name: Book 1

text: Gone was the girl Id been in the village.
Name: Book 1

text: This woman, dressed in leather and dabbed with war paint, was striking, imposing even.
Name: Book 1

text: Her dark gaze might have been fierce if it werent round with astonishment.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby was thrilled at my response.
Name: Book 1

text: She bounced twice and clapped her hands at her success.
Name: Book 1

text: And then she was over it.
Name: Book 1

text: She fired a look back at me, her hair flipping in the process.
Name: Book 1

text: Im not supposed to take you outside.
Name: Book 1

text: Not supposed to leave you.
Name: Book 1

text: She yanked two cloaks from the corner and tied them on, covering our heads, and led me to the wardrobe by her bed.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt imagine how we could get any more clothes on as she opened the door and started to throw them onto her bed.
Name: Book 1

text: But she leaned out of the wardrobe door to whisper, Come on.
Name: Book 1

text: She stepped into the cabinet, dragging me with her.
Name: Book 1

text: We were standing outside the rear of her house.
Name: Book 1

text: She slid the false wall back in place and grabbed my arm again, our heavy cloaks moving like shadows as we ran from the village.
Name: Book 1

text: We didnt go far before she stopped and jerked me into a squat beside her.
Name: Book 1

text: There was movement a brief distance ahead, a rabbit weaving from the cover of one rock to the next.
Name: Book 1

text: As I watched, a stick shot from the ground and speared the animal through the chest, killing it instantly.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby giggled at me.
Name: Book 1

text: She grabbed her quarry and we rushed back to the house.
Name: Book 1

text: We went to the main room and she started a fire as she easily skinned and gutted the animal.
Name: Book 1

text: The entrails went into an urn beside the fire and I wondered what she used them for before remembering all the containers on her bedroom shelf with a shudder.
Name: Book 1

text: She stretched the pelt to dry while the meat cooked.
Name: Book 1

text: She poured us wine and handed me half of her plunder.
Name: Book 1

text: Its not much, but game close to the village is sparse.
Name: Book 1

text: When we get to the peak, we can trade.
Name: Book 1

text: It is the strangest thing; they herd the animals to town and then corral them to eat at their leisure.
Name: Book 1

text: She shook her head at the absurdity.
Name: Book 1

text: But you havent eaten until youve tasted a fattened beast.
Name: Book 1

text: The peak.
Name: Book 1

text: Concerned, she asked, You dont know where were going.
Name: Book 1

text: I drew a breath, uncertain how to answer.
Name: Book 1

text: I would have been sure not to trust her, but she was traveling with us.
Name: Book 1

text: It was probably best not to tell her, of all people, that I had no clue where I was or where I was going.
Name: Book 1

text: I needed to stay on this path, now more than ever.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles words rolled through my mind.
Name: Book 1

text: He thought I wouldnt give up because Id seen the map.
Name: Book 1

text: Something about that nagged at me, but Ruby waited while I searched for a response.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle opened the door and I knew I was saved from at least that much.
Name: Book 1

text: When he saw me, he was struck still.
Name: Book 1

text: I had forgotten Rubys treatments until she squealed in delight at his response.
Name: Book 1

text: He composed his face again, but shed already marked him.
Name: Book 1

text: Oh, you like it.
Name: Book 1

text: Shes fabulous, isnt she.
Name: Book 1

text: She was so proud of herself, but I could tell Chevelle was embarrassed hed been caught off guard.
Name: Book 1

text: It might have pleased me too, except that I couldnt tell if it was less how I had changed and more the resemblance to my mother.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby offered Chevelle a drink and he sat in a chair beside mine.
Name: Book 1

text: She prattled as she enjoyed the wine, and I tried to focus on her stories instead of the occasional glances he threw my way.
Name: Book 1

text: And then he grabbed my arm.
Name: Book 1

text: I flinched, afraid at the quickness and strength of the move, but he only trailed an index finger gently down my arm, over the design, to stop in the center of my palm.
Name: Book 1

text: My arm relaxed into his grip.
Name: Book 1

text: Its beautiful, isnt it.
Name: Book 1

text: His finger stayed on my palm as he looked up at me.
Name: Book 1

text: His eyes lingered on my mouth for a moment and then met mine, piercing.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed like an accusation, but I had no idea why.
Name: Book 1
