text: I sat, blank-faced, staring back at him, and he turned to Ruby to give her the strangest look.
Name: Book 1

text: She appeared abashed for a moment and then simply shrugged, smiling.
Name: Book 1

text: That answered his accusation and he released my hand, easing back into his chair.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, now that youre back.
Name: Book 1

text: She hopped off her own chair and bounded toward the door.
Name: Book 1

text: I cant wait to visit with our new guests.
Name: Book 1

text: She frowned a little.
Name: Book 1

text: Too bad they cant stay inside with us.
Name: Book 1

text: Frey can have my room, Ill be out all night, and you can take the spare.
Name: Book 1

text: She took one last look at me before she rushed out, apparently satisfied with her project.
Name: Book 1

text: And I was alone with Chevelle again.
Name: Book 1

text: My pulse quickened and I had to remind myself he hated me.
Name: Book 1

text: He was my watcher.
Name: Book 1

text: He was fulfilling a duty.
Name: Book 1

text: Then I realized what Ruby had said and I wondered if my brain would ever be quick enough to keep up.
Name: Book 1

text: He hesitated before answering.
Name: Book 1

text: We will be traveling with some friends.
Name: Book 1

text: He was so vague.
Name: Book 1

text: A formless irritation started to crawl its way to the surface, but I had to remember I had no right to ask.
Name: Book 1

text: These were my captors.
Name: Book 1

text: My fingernails cut into the palm of my hand where the map had been.
Name: Book 1

text: Wed be traveling to the peak, theyd said.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt guess what waited there, but that didnt stop the hope that it was something of my mother, my family.
Name: Book 1

text: But even if it wasnt, Id be that much farther away from the village and council.
Name: Book 1

text: The second bit of Rubys parting comment registered, so I excused myself to her room with a yawn and a short good night.
Name: Book 1

text: I closed the door behind me, and though tired, knew I wouldnt sleep with him in the next room.
Name: Book 1

text: I walked to the back window and stared out into the night.
Name: Book 1

text: Moonlight glinted off Rubys figure in the distance, heading away from the village.
Name: Book 1

text: I just pulled a cloak from the pile on her bed and was out the hidden door behind the wardrobe.
Name: Book 1

text: I ran in a crouch, praying no one spotted me as I gained on her.
Name: Book 1

text: I only once glanced at the house in the fear I wouldnt be able to find my way back.
Name: Book 1

text: If I wanted to catch Ruby, I wouldnt be able to mark my path.
Name: Book 1

text: Her cloaked form leapt over a tall rock and disappeared.
Name: Book 1

text: I hurried forward, sure I was about to lose both her and the route.
Name: Book 1

text: When I topped the rock, I froze, taking a heartbeat too long to drop to my stomach.
Name: Book 1

text: Just over that ridge stood a group of elves, though after my pulse settled, I didnt think theyd seen me before Id fallen back.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt quite close enough to hear, but didnt see a better vantage point.
Name: Book 1

text: I squinted, examining the figures.
Name: Book 1

text: Rubys red curls gave her away.
Name: Book 1

text: She had tossed back the hood of her cloak and was laughing with a large elf.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed, I was almost sure because of his stance.
Name: Book 1

text: I scanned the darkness and found two other figures.
Name: Book 1

text: One was about the size of Steed; the other was thinner and appeared fidgety, even in the darkness.
Name: Book 1

text: They approached Ruby and Steed and out of the shadows I could see their dark hair.
Name: Book 1

text: The thinner ones hair was long, his bangs falling over sharp features.
Name: Book 1

text: I studied their gestures in the moonlight, occasionally catching a few words.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed they were planning, but I couldnt be sure.
Name: Book 1

text: There was movement again in the shadows as more figures approached.
Name: Book 1

text: I inched forward, anticipating when they would come into view.
Name: Book 1

text: One of the forms was a mass, low to the ground.
Name: Book 1

text: I squinted to see better and I almost screamed as a hand wrapped around my biceps with fierce strength, jerking me to my feet.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to see my attacker, to think of the magic to protect myself.
Name: Book 1

text: What are you doing.
Name: Book 1

text: It would have been a yell it if wasnt hissed.
Name: Book 1

text: The tone was harsh and I recognized it at once.
Name: Book 1

text: Part of me was saying calm down, but the other was screaming I was still in danger.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt have an answer.
Name: Book 1

text: What was I doing.
Name: Book 1

text: He released his grip just a fraction.
Name: Book 1

text: I went to your room and you were gone.
Name: Book 1

text: He shook his head.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought I had to come out here to get a search party.
Name: Book 1

text: I, uh you were in my room.
Name: Book 1

text: He straightened, his expression making it clear he hadnt expected that response.
Name: Book 1

text: I pressed, taking the chance.
Name: Book 1

text: I heard movement behind me and the fear returned tenfold.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle didnt tense; he only let out an exasperated breath.
Name: Book 1

text: Its fine, he said.
Name: Book 1

text: He released me and I turned to see who hed addressed.
Name: Book 1

text: Four figures stood in a line, almost a formation, and they relaxed at his words.
Name: Book 1

text: My arm tingled as the blood returned to the limb, freed of his harsh grip.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, he hates me.
Name: Book 1

text: I flexed my fist.
Name: Book 1

text: Ah, she escaped, Ruby purred.
Name: Book 1

text: And you didnt trust me with her.
Name: Book 1

text: The formation broke as Steed came to stand beside me, the corner of his mouth tipping into a grin.
Name: Book 1

text: I stared at the group.
Name: Book 1

text: I had no idea who they were, but from the way they spoke it was apparently no secret I was Chevelles prisoner.
Name: Book 1

text: Frey, Chevelle said, this is Anvil.
Name: Book 1

text: He nodded toward a giant of a man who bowed his head respectfully.
Name: Book 1

text: The wiry man bent and straightened, his movements too quick.
Name: Book 1

text: I drew in a startled breath as two more figures came into view.
Name: Book 1

text: A pair of slender elves stepped in sync as they stopped just outside the group.
Name: Book 1

text: They were tall and lean, dressed in robes the color of ash that only accentuated their shocking silver hair.
Name: Book 1

text: I was convinced the moonlight must have been exaggerating it.
Name: Book 1

text: And then I jumped again as, on either side of them, two beasts walked forward to stand just in front of the twinned elves.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed brushed an arm against mine, mumbling under his breath, Yeah, theyre not from around here.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt myself leaning on Chevelle for support.
Name: Book 1

text: Rhys and Rider Strong, he said from behind me.
Name: Book 1

text: They nodded and I was surprised the small gesture also seemed in step.
Name: Book 1

text: A strange whine emanated from one of the dogs as they shifted to sit on their haunches.
Name: Book 1

text: By their size, I might have guessed they were wolves, but Id never known a wolf to be tamed.
Name: Book 1

text: Their fur matched the robes of their masters, down to the black trim.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt be certain in the light, but I thought there was even some silver showing.
Name: Book 1

text: Surely they would be less frightening in the light of day.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby broke the tense atmosphere with a curtsey.
Name: Book 1

text: I attempted a smile for her, not missing the silent exchange between Steed and Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: They were trying to decide what to do with me.
Name: Book 1

text: Since youre apparently not ready to retire for the evening, I suppose we will resume your training, Chevelle said.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle gave her a doubtful look and then glanced at me, apparently deciding I deserved it.
Name: Book 1

text: He nodded once and walked toward the rock ledge.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby bounced from foot to foot, celebrating her victory.
Name: Book 1

text: As Chevelle moved past Anvil and Grey, they turned to follow him.
Name: Book 1

text: The silver-haired elves and their dogs were nowhere in sight.
Name: Book 1

text: My gaze caught Steed, who was watching me.
Name: Book 1

text: I always forgot how strikingly handsome he was until I looked right at him.
Name: Book 1

text: He wore a thin, loose shirt now, rolled at the sleeves and covered by a leather vest.
Name: Book 1

text: It matched the long cuffs on his forearms, the same dark, worn leather of his saddles.
Name: Book 1

text: He stepped closer, taking my chin in his hand to examine my face in the moonlight.
Name: Book 1

text: He purred something toward Ruby about her decorations and gave me a wink as he walked off in the direction Chevelle had gone.
Name: Book 1

text: We were alone then, Ruby and I, and I was sure this was going to hurt more than my other training.
Name: Book 1

text: She untied her cloak and tossed it to land with a muffled sound on the rocks.
Name: Book 1

text: She was smiling a touch as she reached a hand across her waist, closing her fist around a black hoop Id not seen before.
Name: Book 1

text: She drew it out and around as a long black trail curved in its wake and came to rest at her side.
Name: Book 1

text: My mouth went dry.
Name: Book 1

text: Oh yes, this would hurt.
Name: Book 1

text: I loosed my cloak and pitched it aside, lowering myself in a defensive stance, hands out and ready.
Name: Book 1

text: Blood trickled from the strike point.
Name: Book 1

text: Okay, we start slower.
Name: Book 1

text: She considered for a moment.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe we work on your attacks instead of defense.
Name: Book 1

text: I relaxed my stance.
Name: Book 1

text: Um, I dont really have any attacks.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, then, I suppose we had better focus on getting you some.
Name: Book 1

text: She was talking to herself now.
Name: Book 1

text: My mind started to wander as I listened for sounds from the men below.
Name: Book 1

text: What are they doing there.
Name: Book 1

text: Im afraid we will have to use your anger, she said, a smile creeping into the corner of her lips.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed to work with your lunch.
Name: Book 1

text: I remembered the meat I had burnt and flushed.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, this will do, she hummed with a sly grin.
Name: Book 1

text: Let me see yes, Ive got it.
Name: Book 1

text: She began stepping a slow circle around me, talking as she moved, suddenly cat-like.
Name: Book 1

text: The dreams you had after the fairy dust, do you remember them.
Name: Book 1

text: I have a few questions, you see.
Name: Book 1

text: You had plenty to say about someone as you slept.
Name: Book 1

text: You mentioned how his mouth tasted muscles under his shirt.
Name: Book 1

text: And, well, I was curious just who you meant.
Name: Book 1

text: It couldnt have been Chevelle; you should have seen his face.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed was certainly enjoying it, but, my dear, he wont spill the secret to me.
Name: Book 1

text: Whose strong back were you wrapped around, whose dark eyes I was mortified.
Name: Book 1

text: There was nowhere to go, it was too much, and it turned to fury as she continued.
Name: Book 1

text: The flames that had been coursing through me burst in my hands.
Name: Book 1

text: She laughed and tossed her head.
Name: Book 1

text: Oh you should have heard it.
Name: Book 1

text: You gave us such interesting details.
Name: Book 1

text: The image of Chevelle hearing my dreams, the sound of their laughter when I woke.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew what she wanted and I gave it to her.
Name: Book 1

text: Fire shot from my hands toward her, hotter than any Id ever produced.
Name: Book 1

text: The warmth hit my face and Rubys heeled boots sloshed as snow melted beneath her feet.
Name: Book 1

text: She batted away the flames and smiled.
Name: Book 1

text: Come now, youll have to do better than that.
Name: Book 1

text: Let me try harder.
Name: Book 1

text: She flicked her wrist, and the end of her whip caught my ankle so fast I hadnt even realized it was moving.
Name: Book 1

text: She jerked and my leg came out from under me, my hip slamming flat on the ground.
Name: Book 1

text: The pain stole the heat from my anger, and I struggled to stand.
Name: Book 1

text: The whip struck at my head, forcing me back down.
Name: Book 1

text: She circled me, cracking the whip every time I attempted to right myself.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt get a foothold.
Name: Book 1

text: Come now, Freya, you must defend yourself.
Name: Book 1

text: She was faster now, cracking the whip above me and at each side, moving again and again, closer and closer.
Name: Book 1

text: I had to think of something but my mind could only concentrate on the snap of her whip.
Name: Book 1

text: Her boots splashed in the melted snow again, and I sent the icy water racing up under the material of her skirt to her bare legs.
Name: Book 1

text: Shock crossed her face and I hoped it would buy the time I needed.
Name: Book 1

text: The cold water had thrown her for no more than a fraction of a second, but it was enough time to right myself and execute one quick attack.
Name: Book 1

text: I volleyed a nearby rock, which struck her in the back of the head and threw her balance off for another instant.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew I was larger than her so I gritted my teeth and lunged, grabbing her as I tried to figure my next move.
Name: Book 1

text: She raised her face and, when her eyes met mine, they narrowed.
Name: Book 1

text: Part of me was aware I should have been scared, but I was enjoying myself.
Name: Book 1

text: Whatever pain I might receive didnt factor; I had wanted to hurt this wicked little redhead since the first time Id seen her, since her hand reached out seductively toward Chevelle and collected my ruby.
Name: Book 1

text: My palms lit where they wrapped around her arms.
Name: Book 1

text: I would finally burn her.
Name: Book 1

text: She cocked one eyebrow at me.
Name: Book 1

text: Half fire fairy, silly.
Name: Book 1

text: And I flew through the air to land with a heavy thump a few yards away.
Name: Book 1

text: Well, it was a little unconventional, but at least youre thinking on your feet, she mused, straightening the material of her skirt.
Name: Book 1

text: And then she giggled as she realized I was, in fact, not on my feet.
Name: Book 1

text: My body ached as I stood and my best skill was useless.
Name: Book 1

text: I desperately wanted to ask her to show me the way, but my ego stubbornly refused.
Name: Book 1

text: She must have picked up my mood.
Name: Book 1

text: You see, most of us choose one particular favorite.
Name: Book 1

text: We focus on that and practice constantly.
Name: Book 1

text: That way it becomes easier, uses less energy, you know.
Name: Book 1

text: Maybe we should see what your strong suit is, she said and motioned me to follow her as she walked to the rock ridge and jumped over, hurrying down to the men.
Name: Book 1

text: Sorry to interrupt, gentlemen, she announced.
Name: Book 1

text: I was wondering if youd mind a little demonstration.
Name: Book 1

text: They broke their circle to give her their attention.
Name: Book 1

text: Frey here hasnt found her rhythm yet, she explained.
Name: Book 1

text: They seemed to understand and she bounded back over to me and drew me to sit beside her on a large rock facing the men before cueing them to begin.
Name: Book 1

text: The largest stepped forward, boasting deep brown hair and eyes.
Name: Book 1

text: He wore plain clothing but his broad shoulders and massive size made him seem regal.
Name: Book 1

text: They name me Anvil but I am Reed, of Keithar Peak.
Name: Book 1

text: His voice was thick, though it was impossible to tell whether it was an accent or he had difficulty speaking.
Name: Book 1

text: He was huge, frighteningly so, but something about him drew me in.
Name: Book 1

text: I wanted to be his friend for no reason I could rationalize.
Name: Book 1

text: He walked to me and reached out his hand in greeting.
Name: Book 1

text: As I took it in mine, a tingle ran up my arm, the fine hairs standing on end.
Name: Book 1

text: I will try to avoid touching you.
Name: Book 1

text: Its fine, really, I said, though I didnt understand.
Name: Book 1

text: It was like a static charge.
Name: Book 1

text: Meanwhile, I had decided the thickness was a drawl.
Name: Book 1

text: I dont know your accent.
Name: Book 1

text: Where is it from.
Name: Book 1

text: North Camber, he replied.
Name: Book 1

text: A snicker slipped from Steed and Anvil glanced at him before amending, Well, that is where they cut out part of my tongue.
Name: Book 1

text: I recoiled, wrenching my hand from his.
Name: Book 1

text: He didnt seem offended; he simply took a few steps backward to start his demonstration.
Name: Book 1

text: I brought my arm back to my side and it brushed Ruby, shocking her just enough to make both of us flinch.
Name: Book 1

text: She only smiled as she returned her attention to the start of the show.
Name: Book 1

text: The other men drew back, some sitting, some standing, but all giving him their full attention and space as he raised his hands and braced himself, taking one full deep breath before shifting forward, ever so slightly.
Name: Book 1

text: A thunderous crack and excruciating light flew from both of his outstretched hands, slammed into a tall pine, and snapped the top third of the tree off.
Name: Book 1

text: Several limbs splintered and popped as it crashed its way down.
Name: Book 1

text: I stared in open-mouthed astonishment.
Name: Book 1

text: Sweat glistened on the large mans forehead and his breath was a little labored, but still, he stood.
Name: Book 1

text: He had shot lightning from his hands.
Name: Book 1

text: The others nodded appreciatively, but I was having second thoughts about friendship with this man.
Name: Book 1

text: Though not being his friend was probably more dangerous.
Name: Book 1

text: I was shaking my head in disbelief as he turned back to me and bowed.
Name: Book 1

text: He stepped back, taking a seat as the wiry man stepped inside the circle then.
Name: Book 1

text: He nodded to me.
Name: Book 1

text: Grey.
Name: Book 1

text: He was thoughtful for a moment, deciding the best way to display his skill, before finally approaching to offer his hand.
Name: Book 1

text: I reached forward, placing my palm against his, and then he was gone.
Name: Book 1

text: His entire body had vanished.
Name: Book 1

text: I half expected to feel his touchperhaps hed merely camouflaged himselfbut my hand was empty.
Name: Book 1

text: I looked around, baffled.
Name: Book 1

text: The makeshift audience wore easy, amused smiles.
Name: Book 1

text: They watched me, not the vacant space from which Grey had evidently disappeared.
Name: Book 1

text: And then I noticed someone beside me who hadnt been there before it was him.
Name: Book 1

text: But he was gone again.
Name: Book 1

text: Id been staring right at him and had no idea where hed gone.
Name: Book 1

text: I was just beginning to doubt whether Id seen him at all when I spotted him standing across the circle, grinning fiendishly while he dangled an object from his hands.
Name: Book 1

text: It was the feather Ruby had tied in my hair.
Name: Book 1

text: Id forgotten about it.
Name: Book 1

text: I reached up to feel for it and it was gone.
Name: Book 1

text: I started to get irritated but then the feather was in my other hand and he was back, his hands now empty.
Name: Book 1

text: And then, for no apparent reason but amusement, he did a few somersaults and landed in the center of the circle, smiling.
Name: Book 1

text: I could only shake my head as Ruby clapped beside me, clearly thrilled with the show.
Name: Book 1

text: I thought I must have missed something.
Name: Book 1

text: Grey bowed out of the circle and was replaced by the two tall, silvery elves.
Name: Book 1

text: I found myself startled again; I had not seen them sitting with the group, or anywhere else.
Name: Book 1

text: For some reason, it was much more eerie than the little wiry man who blinked in and out of vision.
Name: Book 1

text: One of the men spoke, his tone formal.
Name: Book 1

text: We will not demonstrate their full power at this time, in fear of shorting our forces a man for mere display.
Name: Book 1

text: I assumed he was probably joking.
Name: Book 1

text: As you can see, they can be frightening, however, without attack.
Name: Book 1

text: At that, the dogs walked into the circle.
Name: Book 1

text: I had not seen them either, before they were approaching their masters.
Name: Book 1

text: They came forward to snarl, one regarding Ruby and one Steed, and I could only be glad it wasnt me as their muzzles pulled back and exposed a vicious set of teeth, complete with meat-tearing fangs.
Name: Book 1

text: The hair rose on their backs and I was suddenly positive they were larger than Ruby.
Name: Book 1

text: A horrific growl ripped from their chests in unison and I cringed.
Name: Book 1

text: Then, at once, they settled back into relaxed seated positions as if they had never been angry.
Name: Book 1

text: We also do not do tricks.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, there was humor there.
Name: Book 1

text: I was relieved to see the intimidating pair might not be as strict as Id imagined.
Name: Book 1

text: We will return to watch.
Name: Book 1

text: They inclined their heads and walked out of the circle in unison, disappearing from view.
Name: Book 1

text: I twisted the feather I was holding in my hand.
Name: Book 1

text: How remarkable it must be to master a beast.
Name: Book 1

text: I wouldnt have to be battered during training then, I thought, and winced at the idea of Ruby cracking one of those wolf-dogs with her whip.
Name: Book 1

text: Chapter Eleven An Education.
Name: Book 1

text: The next morning, Ruby was in the main room waiting for me.
Name: Book 1

text: She instructed me to bathe and change; we would be spending the day training.
Name: Book 1

text: I followed her directives, but couldnt decide whether to be grateful or worried when the clothes shed laid out for me were plainly meant for a hard day.
Name: Book 1

text: It was still early as we stole out the back, cloaks covering our heads as we made our way to the ridge.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed, Chevelle, Grey, and Anvil were already there.
Name: Book 1

text: I imagined the othersRhys, Rider, and their dogswere somewhere near, though I couldnt see them.
Name: Book 1

text: Watchdogs, I thought, all four.
Name: Book 1

text: It was comforting, but Ruby wasted no time in getting to training.
Name: Book 1

text: She immediately trounced me.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt all kinds of defeated before wed gone half an hour.
Name: Book 1

text: After watching us for a while, Steed stepped in to save me.
Name: Book 1

text: Freyhed converted to the nickname the others used in place of the sunnier oneswhy dont you take a break for a while.
Name: Book 1

text: Let us spar so you can watch.
Name: Book 1

text: Well give you a few pointers.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know if I liked the idea of the group sparring, whether it gave me a break from the torture or not, but Grey stepped forward and my opinion no longer mattered.
Name: Book 1

text: Just watch and learn.
Name: Book 1

text: I backed away and sat cross-legged on the ground.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby joined me; I could tell she was excited.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed everything excited Ruby.
Name: Book 1

text: Everything that makes me nervous, I amended in my head.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed and Grey stood opposite each other in the center of the clearing we circled.
Name: Book 1

text: A cursory nod at one another signaled the onset of the bout and both tensed and crouched slightly into a ready stance.
Name: Book 1

text: I found myself leaning forward as we waited.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle moved to stand beside me, he too intent.
Name: Book 1

text: Grey wagged his eyebrows at Steed, taunting him to make the first move.
Name: Book 1

text: Come on, blossom, Steed teased back, lets see what youve got.
Name: Book 1

text: At that, Grey disappeared and then, in a flash, was behind Steed, reaching up to smack him in the back of the head.
Name: Book 1

text: The instant before he struck, Steed ducked into a squat and spun, taking Greys legs out from under him.
Name: Book 1

text: Grey was gone again, this time reappearing midair in a flip above Steeds head, reaching down to tag him on the way by.
Name: Book 1

text: It was a loud smack.
Name: Book 1

text: I was sure it had stung.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed stood still, focused on the spot where Grey had landed and was flickering in and out of view.
Name: Book 1

text: I made an effort to consider possible responses in my head, but was coming up blank.
Name: Book 1

text: The nerves were gone.
Name: Book 1

text: I found myself wanting Steed to win and leaned with his strikes, tensing as if they were my own.
Name: Book 1

text: Grey bounded through the air once more, showing off, confident in his evident lead, and then a small rock rose at chest height in front of Steed.
Name: Book 1

text: I was trying to figure out who had lifted it when Grey flashed back into view, hesitating only a moment as he considered the rock.
Name: Book 1

text: At once, his face changed; he knew hed been beaten.
Name: Book 1

text: As hed paused to study the floating rock, Steed had immobilized him and, just like that, the match was over.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby leaned into me, voice soft.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed is stronger than Grey.
Name: Book 1

text: He only needed to catch him.
Name: Book 1

text: Grey conceded, his walk slower, movements no longer jerky as he made his way out of the makeshift ring.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed threw me a quick wink.
Name: Book 1

text: Anvil approached next, stepping into the same starting position Grey had used, and Steed shifted several paces back before he readied himself and nodded toward his new opponent.
Name: Book 1

text: I remembered the tree and was suddenly afraid for him.
Name: Book 1

text: Would Anvil use the same method on a person.
Name: Book 1

text: A thunderous crack answered my unspoken question.
Name: Book 1

text: The lightning bolt was faster than my eyes at such a close distance, by the time I looked at Steed, there was nothing but a wall of water.
Name: Book 1

text: He had constructed a barrier of sorts, caught the strike and redirected it around himself by melting the snow that spotted the mountain.
Name: Book 1

text: Anvil was winded, though the strike wasnt as severe as his previous show.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed would unquestionably be the winner now and as he took aim to retaliate, his opponent raised his hands in surrender.
Name: Book 1

text: Quick thinking, Mister Summit.
Name: Book 1

text: The large man grinned and I was in no doubt they were old friends.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle stepped forward then, eager.
Name: Book 1

text: I had a feeling hed been itching for this the way Id been itching to burn Ruby.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed smiled in acceptance, but not the same smile hed given his last opponent.
Name: Book 1

text: They stood across from each other and readied themselves.
Name: Book 1

text: Both tensed but neither took the low, wide stance previously used.
Name: Book 1

text: As their eyes fixed on one another, I felt myself, and Ruby beside me, lean forward in anticipation of action.
Name: Book 1

text: Both men went taut, their muscles corded, jaws clenched tight, determined stares focusing only on each other.
Name: Book 1

text: I saw nothing happen but knew there must be something, some unseen force causing them pain, draining them.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt look away but stammered to Ruby, Whats happening.
Name: Book 1

text: They are trying to overpower one another.
Name: Book 1

text: I could hear the pleasure in her voice.
Name: Book 1

text: No silly games, just power.
Name: Book 1

text: The way she said it had some part of my mind wondering whether her statement about not having her mothers ambition was true.
Name: Book 1

text: But I could only concentrate on the struggle in front of me.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to judge by appearance who might be winning.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles jaw was set, eyes dark.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed flinched, but I had no idea if it was pain or magic.
Name: Book 1

text: The only thing I was sure of was that neither intended to lose.
Name: Book 1

text: Their stances, right down to their gazes, were absolutely unwavering.
Name: Book 1

text: A sound behind me drew attention to how quiet the valley had grown as we watched this unanimated brawl.
Name: Book 1

text: And in an instant, how still.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed and Chevelle broke their stare, turning to the noisedogs, I thoughtbefore the entire world shifted into action.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby was gone, vanished from beside me, and I was whisked from my seat, catching only a glimpse of Steed and Chevelle darting past.
Name: Book 1

text: In less than a heartbeat, I was standing over the rocks in the opposite direction, Ruby before me, red curls blocking my view, arms outstretched in readiness.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed and Chevelle were at opposite angles in front of us, both tensed, even more so than they had been in their bout.
Name: Book 1

text: I peered around Rubys mane to see what they were focused on.
Name: Book 1

text: In front of our triangle, directly ahead of Ruby, stood a reedy, blond elf, draped in the long white robe and tassels of council.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt sickened as I absorbed the idea that a council memberis he a tracker.
Name: Book 1

text: had been behind me as we were all engrossed in a trivial match.
Name: Book 1

text: He was frozen, unmistakable agony distorting his features.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know which of the group were restraining him, but Anvil and Grey flanked him, Rhys and Rider a distance behind with their dogs.
Name: Book 1

text: The man seemed to be attempting to speak but couldnt get the words out.
Name: Book 1

text: His hair was so pale, robe stark in the moonlight, that I became aware of how quickly Id grown accustomed to the dark features of my new companions.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle mumbled something but I couldnt make it out.
Name: Book 1

text: My ears had begun to buzz, not the all-out siren that had crippled me before, but a constant, crackling hum.
Name: Book 1

text: I worked my jaw, tugged at the lobe of my ear.
Name: Book 1

text: The strangers lips moved, apparently able to speak again, and Anvil approached him, dwarfing the captive with his mass.
Name: Book 1

text: Anvil exhibited remarkable menace when he addressed the frozen councilman, who mouthed another reply.
Name: Book 1

text: Through ringing ears I couldnt decipher their words, but somehow I did hear the breaking bones.
Name: Book 1

text: A grotesque crunch accompanied the snapping of the councilmans thigh, and he dropped nearly to the ground.
Name: Book 1

text: Anvil leaned over him, somehow even more intimidating as he spoke directly to the man, as if they were the only two here, as if he hadnt just suffered a traumatic injury.
Name: Book 1

text: And, evidently, Anvil didnt like the answers he received, because the councilmans other leg snapped, dropping him to rest on the stumps of his broken, mangled thighs.
Name: Book 1

text: I should have turned at the sight, but I couldnt keep from wondering how it was possible he remained upright at all.
Name: Book 1

text: Anvil bent down to keep his stare close, threatening, and the broken man looked at me.
Name: Book 1

text: His glare turned accusing, his mouth suddenly moving with heated, determined words, but my ears only rang louder, engulfing all other sound.
Name: Book 1

text: I cringed, but couldnt stop myself from watching the scene play out, even as my head turned down, wanting to look away.
Name: Book 1

text: Why is he fixed on me.
Name: Book 1

text: What are they saying.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby remained protectively in front of me, her posture lowered, arms tensed tighter since the stranger turned his eyes on me.
Name: Book 1

text: His face twisted in agony as his right arm was dislocated from its socket, leaving the limb hanging limply at the shoulder.
Name: Book 1

text: I was glad I didnt hear that sound.
Name: Book 1

text: He turned back to his questioner, his mouth a grimace as the words came out, unmistakably a curse, and his other arm was wrenched from its place as well.
Name: Book 1

text: He winced, apparently not yet numb from the damages, and then his face went hard, his lips pressed together, jaw clenched tight.
Name: Book 1

text: He wasnt going to scream.
Name: Book 1

text: His back twisted and he fell, a motionless heap on the ground.
Name: Book 1

text: His body was bent out of recognition.
Name: Book 1

text: My ears had stopped ringing the moment hed hit the ground.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby relaxed and stepped away from me.
Name: Book 1

text: I wanted to catch up with what had happened but no one was talking, the mountain was silent.
Name: Book 1

text: Rhys and Rider were once again gone from sight.
Name: Book 1

text: Arent you going to perform the death ceremony.
Name: Book 1

text: I worried as the other elves began walking away.
Name: Book 1

text: Anvil spat on the mangled body.
Name: Book 1

text: I stood staring at the crumpled mass as the others gathered, arguing.
Name: Book 1

text: Its time to move, someone said.
Name: Book 1

text: And I was glad.
Name: Book 1

text: There could be more, Grey insisted.
Name: Book 1

text: That brought me back, no matter how disturbing my realization was.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle gave the bickering group an admonishing glare as he approached me.
Name: Book 1

text: I could hear the alarm in my own voice when I repeated, There are more council members coming for me.
Name: Book 1

text: He tried to calm me.
Name: Book 1

text: Frey I cut him off.
Name: Book 1

text: I wont let you all pay for my crimes.
Name: Book 1

text: Confusion passed over their faces, everyone except for Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: Something flickered in his eyes.
Name: Book 1

text: Besides, they are pursuing me.
Name: Book 1

text: For choking the tracker.
Name: Book 1

text: Grey shook his head.
Name: Book 1

text: Because of me, I argued.
Name: Book 1

text: And now youve killed one.
Name: Book 1

text: But I didnt know who had killed him.
Name: Book 1

text: Anvil had stood before the man, but any one of them could have snapped his spine.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles tone was solemn.
Name: Book 1

text: You know what they did to your mother.
Name: Book 1

text: And I could hear what he didnt say.
Name: Book 1

text: You know what theyll do to you.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt have a counter for that and he knew it.
Name: Book 1

text: He took advantage of the silence, giving orders to Ruby.
Name: Book 1

text: Take her to the house.
Name: Book 1

text: She had me at once, towing me beside her as she retrieved our cloaks.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle was still instructing, Steed, watch the front, stay inside.
Name: Book 1

text: Grey, take the rear, out of sight.
Name: Book 1

text: Anything, no matter how trivial, signal the wolves.
Name: Book 1

text: They had been wolves, not dogs.
Name: Book 1

text: I immediately had more respect for the tall, pale-haired elves.
Name: Book 1

text: Men who tamed wild wolves.
Name: Book 1

text: We were back at the house in what seemed like a heartbeat.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed watched the village from the front room.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby sat with me on her bed, the door closed.
Name: Book 1

text: This will calm you, she said.
Name: Book 1

text: A sprinkle of glitter hit my face before I had the chance to protest.
Name: Book 1

text: Just a touch, she assured me, just a touch.
Name: Book 1

text: It was too late.
Name: Book 1

text: The dust had already taken effect.
Name: Book 1

text: I relaxed onto the bed, just as Ruby did the same beside me.
Name: Book 1

text: We stared at her ceiling unspeaking for an immeasurable amount of time.
Name: Book 1

text: I rolled on my side toward her, dimly irritated shed poisoned me again.
Name: Book 1

text: Though it was much less severe this time.
Name: Book 1

text: I was simply enveloped in tranquility.
Name: Book 1

text: Her curls had tumbled back and my complaint fell short as I was distracted by her ears.
Name: Book 1

text: I reached up to feel my own ears as I considered hers.
Name: Book 1

text: I had always hidden mine behind hair, never braiding it back or putting it up to expose them.
Name: Book 1

text: Not that I could have pulled off the intricate braiding and designs of the other elves.
Name: Book 1

text: But my ears were clearly more rounded than everyone elses, almost blunt.
Name: Book 1

text: Rubys were different, too.
Name: Book 1

text: Hers were more angular though, long and almost pointed at the tip.
Name: Book 1

text: Neither of us matched the norm.
Name: Book 1

text: Hers were one extreme, mine the other.
Name: Book 1

text: She turned to look at me.
Name: Book 1

text: I remembered I was going to ask her something.
Name: Book 1

text: I said, Mm-hmm, and got lost in the hum of my reply.
Name: Book 1

text: She smiled at my satisfied trance.
Name: Book 1

text: I faded off to blackness then, though my dreams were vivid and wild.
Name: Book 1

text: I was a hawk, flying high above the mountain.
Name: Book 1

text: My wings stretched as I soared through an endless and open sky.
Name: Book 1

text: Through keen eyes I watched below, surveying a massive structure of dark stones.
Name: Book 1

text: Then I was a wolf, running through those stones, hunting, searching, protecting.
Name: Book 1

text: My muscular shoulders tensed and released with each long stride.
Name: Book 1

text: I was myself again, though strong and confident.
Name: Book 1

text: Two statuesque elves, twinned in white, glided past me.
Name: Book 1

text: Lightning struck around me, cracking the dark stones of the walls.
Name: Book 1

text: Reed of Keithar Peak stood before me and suddenly I was on a pedestal, looking down as he wagged his tongue at me.
Name: Book 1

text: I scorned him, burning a chunk of it off, and he smiled.
Name: Book 1

text: I jolted awake, the smell of burning flesh still lingering in my senses, and was staring at Rubys ceiling.
Name: Book 1

text: I was alone in her bed, but could hear an exchange of low whispers from the open door as she and Steed conversed in the front room.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt about to announce I had woken.
Name: Book 1

text: My head didnt throb as before, no sour mouth.
Name: Book 1

text: It was overall a much better experience.
Name: Book 1

text: But who could stand the dreams.
Name: Book 1

text: I rolled to my side, rubbing the sleep from my face.
Name: Book 1

text: There were a few books on the bedside table and I reached over to draw the top one near.
Name: Book 1

text: I flipped idly through the pages, until I recognized it was detailing the different aspects of magic.
Name: Book 1

text: I hurriedly scanned through, getting caught on a section marked Exchange.

text: He raised it, expertly gripping the hilt with both hands.
Name: Book 1

text: My mouth went dry, a vague part of my brain only managing a weak, Uh-oh.
Name: Book 1

text: Fear rushed through me and I wrapped my fists around the hilt of my own sword, praying I could protect myself.
Name: Book 1

text: A smile was the only warning Chevelle gave before his blade cut the air.
Name: Book 1

text: Instinct took over and I flung my arms up to block his swing with my own.
Name: Book 1

text: The metal clashed and I felt the shock vibrate through me even as the peal pulsed in my ears.
Name: Book 1

text: He struck again and I pulled the sword back, twisting to block another shot.
Name: Book 1

text: I straightened and raised it back, surprised at how powerful I felt the moment before releasing my blow.
Name: Book 1

text: I smiled as I swung at him, sure he would stop me but reveling in being attacker instead of victim.
Name: Book 1

text: He wound his blade around mine, a metallic screech filling my ears as he knocked my strike aside before coming back at me.
Name: Book 1

text: We continued, blow after blow, the repetitive clank forming a pattern in my head.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle seemed to be enjoying himself as the exercise increased in intensity.
Name: Book 1

text: I found I was as well.
Name: Book 1

text: Id taken no direct beatings like my other training and I wasnt getting as tired.
Name: Book 1

text: I could see why they used weapons.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle pushed harder, assaulting me with faster and stronger swings.
Name: Book 1

text: I was able to defend myself if I focused.
Name: Book 1

text: Murmurs of approval floated in from our audience.
Name: Book 1

text: I enjoyed that more than I probably should have.
Name: Book 1

text: I concentrated hard and began throwing a few good hits of my own in with the blocks.
Name: Book 1

text: Our swords clashed repeatedly, neither of us hitting the mark.
Name: Book 1

text: I was certain he could have, but confident I was blocking well.
Name: Book 1

text: We continued until I became winded, then Chevelle lowered his blade, smiling with approval.
Name: Book 1

text: Our audience commented on the show, and I glanced around to see it was evening already, the sun beginning to set.
Name: Book 1

text: How long have we sparred.
Name: Book 1

text: I could feel the ache in my arms now.
Name: Book 1

text: The sword hung limp at my side.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby took it from my hand.
Name: Book 1

text: Well get you fitted with a sheath.
Name: Book 1

text: I stood there, facing Chevelle, breathless but grinning.
Name: Book 1

text: He was smiling appreciatively.
Name: Book 1

text: I realized we were still being watched and sheepishly turned from him to join the group as they prepared a fire for dinner.
Name: Book 1

text: The evening was filled with stories and laughter.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles eyes fell on me often; he seemed in better spirits in general, which made me wonder again about his morning guest.
Name: Book 1

text: Rhys and Rider approached and most of the group went over to meet them.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed moved to sit beside me.
Name: Book 1

text: Very nice today, Frey, he observed.
Name: Book 1

text: I smiled and he added, You seem to be a natural.
Name: Book 1

text: Across the fire, Grey leaned over to speak in Rubys ear.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed noticed me scrutinize them, so I asked, Are they together.
Name: Book 1

text: I was confident in Greys affection, but they didnt act like a traditional pair.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed sighed as we watched them.
Name: Book 1

text: There seemed to be more to his answer.
Name: Book 1

text: I wasnt sure how to phrase it.
Name: Book 1

text: Steed glanced back at me when he spoke.
Name: Book 1

text: But you cant always have the one you want, Frey.
Name: Book 1

text: His voice was soft, yearning.
Name: Book 1

text: I could never tell if he was teasing.
Name: Book 1

text: I heard once you could die from grief.
Name: Book 1

text: He smiled at my subject change.
Name: Book 1

text: Ive seen it myself.
Name: Book 1

text: Tell me about it.
Name: Book 1

text: No, too sad.
Name: Book 1

text: He was thoughtful for a moment.
Name: Book 1

text: I worried about my father.
Name: Book 1

text: His eyes returned to me.
Name: Book 1

text: After my mother died.
Name: Book 1

text: Sometimes Im grateful for the fire witchs seduction.
Name: Book 1

text: He was grieving so hard.
Name: Book 1

text: His expression lost all trace of its usual cockiness as he brought back the memory.
Name: Book 1

text: Her enchantments numbed him.
Name: Book 1

text: Then, when he woke from them, the tragedy gave him purpose.
Name: Book 1

text: A shadow of his smile returned as he looked away.
Name: Book 1

text: The irony is her tragedy gave root to the idea Frey.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle was suddenly standing between us.
Name: Book 1

text: I gaped up at him, the trance of Steeds words broken.
Name: Book 1

text: Huh.
Name: Book 1

text: Time to go.
Name: Book 1

text: There was anger in his voice.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know what I had done, but I stood obediently.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle pulled me away from Steed.
Name: Book 1

text: Ill take her, Ruby offered.
Name: Book 1

text: Ill do it myself.
Name: Book 1

text: A lot of anger.
Name: Book 1

text: Well both go, she pushed, forcing a polite tone.
Name: Book 1

text: The rest of the group was quiet, watching us, and Ruby eyed Steed as we turned and headed toward the house.
Name: Book 1

text: As soon as we were out of earshot, though I was still being dragged by the arm, I asked Chevelle, Did something happen with the twins.
Name: Book 1

text: We both stared at her.
Name: Book 1

text: Right, well, you know what I mean, I said, embarrassed.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby chimed in, It is fine, and I was knew it was intended for him.
Name: Book 1

text: He relaxed his grip on my arm and slowed our pace as he directed an almost imperceptible nod at Ruby.
Name: Book 1

text: I relaxed, too; fine being better than anything Id thought in a long while.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle stayed in the front room that night, watching through the small windows.
Name: Book 1

text: When I closed my eyes, I could see the glint of swords making patterns as they crossed again and again.
Name: Book 1

text: Rubys hummed tune was sad, the sound drifting through the walls between us as I fell into an easy sleep.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle and Rubys voices, low and confrontational, woke me.
Name: Book 1

text: I rubbed my tired arms as I rose to join them in the front room.
Name: Book 1

text: I asked, though I could tell by their exchange theyd been arguing.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby grinned at me.
Name: Book 1

text: Just planning for the trip.
Name: Book 1

text: Trip.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, you know, to the peak.
Name: Book 1

text: I decided Id let them work it out, heading instead to Rubys room.
Name: Book 1

text: Im going to take a bath.
Name: Book 1

text: As I closed the door, Ruby said, Its time to tell her.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt hear a response.
Name: Book 1

text: I was soaking in hot water, my eyes closed, not even considering getting out when she knocked on the door.
Name: Book 1

text: How did you know it was me.
Name: Book 1

text: No one else is that annoying.
Name: Book 1

text: Can I come in.
Name: Book 1

text: No.
Name: Book 1

text: The water streamed from the tub and out the back window.
Name: Book 1

text: Fine, Im getting dressed.
Name: Book 1

text: I dried off, gathering clothes from a pile I assumed was for me, too large for Rubys petite frame.
Name: Book 1

text: I opened the door and knew right away I would regret whatever they were about to tell me.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby commanded me to sit.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle straightened, clearing his throat.
Name: Book 1

text: Frey, we need to talk with you about something.
Name: Book 1

text: I waited, and he proceeded carefully, You know you are bound.
Name: Book 1

text: Yes, I agreed, even though I wasnt clear how I was partially bound.
Name: Book 1

text: I could use some magic, I had lost some memories.
Name: Book 1

text: No, that isnt true, is it.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt really remember anything from before the village.
Name: Book 1

text: Anything except the dreams.
Name: Book 1

text: And Im sure you want to be unbound.
Name: Book 1

text: Why is that a question.
Name: Book 1

text: He nodded as if he were going down a checklist.
Name: Book 1

text: We know council has bound you.
Name: Book 1

text: I waited for the next detail, my fingers curling into my palms.
Name: Book 1

text: And we know they must be the one or ones to unbind you.
Name: Book 1

text: Some part of me realized the seriousness of the conversation, but all I could do was listen.
Name: Book 1

text: They are, obviously unwilling.
Name: Book 1

text: The breath I drew was too sharp.
Name: Book 1

text: I know some about the binding.
Name: Book 1

text: When he stopped, I said, All right.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know what he was getting at.
Name: Book 1

text: The problem is meddling with the bindings, meddling with your mind is well, its dangerous.
Name: Book 1

text: And there it was.
Name: Book 1

text: They let me consider that for a moment.
Name: Book 1

text: They were being careful with me, didnt want to upset me.
Name: Book 1

text: I tried to ease them.
Name: Book 1

text: So we go back to the village and.
Name: Book 1

text: They shared an uncomfortable glance, and then, Not High Council, Freya.
Name: Book 1

text: The ones who were trying to capture me.
Name: Book 1

text: The ones who want to burn me.
Name: Book 1

text: Their cautious demeanor made more sense now.
Name: Book 1

text: The council had sent trackersthe pair Chevelle had choked and released, and the other, the broken, limp corpse in the clearing by the ridge.
Name: Book 1

text: We had killed him.
Name: Book 1

text: And they were worried about my stupid binding.
Name: Book 1

text: The circling cloaks from my dreams were back, filling my head.
Name: Book 1

text: My thoughts were twisting, getting out of control.
Name: Book 1

text: Theyd be hunting us all down now.
Name: Book 1

text: They would kill us.
Name: Book 1

text: That was why I needed training.
Name: Book 1

text: Because they intended to kill me, not capture.
Name: Book 1

text: They intended to kill us all.
Name: Book 1

text: And without magic, bound as I was, I didnt stand a chance.
Name: Book 1

text: My anxiety must have shown; Ruby shifted her jaw.
Name: Book 1

text: I held up a hand up to stop her.
Name: Book 1

text: Lets just get back.
Name: Book 1

text: They didnt argue, though they were plainly concerned.
Name: Book 1

text: We went to the ridge with the others, but we didnt train.
Name: Book 1

text: In fact, I was fairly certain Ruby and Chevelle were avoiding me.
Name: Book 1

text: I waited through the morning and finallyaround middayI gave up and relaxed onto the ground, staring up at the sky.
Name: Book 1

text: The earth beneath me was warm, the sun shining bright.
Name: Book 1

text: I watched as a bird flew high overhead.
Name: Book 1

text: It was gliding, slow and steady on the wind.
Name: Book 1

text: As I shielded my eyes with a hand, I noticed the ink on my wrist and smiled.
Name: Book 1

text: I suddenly knew the soaring creature above was a hawk.
Name: Book 1

text: I closed my eyes and relaxed my arm at my side, imagining flying.
Name: Book 1

text: I breathed deep and conjured the image it would see, looking down on us.
Name: Book 1

text: The picture was sharp, even at this distance, but the colors werent as clear, and the outlying shapes not as defined.
Name: Book 1

text: I laughed at myself for adding that detail to my daydream, imagining a bird seeing differently.
Name: Book 1

text: My vision sailed over us, past the ridge, south.
Name: Book 1

text: I imagined seeing the twins, perched in two trees, watching.
Name: Book 1

text: Hardwood bows rested high on their backs.
Name: Book 1

text: The wolves were mostly concealed on the ground, vigilant.
Name: Book 1

text: One glanced up at me, at the bird.
Name: Book 1

text: Someone approaching, robe and tassels blowing in the cool breeze.
Name: Book 1

text: The second wolf looked forward.
Name: Book 1

text: He saw it, too, and abruptly pointed, calling out.
Name: Book 1

text: But the howl echoed in my own ears, not my imagination, and I jolted upright.
Name: Book 1

text: The field was in motion, rushing in response to the warning.
Name: Book 1

text: In seconds, they were set again, the same protective positions they had taken the last time.
Name: Book 1

text: The last time a tracker had found us.
Name: Book 1

text: It was all I could do to steady myself as the councilman was brought forward, because he was the same one from my vision.
Name: Book 1

text: I was in shock as he knelt, not under his own power, and was frozen there before us.
Name: Book 1

text: How could I have seen him.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle mumbled something and my ears began to ring, distracting me from bewilderment.
Name: Book 1

text: It was only a few stuttered heartbeats before recognition came.
Name: Book 1

text: All eyes turned to me, but I glared at Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: My ears ceased ringing, my hearing cleared.
Name: Book 1

text: I stepped forward, the rage still fuming.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt like a fool for not realizing before.
Name: Book 1

text: He had been the cause of my hearing issues, and he was the one holding the tracker there.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle had bound the man from magic for questioning.
Name: Book 1

text: He had studied it, said he knew something about it.
Name: Book 1

text: I was furious, so much so that I forgot my own situation.
Name: Book 1

text: I approached the kneeling tracker, daring anyone to stop me.
Name: Book 1

text: Tell me what you know about binding.
Name: Book 1

text: He didnt answer, his jaw tight in defiance.
Name: Book 1

text: The sword sat in my newly acquired sheath and I drew it out, taking a peculiar sort of delight in the ssshk that sounded when the steel passed through.
Name: Book 1

text: The others watched me, silent and wary, but the tracker smirked.
Name: Book 1

text: He wasnt afraid of a sword.
Name: Book 1

text: The last tracker hadnt given at broken bones, not even before the threat of certain death.
Name: Book 1

text: Id need something dreadful, a new tactic to convince him.
Name: Book 1

text: A tiny snake sunning on a nearby rock caught my eye and I smiled.
Name: Book 1

text: Some part of me knew what had happened before, had felt it.
Name: Book 1

text: I could do it again.
Name: Book 1

text: I slipped the tip of the sword down to the trackers leg, just above where his knee met the ground, and sliced his trousers up to the thigh to reveal bare skin.
Name: Book 1

text: Drawing the snake close with magic, I took it in my hand, its thin green body writhing over my left palm, the sword grasped in my right.
Name: Book 1

text: The prisoner watched me, almost smug.
Name: Book 1

text: It was a small snake, its white belly confirming it was nonvenomous, its frame no thicker than my pinkie, but it would do.
Name: Book 1

text: I slid the tip of the sword across the skin above the mans knee, making a narrow incision.
Name: Book 1

text: His expression did change then, giving way to uncertainty.
Name: Book 1

text: I smiled at him as the sword tip rested against his leg.
Name: Book 1

text: In measured movements, I placed the snake on the base of the blade, letting it slide toward its mark.
Name: Book 1

text: I closed my eyes to relax, settle into the snake as I had the bird.
Name: Book 1

text: My knees buckled as I released too much and I had to back off, giving myself just enough to control it.
Name: Book 1

text: As it entered the wound, the tracker gasped and my smile stretched wickedly.
Name: Book 1

text: I wormed my way blindly up his leg, intent on getting the information I needed.
Name: Book 1

text: Theyve found us a third time now.
Name: Book 1

text: I wanted to free my mind, free my bonds.
Name: Book 1

text: They wont take me.
Name: Book 1

text: Something about that last thought didnt seem right, like it wasnt mine, but I couldnt follow it.
Name: Book 1

text: The tracker screamed; it had reached his thigh.
Name: Book 1

text: My eyes flicked open.
Name: Book 1

text: The body of the snake made a lump under the skin of the trackers leg.
Name: Book 1

text: His face was contorted in agony, but that wasnt what had done it.
Name: Book 1

text: It was the fear.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelle released the trackers hand long enough for the man to scribble a few words of a spell, not allowing him to speak or cast magic.
Name: Book 1

text: He slumped after his surrender, confident the worst was over.
Name: Book 1

text: I reached the sword tip back to his leg and made another incision to release the snake.
Name: Book 1

text: It jerked and coiled free of the wound, flicking blood over the trackers pristine white robe.
Name: Book 1

text: Behind me, a low voice ordered, Kill him.
Name: Book 1

text: I glanced down at the sword, still in my hand.
Name: Book 1

text: The sword I was supposed to take someones head off with.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt know who the order had been intended for, but it wasnt me.
Name: Book 1

text: This man was going to die.
Name: Book 1

text: I knew he didnt have more than a moment before their magic broke him.
Name: Book 1

text: They would take his life because he was after us.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt hesitate, just pulled my arm up and swung hard, backhand.
Name: Book 1

text: The blade cut clean and his head rolled backward, hitting the ground with a sickening thud.
Name: Book 1

text: The others stared at me.
Name: Book 1

text: I couldnt blame them.
Name: Book 1

text: Steeds voice was low, wary.
Name: Book 1

text: He didnt mean you, Frey.
Name: Book 1

text: I turned, unable to stand the bloody vision in my peripheral.
Name: Book 1

text: The trackers words waited in Chevelles hand.
Name: Book 1

text: Okay, I said, feeling slightly detached from myself.
Name: Book 1

text: Chevelles disbelief was more than evident as he shot back, No.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby spoke up.
Name: Book 1

text: It could be a trick.
Name: Book 1

text: Hell need to try it on someone else first.
Name: Book 1

text: Who else was bound.
Name: Book 1

text: She could see I was prepared to argue.
Name: Book 1

text: It isnt safe.
Name: Book 1

text: And if it doesnt work.
Name: Book 1

text: I remembered the story of her father then, how hed been released after the fairys death.
Name: Book 1

text: If the council member who bound me dies, then will I be released.
Name: Book 1

text: He plainly regretted what hed divulged that morning, but something else rested just below his reluctance.
Name: Book 1

text: Something that burned beneath my skin.
Name: Book 1

text: He answered, Yes.
Name: Book 1

text: Then we kill them.
Name: Book 1

text: And if we dont know which ones.
Name: Book 1

text: We kill them all.
Name: Book 1

text: I glanced around the clearing as the others watched me.
Name: Book 1

text: The atmosphere had changed, and I realized only then the uncertainty Id grown to expect.
Name: Book 1

text: A movement at the tree line caught everyones attention, and I turned to find Chevelles onetime guest, Asher.
Name: Book 1

text: He stood in the shadows, staff in hand, as if allowing us to see.
Name: Book 1

text: The air was still as he inclined his head toward Chevelle and then turned, a long, dark braid whipping behind him as he disappeared into the brush.
Name: Book 1

text: This seemed to mean something to the group, something like relief.
Name: Book 1

text: I stared after him, but Anvil stepped forward, thumping his balled fist against his chest in a gesture I didnt understand.
Name: Book 1

text: Grey followed, repeating the action and adding a single nod, and Ruby clasped her hands, bouncing excitedly from heel to toe.
Name: Book 1

text: I felt myself drawing back together, tied by the knots in my stomach and mind.
Name: Book 1

text: A tandem wolf howl sounded in the distance.
Name: Book 1

text: My stomach swam in unease.
Name: Book 1

text: The councilmans body was disposed of, and the group bustled around the clearing.
Name: Book 1

text: I slid my sword into its sheath, careful not to touch the blade.
Name: Book 1

text: I hadnt comprehended what the flourish of activity meant until Ruby grabbed my arm to conduct me.
Name: Book 1

text: Come on, we have to pack.
Name: Book 1

text: She dragged me along as she rushed back to her house.
Name: Book 1

text: She threw things around her room, sorting and gathering.
Name: Book 1

text: I didnt really have anything to assemble.
Name: Book 1

text: There was only the pack Id acquired months ago, nothing in it but that stupid white dress and the pouch.
Name: Book 1

text: I hurried from the room, explaining to Ruby I would be getting ready for the trip.
Name: Book 1

text: I already put your pack in the front room for Chevelle.
Name: Book 1

text: Ill just check it, I said.
Name: Book 1

text: I found the pack with some of Chevelles things.
Name: Book 1

text: As I started to open it, I knocked one of his bags over and went to pick it up.
Name: Book 1

text: The flap was loose and a piece of familiar fabric hung out.
Name: Book 1

text: I glanced over my shoulder to be sure Ruby wasnt watching, and opened the bag to find the fabric-wrapped package shed handed to Chevelle our first day here.
Name: Book 1

text: The package hed traded my stone for.
Name: Book 1

text: I pulled the material back to reveal a leather-bound book.
Name: Book 1

text: Afraid Ruby would catch me, I slid the book into my own pack and took it to my room.
Name: Book 1

text: Id already been in trouble for stealing one book but this was technically mine.
Name: Book 1

text: It had been swapped for my ruby.
Name: Book 1

text: I was careful anyway, pretending to lie down and placing the book where I could quickly cover it if I were caught.
Name: Book 1

text: I ran my fingers over the dark leather cover, tracing the scripted V etched there.
Name: Book 1

text: The first pages had been torn from the bindings so I flipped through, finding several more damaged sections, some torn, some by water.
Name: Book 1

text: Wasnt that the way of things.
Name: Book 1

text: I returned to the first page to read.
Name: Book 1

text: Today was the solstice celebration for the fairies.
Name: Book 1

text: They are such fools.
Name: Book 1

text: They got hopped up on dust and raided the castle.
Name: Book 1

text: We had to kill about six of them before they sobered up enough to reason with.
Name: Book 1

text: That was before Father killed two more just for fun.
Name: Book 1

text: He said he had to prove a point, but I could tell he enjoyed it.
Name: Book 1

text: I straightened and blinked.
Name: Book 1

text: I shook my head and continued.
Name: Book 1

text: My stupid sister was mad because he didnt let her help.
Name: Book 1

text: She started to throw a tantrum and he stiffened her tongue.
Name: Book 1

text: It was stuck like that for hours.
Name: Book 1

text: I laughed so hard I kept having to wipe the tears from my eyes.
Name: Book 1

text: She tried to yell at me and it came out, Thut uhp.
Name: Book 1

text: Which made me laugh harder, and she got so mad she screamed and busted a bunch of glass.
Name: Book 1

text: I kept reading, enthralled.
Name: Book 1

text: It seemed to be a journal, written by a girl, but I had no idea who.
Name: Book 1

text: Why would he have a young girls diary.
Name: Book 1

text: It was filled with pointless stories as far as I could tell, but after a few pages the writing matured and it seemed to jump several years.
Name: Book 1

text: I wished it was dated.
Name: Book 1

text: I tire so easily of the formalities here.
Name: Book 1

text: The only thing I have to look forward to are the few breaks I get to go out on my own, into the pines.
Name: Book 1

text: Father has increased my work periods to every other day.
Name: Book 1

text: Combined with my other duties, I am stationed in the castle almost all week.
Name: Book 1

text: The magic practice exhausts me or I would sneak out at night, the way I enjoyed as a child.
Name: Book 1

text: It doesnt seem fair.
Name: Book 1

text: My sister is practically ignored.
Name: Book 1

text: Father clearly prefers me, but sometimes I wonder if that is really better.
Name: Book 1

text: She wanders idly around the castle, no practice, no duties, no formal gatherings.
Name: Book 1

text: Magic practice, castles, who was this girl.
Name: Book 1

text: I read the entries for hours.
Name: Book 1

text: Ruby must have thought I was sleeping.
Name: Book 1

text: I had no idea what in this journal could be of interest to Chevelle unless he knew the woman, and that kept me reading.
Name: Book 1

text: It continued onher fathers rigorous schedule, their distaste for her sisterand then the entries got more detailed and frequent.
Name: Book 1

text: Mother has been too ill lately for guests.
Name: Book 1

text: I have not been able to see her.
Name: Book 1

text: The tedium of my duties is getting to me and Father has been relentless with my studies, pushing me harder and harder to strengthen my control.
Name: Book 1

text: My sister has been exploring the mountains.
Name: Book 1

text: I see her bring in all sorts of interesting finds, but she refuses to tell me where she got them.
Name: Book 1

text: I wish there were a way to sneak out.
Name: Book 1

text: I would follow her or force her to show me, but Father is keeping a close eye on me, making certain I stick to a strict schedule.
Name: Book 1

text: This morning he brought in a detailed list for Rune, giving him direction through a series of tasks.
Name: Book 1

text: Rune is supposed to grade me on them, see which I excel most at so they can pick a specific field to concentrate on.
Name: Book 1

text: I dont know how extensive it was, but I saw wind, water, growth, transfer, fire, and foresight written as it passed between them.
Name: Book 1

text: We had already done months of fire.
Name: Book 1

text: Pass it through water, see how large a flame I can create, see how hot I can go, test me on this, test me on that.
Name: Book 1

text: And now he asks Rune to test me in the impossible, to see the future.
Name: Book 1

text: He expects too much.
Name: Book 1

text: Merely because I am different.
Name: Book 1

text: My sister is different, too.
Name: Book 1

text: But she never has to practice.
Name: Book 1

text: He doesnt expect her to stay in the castle, not even when we have guests.
Name: Book 1

text: No doubt he prefers her not be seen then, embarrassed by her light hair and features.
Name: Book 1

text: I wish I were as strong as he hoped.
Name: Book 1

text: I could do what I wanted then.
Name: Book 1

text: ~ I attempted slipping in to see Mother this morning, but the doors were protected.
Name: Book 1

text: Father found me trying to break though and sent me directly to Rune for practice.

text: I remember most of it, though I cant recall the tone of her writings, whether she was happy in the beginning.

text: I yearned to retreat into the horse, run from the agony, but the severity of it tore me back and kept me there in my own head.

text: It felt and sounded like metal bands inside my mind, inside my ears, screeching.

text: I hadnt opened my eyes again and now I couldnt.

text: Freya is growing and strong.
